loans.use: To purchase flour, milk, sugar, and other ingredients

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 32 years old and lives in South Poblacion, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is a single mother of two children. Joy has managed an Internet cafe business for six years.  At present, Joy's estimated monthly business income is PHP 8,000. She is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to  purchase additional computer units for her business. Joy has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative since May 31, 2012. In the future, Joy dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional computer units for her business

loans.name: Yimi Omar

texts.es:
Yimi de 20 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su familia en Taulabe, Comayagua
Yimi a su corta edad  realiza actividades de cultivo de café con su familia, es un muchacho  muy trabajador. Hace 2 años se independizo y  tiene cultivado 1 manzana de café, de la cual saca producción de café pergamino húmedo y lo vende en el mercado local, pero muchas veces llegan los compradores hasta su casa. Esta motivado con el cultivo ya que este producto tiene gran demanda y va obtener buenas ganancias. 
Ha  solicitado este préstamo de L.6, 000.00 para invertir en compra de fertilizante para mejorar su finca, y así sacar una mejor cosecha para la venta.
 Su plan es mejorar la producción y seguir obteniendo ganancias.
texts.en:
Yimi, 20, is single living with his family in Taulabe, Comayagua.  At his young age, Yimi is growing coffee with his family; he’s a very hardworking young man.  He became independent two years ago and has one manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] planted with coffee that he harvests as damp parchment and sells in the local market although often buyers come all the way to his house.  He’s motivated by the crop because it’s in high demand and he will earn good profits.

He’s asking for a 6,000 lempira loan to buy fertilizer to improve his farm and obtain a better harvest to sell.  His plan is to improve production and to continue earning profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Dialegne N°7 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Takku liggey dialegne n°7" se compose de cinq femmes toutes mariées.Elles vendent chacune des produits alimentaires dans le marché situé dans  un grand quartier de la ville.La plupart d'entre elles passent la journée dans le marché.Elles reviennent le soir  fatiguées mais se consolent souvent par les modestes revenus obtenus.Ces revenus leur permettent de prendre en charge certains  de leurs besoins et ceux de leurs enfants.Le chef de groupe (au milieu avec la main levée) est mère de trois enfants dont les deux vont à l'école.Le groupe sollicite un pret de 250000f pour renforcer les fonds de commerce de ses membres en achetant des produits alimentaires divers.
texts.en: The group, "Takku liggey dialegne n°7," has five women members who are all married. Each of them sells food items at the main market in the city. Most of them spend the entire day at the market. They return home tired, but find consolation in their modest revenues. These revenues have helped them take care of some of their needs and their children's needs. The leader of the group (in the middle with her hand raised) has three children with two of them in school. The group is requesting a 250,000 cfa francs loan to strengthen their business buy purchasing basic food items for resale.

loans.use: to purchase basic food items.

loans.name: Lily

texts.es:
Lily es soltera y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en casa de sus padres ocupando  una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Alpacoma de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como enfermera en un hospital privado por más de diez horas y a veces cubre turnos toda la noche y con lo que gana debe pagar los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia ya que es la única que cubre todos los gastos,  es por eso que solicita crédito para la refacción de su habitación ya que se encuentra muy deteriorada y desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Lily, es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse para tener más comodidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Lily is single and has a child who is of school age. She lives at her parents' house where she occupies one room. The house is located in the District of Alpacoma in the city of La Paz.

Lily currently works as a nurse at a private hospital for more than 12 hours, but sometimes she has to cover the overnight shift. With the salary she earns, Lily is able to pay for expenses such as food, education, and basic services for her family. This is the only source of income that she has to cover all of her expenses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can repair her room which has greatly deteriorated. She wants to improve her quality of life.

Lily dreams of improving her income and becoming independent so that she can be more comfortable. This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to repair her room.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca Rosa, de 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, vive en una colonia que pertenece al sector López Arellano del municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Ella tiene nueve años de tener un pequeño taller de confección de ropa, como camisetas, blusas, pijamas y pantimedias. Confecciona ropa y la vende. Ella adquirió experiencia donde trabajaba anteriormente. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en un local en el mercado. Solicita un préstamo de 5,000 Lempiras para comprar materiales como telas, hilos, agujas, botones, broches etc. Tiene como meta llegar a tener varios negocios para mejorar su casa y ayudar a que sus hijos se gradúen.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa, 31, is a single mother; she has three children.  She lives in a neighborhood belonging to the López Arellano sector in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.

She’s had a small clothes-making workshop for the last nine years; she makes shirts, blouses, pajamas and pantyhose.  She makes clothes and sells them.  She acquired her experience in her previous job.  Her business is located in a stand in the local market.

She’s asking for a 5,000 lempira loan to buy supplies like fabric, thread, needles, buttons, clasps, etc.  Her goals is to have several business in order to do some home improvements and to help her children graduate.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Hernan

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijas, y vive con su familia en la Colonia Lopez Arellano, de Choloma, Cortes.
Don Carlos tiene una actividad la cual es la que le da los recursos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es un puesto de cafetería, en donde vende variedad de alimentos como  almuerzos, cenas, golosinas, arroz chino, variedad de repostería y refrescos. Lleva 12 años trabajando al lado de su esposa la cual le ayuda en el negocio. Este negocio le ha sido muy rentable y es su fuente de ingresos.
El ha solicitado a odef un préstamo de 16000 lempiras para comprar productos como verduras, carnes, refrescos,  granos, condimentos, etc. Para tener los materiales necesarios para elaborar los alimentos y dar un buen servicio a los clientes.
En el futuro su meta es establecer otro negocio en otro sector dela ciudad, y poder crecer mas.
texts.en:
Carlos, 38, is married and has two daughters.  He lives with his family in the López Arellano neighborhood in Choloma, Cortes.

Carlos’ source of family income is a café where he sells a variety of food like lunches, dinners, snacks, Chinese-style fried rice, an assortment of pastries and soft-drinks.  He’s been working alongside his wife for 12 years; she helps him with the café.  The business has been very profitable and it’s his source of income.

He asked ODEF for a 16,000 lempira loan to buy products like vegetables, meats, soft-drinks, grains, condiments, etc. to have the necessary ingredients on hand to prepare the food and provide good customers service.  His future goal is to open another business in a different part of the city and to be able to grow more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Erenia

texts.es:
Doña Maria tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con un hijo en una colonia periférica de la ciudad de San Pedro Sula. 
Doña Maria tiene un negocio de pulperia, este negocio lo estableció hace 2 años. y vende productos de la canasta básica familiar y productos de abarroteria entre otros. atiende todo el día a sus clientes.
Ha solicitado un préstamo con Odef de 10,000 lempiras porque necesita invertir en el negocio abastenciendose de productos como carnes,de pollo, de cerdo y res. Esta compra le ayudara a satisfacer la demanda de los clientes.
Su meta es que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
María, 53, is a single mother.  She lives with her son in an outlying neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  She has a grocery store that she opened two years ago.  She sells basic staple items and groceries among others.  She tends to customers all day.

She’s asked ODEF for a 10,000 lempira loan she needs in order to invest in the store.  She will stock up on items like chicken, beef and pork.  This purchase will help her meet customer demand.  Her goal is that her business makes progress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: Cesar, tiene 52 años de edad, está casado, tiene 3 hijos, y vive en el municipio de San Manuel, Cortes. Don cesar se dedica a comprar y vender todo tipo de chatarra, vehículos viejos en mal estado, maquinaria y equipos viejos. El tiene 12 años de haber emprendido este negocio, compra piezas o los vehículos en mal estado y los vende por libras en las fábricas que se dedican a reciclar hierro, aluminio y otros metales. Anteriormente se dedicaba a realizar trabajos de mecánica pero los ingresos no eran suficientes. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar materiales de chatarra para la venta, la cual le ayudara a incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos. Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio y consolidarlo, para mejorar su calidad de vida. Agradece a ODEF y a KIVA por la oportunidad de financiamiento.
texts.en:
Cesar is 52 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in the town of San Manuel, Cortes.

Don Cesar buys and sells all types of scrap metal, old vehicles in bad condition, machinery, and old equipment. He started this business 12 years ago. Cesar buys parts or vehicles in bad condition and then sells these items by the pound to factories that recycle iron, aluminum, and other metals. He previously worked as a mechanic, but the income was not enough.

Cesar is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL so that he can buy scrap materials to sell. This will help to increase his sales and his income. His goal is to continue growing his business and consolidate it so that he can improve his quality of life. He thanks ODEF and Kiva for this opportunity to receive financing.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal that he can resell.

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik lives in Kapan town with her husband and son. The family is involved in beekeeping and currently keeps 21 colonies of bees. 

Nazik would like to increase the number of bee hives, for which she needs sufficient funds. She has applied for this loan to purchase colonies of bees and bee hives. This will allow Nazik to gather and sell more honey and increase her income. 

Nazik dreams of her son being able to start a family and provide stable income for them. Development of beekeeping is important if Nazik and her son are to reach this goal.

loans.use: to buy more bee colonies and bee hives and produce more honey.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba Luz, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el sector suburbano de San Pedro Sula.
La señora Alba, tiene su propio negocio desde hace 3 años, vendiendo ropa de segunda mano. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa de habitación y los clientes son los vecinos de sus alrededores. Este tipo de ropa tiene demanda ya que está al alcance de la economía de los clientes. Ella quiere surtir más el negocio y mantenerlo con variedad de ropa para incrementar las ventas, y para eso solicita el préstamo que es por 8,000 Lempiras, piensa comprar los fardos que traen ropa clasificada en mejor estado. Su plan es seguir creciendo con el negocio para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y llegar a tener una tienda surtida.
texts.en:
Alba Luz is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in a suburban section of San Pedro Sula.

Sra. Alba has her own business that she started three years ago. She sells secondhand clothing. This business is established in her home and her customers include neighbors from the surrounding areas. The type of clothing that she sells is in demand since these products are affordable for her customers. She wants restock her business with more inventory and maintain a variety of clothes to increase her sales.

For this reason, Alba is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL. She plans to buy bundles of clothing that are considered to be in better condition. Her plan is to continue growing her business so that she can improve her family’s standard of living and to have a shop that is fully stocked.

loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
El Sr. Natividad es de la ciudad de Pilar, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día.
Cuenta que tiene una carpintería en la que trabaja desde hace más de 8 años, y cuenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan.
Su deseo es poder seguir ampliando su negocio y también poder ayudar a otras personas con fuentes de trabajo, que desean progresar al igual que el.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de madera, porque tiene pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Natividad is from the city of Pilar. He is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person who works every day starting early in the morning.

He says that he has a carpentry shop in which he has worked for more than 8 years. He says that through his work he helps his family and gives them everything they need.

His desire is to be able to continue expanding his business and to also be able to help other people who want to progress just like him with a source of work. 

He is asking for the loan to buy wood because he has orders that he would like to fill. He is thankful for the opportunity that he is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various goods such as: biscuits, sugar, soap, lotions etc for resale.

loans.name: Hermosa

texts.en:
Hermosa is married with six children. Hermosa is 63 years old and lives in Villa M. Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Hermosa sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Hermosa has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Hermosa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

location.town: Liloy-Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Beth Joan

texts.en:
Beth Joan is 20 years and single.  She is a resident of Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor.  

She has been an active member of PMPC since February 2012 and has now requested a loan for the second time.  She wants to increase the capital for her gasoline business, which she started six months ago because she wants to help her parents in generating income for the family.

loans.use: additional capital for her gasoline business.

loans.name: Nestor Filomeno

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Nestor, él pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú. Nuestro socio es odontólogo y sigue con su actividad profesional, la cual le ha traído muchas satisfacciones y con ella ha podido ofrecer mejor educación a su hijo y bienestar a su familia. Precisamente para mejorar su actividad, nuestro socio  invertirá su préstamo para implementar su consultorio dental y comprar material odontológico.
Nestor agradece a  KIVA por permitirle ayudarlo con su actividad profesional y por apoyarlo con la educación y el desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en: This is Nestor, a member of communal bank "Tercer Milenio" ("Third Millenium") of the province of Urumbamba del Cusco in Peru. He is an odontologist and continues to exerce his profession, which has brought him many satisfactions, among which being able to offer his son a better education and his family a good standard of living. It is precisely to improve his activity that he asks for this loan, which he will invest in his own dental practice and use to buy odontology supplies. Nestor thanks Kiva for the help it brings to his professional activity, helping him thus with his family's education and development.

loans.use: to buy odontology supplies.

loans.name: Razmik

texts.en:
Razmik is involved in agriculture. He breeds cows and chickens and grows different fruit trees. Razmik would like to start beekeeping, for which he has applied for this loan to purchase colonies of bees. In addition, he wants to purchase one more cow and grass to feed the cattle. This loan will help Razmik to implement these goals, which means increased income for him.

Razmik lives with his wife and two daughters: 4-year-old Ani and 5-year-old Nane. Agriculture is the main source of income for the family, so with its development, Razmik will be able to provide better living conditions for them.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, grass and colonies of bees

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 31 years old and married. He sells clothes for men and women. He has one year of experience in this work and he currently employs one person to help him. He works from 8 am to 6 pm every day of the week except on Sunday. 

Fabien has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more second hand clothes for men and women for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa es de la ciudad de Pilar, es dueña de una pequeña empresa comercial, y nos cuenta que está en el ramo hace más de 20 años vende prendas de todo tipo y dice que le va muy bien.
Está acompañada, y tiene dos hijas aun pequeñas, por quienes lucha, para poder darles todo lo que necesitan para un mejor estilo de vida y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
Teresa pide la ayuda de Kiva y fundación paraguaya para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el tiempo de frío y quiere poder surtirse y de esa forma tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teresa is from the city of Pilar.  She is the owner of a small business and she tells us that she has been in this business of selling all types of clothing for more than 20 years. She says she is doing very well.  She lives with her spouse and two young daughters. She works hard to provide them with all that is necessary for a better life so that they will not be deprived of anything.

Teresa has requested the support of Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya to buy winter clothes, since the colder season is approaching and she wants to be able to stock up and offer her customers a broad range of clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa is 29 years old and has four children. She has one year of experience running her own green grocery store; before she was only responsible for taking care of the home. The products that she needs for her store she buys in the municipal market and sells in her rural home. The loan she is asking for from Yehu is to purchase onions, tomatoes, and some vegetables, so as to increase her store's stock. She has the objective of increasing sales, which will allow her to improve her standard of living (food, health, clothing). With the earnings from her business, she will try to pay for her children's schooling, so that they can continue with their education, and also to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, and some vegetables

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is proud to raise his five children who are all in school. He is married to Lucy, a businesswoman, and they have been sharing ideas on how they can move forward. Elias has been operating a clothing sales business for one year and has already established a good customer base. He sells a variety of clothing at the market ranging from children’s to men’s and women’s clothing. 

Elias’ customers have requested more clothing styles and he does not want to let them down; therefore, he is planning to increase his available inventory to offer his customers. Because Elias lacks sufficient capital to increase his inventory, he has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jipe Moyo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kyakimwa est Secrétaire du le groupement  d’affaire Jipe Moyo, elle est âgée de 37 ans, femme vivant seule (sans aucun mari) ,  et mère de 4 jeunes enfants qui étudient tous.  La cliente est vendeuse de Jus Madrakwa à son  domicile. Elle commença son entreprise avec son fonds propre reçu de son petit ami et connaissances. Plus tard, elle sollicita le soutien de l’IMF Hekima. Grace aux crédits, elle a réalisé des investissements modestes (achat parcelle, chaises, armoires, etc.). Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 3 sacs de maïs, qui lui servent des matières premières de production jus Madrakwa. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes.
texts.en:
Kyakimwa, a client of MFI Hekima and Secretary of the business group called Jipe Moyo, is 37 years old and is a woman living alone (without a husband) and the mother of four young children who are all enrolled in school. She sells "Madrakwa" juice out of her home. She began her business with her own funds that she received from her boyfriend and her acquaintances. 

Later on, she requested help from MFI Hekima. Thanks to loans, she has managed modest investments (buying a plot of land, chairs, cupboards, etc.) This new loan should allow her to buy three sacks of maize which she will use as an ingredient for producing "Madrakwa" juice. She thanks Hekima for their support and for helping small-scale female entrepreneurs to become independent.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of maize

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
La socia Maria Antonia tiene 20 años y es soltera, ella vive en la ciudad de Huambutio y pertenece al banco Comunal “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella trabaja en una entidad pública en el área de contabilidad pero en sus horas libres se dedica a la elaboración de tejas y ladrillos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal para pagar sus matriculas, educación y alimentación. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member Maria Antonia is 20 years old and single.  She lives in the city of Huambutio and belongs to the communal bank Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio, which is part of the Asociación Arariwa.  

This membership has been going very well for her, thanks to puntual payments of her loans. 

She works in a public entity in accounting but during her free time she makes tiles and bricks.  For this opportunity she needs a loan for personal use to pay for enrollment, classes and food.  She is grateful for the loan and she is committed to paying it according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to pay for school enrollment, classes and food.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is a 47-year-old married woman with three kids.  She has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for over 4 years.  Shiela is a member of PMPC and has benefitted from 3 loans since becoming a member.

Shiela would now like to request another loan to support her business activity. With the proceeds from her business, she provides for her children’s education, transportation and food. She hopes that someday, with God’s help, her living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to support her ready-to-wear clothing business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has been working hard in her fish-selling business. It has been a profitable project, and this is why she is turning to Yehu to request another loan so as to expand her business. 

She narrates to us that her clientele has increased, and meeting their needs has become a big problem since she doesn't have enough money to expand. She hopes to use the profits from this loan to venture further into her business and probably open some new businesses. 

Since the previous loan, her living standards and those of her family have improved. She is grateful to both Yehu and Kiva. With this loan she will be able to purchase stocks of fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Joucelyn

texts.en:
Joucelyn is an artisan who specializes in embroidered handbags and belts. She would like to invest in the purchase of wool and leather for her craft. She would also like to offer work to additional artisans from her community.

Joucelyn has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is her story:

"In 2008, I began to design and work hand-in-hand with skilled artisans. I absolutely love being a part of this work, which provides a living for many artisan families. It's also so fulfilling to discover and learn about these traditional arts that have been handed down from generation to generation."

"Thank you for your support by offering me the opportunity of this interest-free microcredit. I take pride in being involved in this type of work, especially because it benefits artisan families here in Huanta. It also means we get to show the world the magnificence of Peru's traditional arts. There is a great diversity between the textile arts of my country's coastal and mountain regions, and this is a constant source of inspiration for me to continue developing professionally." 

Use the link below to view Joucelyn's handmade accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7280

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wool and leather for her craft

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia  is a 47-year-old divorced woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 14 years to 27 years. She describes herself to be social and a loving woman. She operates a retail store where she sells juice. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located within a busy residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital for improving the business. 

Sophia will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more fruit for blending juices to sell. Her business goal is to venture into starting up a restaurant  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children as she is the sole provider of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits for blending juice to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, 51, is a hard-working, very enterprising, divorced woman. She is a mother of two children who are 30 and 18 years old, and who she loves very much and are her motivators. They live together in their own house that she managed to build with support from her children.

Her activity is selling consumer goods in her small kiosk. She buys her merchandise in local shopping centers and sells them to the neighborhood.

She started this business over 10 years ago with her own capital. She likes her activity because she keeps busy even as it earns her a good income. However, she comments that it’s a business that is very demanding physically and keeps her from spending much time with her friends.

She is requesting a loan from Yehu to invest in her business. She will use the requested amount of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to add stock of flour and sugar.

loans.use: to add stock of flour and sugar.

loans.name: Harold

texts.en: Harold has been an active member of PMPC since April, 2012.  He is single and a resident of Calalinan, Siquijor, Siquijor.  Harold has been operating a sari-sari store for over two years.  He has requested his first PMPC loan for additional capital for his business in hopes of increasing his monthly earnings.

loans.use: to fund his sari-sari business.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es:
El Señor Victorino tiene 30 años, es soltero, y vive en la ciudad de Curuguaty, es dueño de un local de ventas y reparaciones de celulares, que está ubicada en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad.
Victorino hace dos años que se dedica a este trabajo y gracias a su buen trato y servicio con los clientes, ya pudo formarse una buena clientela que siempre acude a él, además de eso también trabaja como funcionario y de esa forma ayuda a sus familiares y logra salir adelante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para celulares, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, también agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Victorino is 30 years old.  He is single and lives in the city of Curuguaty.  He is the owner of a business that sells and repairs cell phones.  The business is strategically located in the city.

Victorino has been doing this for two years and thanks to his good customer service, he has already been able to build a strong clientele that always returns to him.  He also works as an official and in this way he supports his relatives and is able to get ahead. 

He is asking for the loan in order to buy parts for cell phones.  In this way he can continue working and providing good service to his customers.  He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy parts for cell phones.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 32 years old and married with two children between one and three years old. He sells shoes for men. He has 10 years of experience in this work and he currently employs two people to help him. He works from 6 am to 7 pm every day of the week except on Sunday.

Celestin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more shoes for men for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for men for resale.

loans.name: Santos Gabriela

texts.es: Santos Gabriela de 59 años de edad, soltera con 5 hijos mayores de edad, el cual tiene por actividad economica la venta de embases  de vidrio, tiempo de tener el negocio  21 años , el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion y forma ambulante, el negocio lo inico con la ayuda de su esposo ya que el trabaja lavando botellas, y de dicha manera comenzamos acopiar envases de vidrio, el financiamiento lo necesito para comprar envases de vidrio , lo cual le generaria mayor ganancia,
texts.en: Santos Gabriela is 59 years old.  She is a single mother of five grown children.  She has been making a living selling glass plates for 21 years.  The business is located in her home and she also sells door-to-door.  She started the business with the support of her husband.  He worked washing bottles, and then they started collecting glass plates. She needs the financing to buy glass plates, which will generate income for her.

loans.use: to buy glass plates.

loans.name: Jade

texts.en: Jade is an active member of PMPC. He  is married with two school-age children.  He is engaged in cell phone repairs and sells some parts and accessories. He has operated this livelihood for over two years.  He borrowed a loan from PMPC for the second time to be used for the purchase of cell phone parts and accessories to increase his income aside from ordinary repairs. He practices spending his money from his income wisely to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase parts and accessories for cell phones

loans.name: Naile

texts.en:
Naile is 45 years old and married. She has three children; one of whom attends school. They live in a village not far from a major city. Naile has been in the livestock business for a long time. She has been selling milk to neighboring dairy farms. 

In her area, the number of unemployed women is very high. Through borrowing loans, they try to be self-employed and to earn money for the welfare of their families.

Naile loves the livestock business and is committed to it. She is aware that without KosInvest support, her goal will be difficult to achieve. 

She requests a loan to buy a cow and calf.

Selling the milk will help her to pay the loan. After she finishes this loan, she is planning to buy another cow using a new loan.

She appreciates very much KosInvest for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy a cow and calf

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine lives in the Mombasa area of Kenya. She is married and has one child who attends school. She owns a salon, which she has been operating for two years.

Dorine learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenge she is facing is late payments by her clients.

Dorine is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya Shillings to buy blow driers and cosmetics for her business. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children and get her children to a better school. Her plan for the future is to build a bigger salon that can accommodate more clients.

loans.use: To buy blow driers and cosmetics

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
At 26 years old, Mariam is married and the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She has been specializing in the selling of consumer products in her retail shop. Her customers are made up of people from the neighborhood and its environs. She gets her supplies in the nearby town and also through supplies Mondays and Thursdays.

With the goal of increasing her sales and meeting customer demand, Mariam has sought a loan from Yehu. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business and to contribute to her children's professional training.

Mariam intends to purchase rice, beans, flour, and other fast-selling products like sweets.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, flour, and other fast-selling products like sweets.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has one child, ten months old.  Rose started her tailoring business two years ago. Thanks to her perseverance and commitment, Rose has been able to provide for her family.

As a result of Rose's good service and friendliness, along with help from her husband, her business is improving with each moment. Her goals are to continue working, to feel useful, and to move forward. 

Rose needs a loan to buy clothing materials to continue making clothes for sale. She and her husband are grateful for the help they have received and view it as a good opportunity to make progress.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials to continue making clothes for sale.

loans.name: Giuliana

texts.en:
Giuliana is a jewelry designer who specializes in gold and silver filigree art. She would like to invest in the purchase of two kilos of silver for production.

Giuliana has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story:

"As a child, I loved creating my own jewelry to wear at parties, or to give as gifts to friends. My designs speak of tradition yet are modern, and they feature the harmony between metal, pearls, and gemstones. I'd like to show the world the hand-crafted filigree styles developed in Peru over the centuries. I have researched the theme at length, and my findings have led me to experiment with many great materials, with Andean opal being my favorite.

"I would like to thank you for being there when people are going through tough times. Especially for women like me, who are trying to make it in this art form and find success in our ventures."

Use the link below to view Giuliana's silver and gold jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4994

loans.use: to purchase two kilos of silver for her filigree jewelry.

loans.name: Tiberio

texts.en:
Tiberio is an artisan who specializes in handcrafted silver and gemstone jewelry. To continue production he would like to invest in the purchase of natural gemstones and a kilo of sterling silver.

Tiberio has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

Tiberio was offered a job cutting gemstones by mere chance. "Thanks to my teacher, I learned the craft. I love the gems of Peru with all their beautiful colors. I combine them with silver; this is how each of my creations is born. I try to use these natural elements in different and unusual ways, with the authenticity of Peru inherent in my style. My inspiration comes from the stones themselves."

"It is so good to know that when times are hard we can actually count on the kindness of others. Thank you all so much for taking part in the funding of this interest-free microcredit."

Use the link below to view Tiberio's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5194

loans.use: buy gemstones and sterling silver for his jewelry business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages 5 years and 8 years. She describes herself to be a polite and intelligent woman. 

Rehema operates a retail store where she sells cosmetics, sweets and sodas.  She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located at a competitive area and her primary customers are residents.   She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

Rehema will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more cosmetics for resale. Her business goal is to run another similar retail store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, her business will have been successful .

loans.use: buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en:
Ramadhan lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married. Ramadhan has a transport business that he has been operating for four years. Besides this, he also runs a vegetables and grocery stall.

Ramadhan learned about Milango through an employee.  He has the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are seasonal weather and high taxes.

Ramadhan is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to buy spare parts to repair his motorbike. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to increase his savings and improve on his living standard. His dream is to buy a public service van.

loans.use: buy parts to repair his motorbike

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She owns a shop selling weaved palm leaves which she has been operating for fifteen years. These leaves are used for roofing around the coastal area. Mariam started the business through her own savings. Besides this, she also supplies building materials and owns rental houses.

Mariam learned about Milango through a friend.  She has an aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenge she is facing is high prices for fuel and transport.

Mariam is applying for a loan of 43,200 Kenyan shillings to purchase stones and cement. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to buy school uniforms for her children. Her plan for the future is to build another rental house.

loans.use: buy stones and cement

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two children, only one of whom attends school. She owns a retail shop which she has been operating for two years.  She learned about Milango through an employee and has an aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation.

Vivian is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to purchase vegetables. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her child. Her plan for the future is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Zuma

texts.en:
Zuma lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He has three children, two of whom attend school. He owns a tailoring shop which he has been operating for four years.  He learned about Milango through a friend and has an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The challenge he is facing is lack of enough funds.

Zuma is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenyan shillings to buy more materials for making dresses and trousers and equipment needed for his tailoring shop. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. His plan for the future is to open other tailoring shops.

loans.use: buy tailoring equipment and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy vegetales to resell

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
Alexis is 38 years old and married with five children between 5 and 18 years old. He sells various goods such as cooking oil, lotions, biscuits, soap, etc. Alexis has seven years of experience in this work and he works from 6 am to 9 pm every day of the week.

Alexis has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as cooking oil, lotions, biscuits, soap, etc. for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as cooking oil, lotions, biscuits, soap, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en: Japhet is a 34-year-old single man who operates a kiosk. It has been active for the last year and selling to the neighborhood. Japhet is dedicated to his business and he is struggling to achieve his dream of opening a retail shop in the future. His business has run out of stock and he plans to increase his inventory, so he has requested a loan of KSH 35,000 to add stock of flour, rice, paraffin, and other fast-selling products. Japhet lives in his own house in the village of Kaloleni, in the coastal region of Kenya. He hopes to repay his loan on time and request more loans to invest in his business. By doing this, he will be in a better position to progress in life.

loans.use: to buy more flour, rice, paraffin, and other fast selling products.

loans.name: Olandina

texts.en: Olandina is a 48-year-old married woman with nine children; five of them are in school and her husband is a fisherman. She has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including flour, oil, soap, and fish. She lives with her family in a house made of bricks with zinc for the roof. She would like to build a stronger house for her family and hopes to earn enough in her business to support her children to go for higher education.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, soap, and fish

loans.name: Agustinha

texts.en:
Agustinha is a 28-year-old married woman with six children, three of them are in school. Her husband is a farmer. She has a kiosk in front of her home  to supply people in her village with basic goods. 

Agustinha will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including sugar, candles, oil, soap, and coffee. She opened her kiosk a year ago with a working capital of $400. 

Agustinha lives in a simple house made of bamboo and zinc for the roof. She hopes that she can build a good house for her family and send her children to study.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
A $1000 loan is requested by Paulina.  She is a widow with 2 children, both are in primary school.  Paulina has a kiosk in front of her home.  She has been operating her kiosk since 2005 with a starting capital of $400.  

Paulina will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including noodles, oil, soap, cigarettes, fish and vegetables.  She lives in a simple house made of palm branch for walls and zinc for roof. She wants to open a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Exuperia

texts.en:
Exuperia is 47 years old and is from the town of Antequera, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 8 and 20. Her husband works as a driver but his income is not sufficient for their daily needs.  Because of  this, she helps by operating a sari-sari store, selling clothing and medicines. 

Exuperia is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, noodles, eggs, toiletries, canned goods, medicines and clothing.  She hope that her business will continue to provide for her family's needs and she can have a business expansion in the future.

loans.use: buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Umbelina

texts.en:
Umbelina is 38 years old.  She is married and has 4 children, 2 of  them are in school.  Her husband is a farmer. 

Umbelina has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including flour, oil, soap, and animals like chickens and pigs. 

Umbelina started this business in 2006 with a working capital of $300.   She lives in her house made of bamboo for the walls and zinc for the roof. She wants to send her children to study in higher education and wants to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel operates a tricycle business in Cortes, Bohol. He is married and has two children, ages 9 and 12. From this livelihood he support his family's need for food and pay school fees for his children. 

Roel is asking for a loan so he can better take care of his transportation business. He needs to pay for vulcanizing, engine maintenance and to buy spare parts. Once these are met, he will be assured of continued transportation service in his community, giving him a better chance of an income. His profit will be for tuition fees and a healthy diet for his family.

loans.use: pay for the maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 30 years old and has 3 children. She lives in D'ban, Calamba.  Lucia provides beauty services for a living, particularly pedicure and manicure services.  She's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 3,600 doing this type of business. 

Lucia requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to obtain materials such as nail polish. Recently, Lucia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she simply hopes for the business improvements.

loans.use: buy beauty service supplies

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 26 years old.  She is married and has one child.  Her husband is a businessman. 

Filomena has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including sugar, oil, soap, cigarettes, and vegetables. 

Filomena started the business with her own working capital of $500.  She also has a farm to grow vegetables.  She hopes that with the income she can build a good house for her family in the future.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 28, married and a mother to two children, ages 11 and 5. Her husband is a driver. Eunice helps her spouse pay their household bills. For the last four years, she has been operating a food sales business, selling in the streets in an open-air market. She describes market competition to be her major challenge. Eunice also sells firewood from her home. Her cement house has both electricity and piped water.  Eunice dreams she will be able to open a hotel in the future.

Both of Eunice’s children are in school and providing for their education is one of the reasons she started working. She is requesting a loan in the amount of Ksh 20,000 to purchase wheat flour, potatoes, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, potatoes, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Phat is aged 47, living in a rural village of the Sa Ang district, Kandal province. She is married with four children (two daughters and two sons), all of whom are still dependent on her. Some of them work at a garment factory and some are in school. To support her family, Phat has been involved in rice farming and supplements her family’s income by fishing. She has been in this business for 20 years, earning about 5 U.S. dollars per day to meet her family’s needs. Phat is in her fifth cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now she is applying for a loan with VisionFund of 300 U.S. dollars. Phat is going to use this loan to buy an additional plot of land for growing her rice paddy as the business expands. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of land for growing her rice paddy and expanding her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 4 children ranging in age from 5 to 18 years old. She describes herself as social, generous and a God fearing woman . She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as salt, sugar, sweets and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located within a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. Mary describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for improving her business. 

Mary will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more household items for resale. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and use the profits to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy household items for her business.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is from Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 57 years old.  He is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Florencio owns and operates a service-based business. He has been engaged in his business for 12 years and earns 3,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, he joined GDMPC. 

Florencio is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

loans.use: repair his transport vehicle

loans.name: Sam Ol

texts.en: At the age of 63 years old, Sam Ol is a widower father of nine children living in the Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province, Cambodia. He has earned a living through rice farming on a hectare of farmland for almost 40 years. He manages to earn approximately USD 7 per day from his current business. Low crop yields caused by drought remain the main challenge for him. Sam Ol has been with VisionFund for three cycles and successfully paid back the past loan, which has helped him to have a motorbike for family use. Now he is requesting a loan in the amount of USD 400. With this loan, he will buy a cow for plowing his farmland. He hopes to increase his income so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a cow for using in the field business

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is married with three children. She is 56 years old and lives in Patawag, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Estrella owns a piggery to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feed for the pigs.

Estrella has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to have more pigs to grow.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Tusaidie Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bituha est conseillère du le groupement  d’affaire Tusaidie, âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 12 enfants et plusieurs petits fils. Son mari est un serviteur de Dieu, pasteur dans une église baptiste. La cliente est vendeuse de beignets, de gâteaux à son  domicile. Elle commença son entreprise avec le crédit rotatif d’un mutuel locale de développement, de lors qu’elle a été affectée dans cette ville de Goma. Environs 5 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Plus tard, elle sollicita le soutien de l’IMF Hekima, elle vient de réaliser 22 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Dit-elle, que grâce à ce prêt, ses enfants étudient confortablement dans les universités de la place. Le grand défi de cette activité est lié au faible capital financier. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  la farine froment, levures, sucres, etc. Le reste d’argent servira pour payer les frais académiques pour ses enfants.  Elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes
texts.en:
The client Bituha is the advisor of the business group Tusaidie. She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of 12 children and a number of grandchildren. Her husband is a priest in a Baptist church.

The client has been selling beignets and cakes out of her home for about 5 years. She started her business with a revolving credit line from a local development bank in the city of Goma.

Later on, she asked for support from IMF Hekima. She has just completed 22 loan cycles with Hekima's microfinance program.

She says that thanks to this loan, her children can study comfortably in the local universities. 

The major challenge with her business has to do with having a small amount of capital. This new loan will help her buy wheat flower, yeasts, sugars, etc. The rest of the money will be used to pay for schooling fees for her children. 

She would like to grow her business and would like to thank Hekima for their support and empowerment of female small business owners.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, yeasts, sugars, etc.

loans.name: Divino Niño Sauce Group

texts.es: El banco comunal divino niño esta conformado por 8 integrantes los cuales son: Gloria Elena, Maria del Socorro, Kenia Vanessa, Luisa Emilia, Daniel de Jesus, Liduvina del Socorro, Rosibel del Carmen, Rosa Melida. Todas ha demostrado ser personas responsables, trabajadoras,  con ganas de superacion personal, Liduvina del socorro es la cordinadora del banco ella tiene por actividad economica una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion la cual vende productos de consumo diario como: jabon, detergentes, pasta dental, fosforos, hielos, tiste, arroz, frijoles, azucar, aceite, harinas, verduras, frutas, pan, huevos queso, cremas, entre otros.
texts.en: The 'Divine Child' Communal Bank is comprised of 8 members which are: Gloria Elena, Maria del Socorro, Kenia Vanessa, Luisa Emilia, Daniel de Jesus, Liduvina del Socorro, Rosibel del Carmen, Rosa Melida. All proved to be responsible, hardworking, and willing to overcome personal.   Liduvina del Socorro is the coordinator of the bank.  She has a grocery store located in her home where she sells dairy products such as soap, detergents, toothpaste, matches, ice, tiste (a typical corn-based beverage with sugar, cacao, and cinnamon), rice, beans, sugar, oil, flour, vegetables, fruits, bread, eggs, cheese, and creams, among other things.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergents, toothpaste, matches, ice, tiste, rice, beans, sugar, oil, flour, vegetables, fruits, bread, eggs, cheese, creams, etc.

loans.name: Vandy's Group

texts.en:
A married father of six children, Vandy is from a rural area located in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. He is 46 years old. Out of six children, he still has five children to take care. Some of his children work at a garment factory and some are in school. The family’s primary income is from rice farming, a business he has been in for almost 30 years. Lack of capital for the business is still the main challenge for him. 

Vandy’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and this is the second loan cycle for his group with VisionFund. The past loan has helped him earn a better living and now he can earn about KHR 40,000 per day. He and the other member are applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. Vandy, as the group leader, is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland and use a portion of it to buy gasoline for pumping water. With this loan, he expects to expand his business and earn more income to provide his family with comfortable living conditions and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Usalama Renovee Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nankafu est trésorière du le groupement  d’affaire Usalama Rénové, elle est âgée de 51 ans, mariée et  mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous et d’autres ont déjà leurs propres ménages.  La cliente est vendeuse des friperies  dans la ville de Goma. Elle est expose ses marchandises au marché central de Virunga. Elle commença son entreprise de lors, qu’elle fut mariée. Elle s’entraide avec son conjoint dans ce business. Elle vient de réaliser  12 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit. Elle a bénéficié plusieurs produits promotionnels qu’offre Hekima. Grace aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé des investissements modestes pour sa famille (scolarité des enfants, chaises,  etc.). Elle ambitionne acheter une voiture, une moto pour faire le taxi dans la ville. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  4 ballons de friperies. Le défi actuel pour elle, c’est la permanence de l’insécurité dans l’intérieur de la province (Masisi, Rutshuru, etc.) car leurs clientèles proviennent de ces villages.  Ainsi, dit-elle, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes.
texts.en:
The client, Nankafu, is the treasurer of the business group Usalama Rénové. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 8 children who all go to school. Some of her children are in their own households.

The client sells second-hand clothes in the city of Goma. She sells her goods at the central market of Virunga. She started her business when she got married. 

She works with her husband on her business. She has benefitted form a number of promotional products offered by Hekima, and just completed 12 loan cycles with their microfinance program. 

Thanks to Hekima's loans, she was able to make small investments in her family (schooling, chairs, etc.) She would like to buy a car and a motorcycle to become a taxi driver in the city. 

She'll use this new loan to buy 4 bales of second-hand clothing. Her current challenge is the ongoing safety issues within her province (Masisi, Rutshuru, etc.) because her clients come from those villages.  She would like to thank Hekima for their support and for the empowerment of female small business owners.

loans.use: to buy 4 bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima is a clever person with a good nature. She is a very good baker and always cooks very tasty breads and rolls for her children. She has three smart children and loves them very much. Her husband is a very kind man and helps her in everything. He is a master. 

Rahima is as good in family as she is in business. She has owned her business for more than four years. She has been busy selling children's clothes. In the local market she has many customers, and her business has been developing day by day. She is going to buy goods for the new season. She is asking for a loan to buy children's clothes. She awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy goods, such as children clothes, for widening her assortment

loans.name: Joyeuse Mpya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Luanda est conseillère dans le groupe de crédit Joyeuse Mpya, entrepreneur très ambitieux expérimentée. Agée de 45 ans. Elle est une femme vivant seul (sans conjoint). Mère de 3 enfants. La cliente est vendeuse de pagnes. Elle étale ses marchandises au marché central de Virunga. Elle commença son entreprise avec son fonds propre reçu de son grand frère. Plus tard, elle sollicita le soutien de l’IMF Hekima. Elle vient de realiser 8 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Environs 10 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 8 pièces de pagnes à marchander. Cette cliente est confortable avec son business. Dans le futur, elle compte acheter une parcelle et construire une maison d'habitation. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes.
texts.en:
An ambitious and experienced entrepreneur, the client, Luanda, is an advisor in the Joyeuse Mpya loan group. She is 45 years old and lives alone (without a spouse). She is the mother of 3 children. 

The client has been selling pagnes (traditional wrap arounds) for about 10 years.  She sells her goods at the central market of Virunga. She started her business with money from her older brother. 

Later on, she asked for a loan from IMF Hekima. She just completed 8 loan cycles in their microfinance program. This new loan will help her buy 8 pagnes. The client is comfortable with her business. 

In the future, she would like to buy a piece of land where she can build a house. She would like to thank Hekima for their support and for the empowerment of female small business owners.

loans.use: to buy 8 pagnes.

loans.name: Tusaidiane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kahambu est membre du le groupement  d’affaire Tusaidiane, elle est mariée et mère de 3 jeunes enfants. La cliente est couturière. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans ce métier de coupe couture. Elle est sociétaire d’un petit atelier de coupe couture, organisé à son  domicile. Elle commença son entreprise avec son fonds propre. Environs 15 ans, elle exerce ce métier. Plus tard, elle sollicita le soutien de l’IMF Hekima, elle vient de réaliser 13 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Le grand défi de cette activité est qu’elle est périodique. Elle réalise les grandes recettes souvent pendant les périodes de festivités. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  les matériels de couture (tissus, fils, ribat, dentelles, popeline, etc.).  Elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes
texts.en: Kahambu is a member of the Tusaidiane business group.  She is married and the mother of three young children.  Kahambu is a seamstress and works with her husband in tailoring.  She is a member of a small tailoring workshop, organized in her home.  She began her business with her own funds and has been in business for about 15 years.  Kahambu later requested aid from Hekima, and she has recently completed 13 cycles in its microcredit program.  The main challenge in her line of business is its cyclical nature; she often has large orders during holiday periods.  This new loan will allow her to buy sewing supplies (fabrics, thread, ribbon, lace, poplin, etc.).  She wants to grow her business.  Kahambu thanks Hekima for its support and for helping women entrepreneurs to gain independence.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies (fabric, thread, ribbon, lace, poplin, etc.)

loans.name: Banco Comunal Victoria De David Group

texts.es: El banco comunal  la victoria de david esta conformado por ocho integrantes los cuales son:  Mario Jose, Mariana Andrea, Micaela,Gladys Mariela, Norma del Carmen, Juana Paula, Dania Maricela,Teodora Amparo esta emprendedora se caracterizan por ser responsable, trabajadoras, con ganas de superacion personal, Juana Paula es la cordinadora del banco comunal  y tiene por actividad economica una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion con el financiamiento comprara productos de consumo diario como: aceite, pan,huevos, leche, crema, quesos, sopas magi, tiste, leña, frijoles, azucar, jabon, detergente, entre otros.
texts.en:
The communal bank "La Victoria de David" is comprised of eight members (first and middle names):

Mario Jose
Mariana Andrea
Micaela
Gladys Mariela
Norma del Carmen
Juana Paula
Dania Maricela
Teodora Amparo

This is a group of people who are resonsible and hardworking and who are highly motivated to better themselves.  Juana Paula is the coordinator of the communal bank and makes her living through operating a home-based grocery store.  With the loan proceeds she will buy groceries such as bread, eggs, milk, cream, cheese, beans, sugar, instant soups, soap, detergent, firewood and other products.

loans.use: to buy oil, bread, eggs, milk, cream, cheese, beans, sugar, instant soups, soap, detergent, firewood and other products.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia Alejandrina tiene 43 años y es casada fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, ella vive en la ciudad de Huambutio y pertenece al banco Comunal “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejas y ladrillos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer secar las tejas y va comprar como por ejemplo leña y combustibles. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 43 and is happily married.  She lives with her husband and two children in the city of Huambutio. She is a member of the communal bank “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” of the Arariwa Association.   She is doing very well and is punctual with her repayments.

She has a business making tiles and bricks.  Currently, she requires a loan so that she can buy materials used for baking her tiles, such as firewood and other fuels.

She is grateful for the loan opportunity and promises to make her repayments according to the agreed-upon schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials used for baking her tiles, such as firewood and other fuels.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 55 year old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari store, or grocery store, in their community. She has operated this business for more than ten years now. This business is the source of income for the sustenance of their daily needs and expenses.

Luzviminda is requesting for a loan, worth 5000PHP, to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, snack foods, sodas, soap, shampoos and other items. She believes that, if she will be provided with financial support through loans, she can fulfill her dreams of expanding her business and she can augment her income.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, snack foods, sodas, soap and shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Aged 46, Chan is a resident from Pouk district of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has three children, two of whom are still living with her and helping the family’s business. To support the family’s basic need, Chan raises chickens and ducks for resale. She has been in this business for 5 years and is able to earn about KHR 30,000 per day.

This is the first loan cycle for Chan’s group. She is leading the group of two members to apply for a loan with VisionFund, in the amount of KHR 1,000,000, each. Chan will use her loan portion to purchase more chickens and ducks. She hopes to raise her ducks and chickens healthfully in order to sell at a high price, so she can earn more profit to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
A 53 year old man, named Pedrito, wants to improve his business and decided to be part of PMPC last June 2012. He is married and is blessed with 6 children. Some of his children are still in school.  

Pedrito's recycled materials business is the main source of income to feed his family. Pedrito's purpose of joining PMPC is to have financial access to help improve the capitalization of the business to provide not only food but also to educate his school-aged children.

loans.use: to buy and sell recycled materials.

loans.name: Josefina Juana

texts.es:
Josefina es una mujer de 50 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Mala, con su querida madre y sus 2 hijos; ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lastimosamente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja; en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las acogedoras calles de la ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Arroz con Mariscos para compartir con su familia.
 Con mucho empeño, Josefina trabaja como Enfermera en un hospital de su ciudad; adicionalmente, gracias al apoyo y enseñanzas de su madres, Josefina puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de Tamales, día a día desde tempranas horas de la mañana Josefina prepara estos deliciosos potajes para ponerlos en venta, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que su negocio marcha bien ya que sus clientes la solicitan por su buena sazón y por su trato amable.
Josefina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus tamales, tales como: choclos, pancas, ají, manteca, entre otros; asimismo, podrá comprar una congeladora para conservar sus productos e insumos; de esta manera Josefina tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea utilizar para asegurar la educación y bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Josefina is a 50-year-old woman living in the city of Cañete, Mala District with her beloved mother and her two children.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who focuses al her efforts into moving her family forward.  Sadly, for various reasons she separated from her spouse.  
In her free time she enjoys walking through the welcoming streets of the city and sometimes cooks a delicious “Arroz con Mariscos” [Rice with Seafood] to share with her family. 

Josefina works very diligently as a nurse in a hospital in her city and also, thanks to support and teaching from her mother, she also started her small tamale business.  Day to day starting very early in the morning Josefina prepares these delicious dishes to sell.  She spends about 8 hours daily in her business and believes it does well because her customers seek her out due to the tasty way she cooks and because of her kindness.

Josefina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy ingredients to make tamales like: corn, corn husks, chili and lard, among others.  She will also be able to buy a freezer to store her products and ingredients.  In this way, Josefina’s business will be better supplied and equipped and she hopes with that to increase sales and income that she wants to use to insure her children’s wellbeing and schooling.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and ingredients.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a 51 year old married womanfrom Bohol, Philippines. She has five children. Julita is engaged in beauty and wellness services in their community. She provides services like manicure, pedicure and foot reflexology. 

Julita is a hardworking woman with great desire to improve their way of living. She takes every opportunity to earn a living in order to help her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the education of their children who are still in school.

Julita is asking for a loan worth 4000PHP to buy more materials for manicure/pedicure such as nail color, nail polish and other items. She believes that through this loan, she can make her goal of improving her daily income. She also plans on investing in another lucrative business to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy more materials for manicure/pedicure such as nail color, nail polish and other items.

loans.name: Esperanzas Del Mañana Group

texts.es:
María Josefina, tiene 40 años de edad,  es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, vive con ellos en  una aldea cercana al municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Doña María Josefina, hace 3 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan casero como ser semitas, empanadas, torta etc. Este producto lo vende en su comunidad de manera ambulante ofreciendo de casa en casa. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar materiales e insumos necesarios para la elaboración de pan, con el objetivo de incrementar la producción y las ventas. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y que sea fuerte. Ella pertenece al  G.S  Esperanzas del mañana, que está formado por dos integrantes  María Josefina en la foto esta a la derecha y doña Abadio esta a la izquierda, quien se dedica  a la venta de tortillas, las dos solicitan un préstamo de 4,800.00 Lempiras  este es el tercer préstamo solicitado en grupo y residen en la misma comunidad.
texts.en:
María Josefina, 40, is a single mother; she has three children living with her in a village near the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.  María Josefina has been making home-made bread like ‘semitas,’ [type of sweet bread roll] turnovers, cakes, etc. for three years.  She sells it from place to place in her community door-to-door.  

The loan she’s requesting is to buy supplies and ingredients needed to make bread with the goal in mind of increasing production and sales.  Her goal is to make the business bigger and stronger.

She belongs to the “Esperanzas del Mañana” (Tomorrow’s Hopes) communal bank which has two members. In the photo, María Josefina is on the right and Abadio is on the left; she sells tortillas.  The two of them are requesting 4,800 lempiras and this is the third group loan they’ve requested.  They live in the same community.

loans.use: to buy bread-making supplies.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La socia Martina tiene 48 años de edad y es casada fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, ella vive en la ciudad de Huambutio y pertenece al banco Comunal “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejas y ladrillos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer secar las tejas como por ejemplo leña y combustibles. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Martina is 48 years old and is happily married.  She lives in the city of Huambutio with her husband and two children.  She belongs to the communal bank “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio”  which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is doing very well and is punctual with her repayments.

She has a business making tiles and bricks. Currently, she requires a loan so that she can buy materials used for baking her tiles, such as firewood and other fuels.

She is grateful for the loan opportunity and promises to make her repayments according to the agreed-upon schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials used for baking her tiles.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is married and has 5 children. She is 48 years old and lives in Namnama, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Rosalina is a farmer and owns a rice field to earn her living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 7000PHP to purchase more fertilizer for her crops.

Rosalina has been a new member of PMPC. In the future, Rosalina hopes to expand her rice field.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is married and has 3 children. Merlina is 45 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Merlina grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested for additional working capital.

Merlina has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Merlina hopes to grow more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Nefilia

texts.en:
Nefilia is married with 5 children. Nefilia is 61 years old and lives in Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Nefilia owns a general store business to earn a living and had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP3000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 6500 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Nefilia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Nefilia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 48 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has 10 children.

Zosima works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Zosima has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Zosima hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jenny Laila

texts.en:
Jenny Laila is 23 years old and lives in Namnama, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married.

Jenny Laila works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 4 years. She has requested a loan of 7,000PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Jenny Laila has been a new member of PMPC. In the future, Jenny Laila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Grace Divine Group

texts.fr: GRACE DIVINE est un groupe constitué de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Adeline. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Adeline est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Paul. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adeline a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Adeline exerce la coiffure, activité qu’elle apprise et qu’elle exerce depuis une quinzaine d’année dans son atelier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Adeline vend des mèches et des produits de cheveux dans son atelier. Adeline s’approvisionne dans sa région. Pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Adeline sollicite un quatrième prêt ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GRACE DIVINE. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Grace Divine is a group made up of three friends from the same neighborhood.  The group representative (with hand raised in photo) is named Adeline.  To increase their operating funds, the group is requesting a fourth loan through ALIDé.  Adeline is 34 years old and married to a man named Paul.  The couple has four children, all in school and under their care.  Adeline left school at the primary level.
