To meet her and her family's needs, Adeline is a hairstylist, a business she learned and has been practicing for about 15 years in her salon.  In addition to hairstyling, Adeline sells extensions and hair products at her salon.  She buys her supplies in the region.  To be more competitive in the market, she is requesting her fourth loan, together with the other members of the Grace Divine group.  This loan will allow them to strengthen their businesses and increase their clientele and income.  Their previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and hair products.

loans.name: Brenda Xiomara

texts.es:
Brenda  tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre,  tiene 4 hijos, vive en el Municipio de Morazán Yoro. 
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, realiza  actividades agrícolas, hace 3 años que se dedica a la producción y venta de Café, ya tiene sus propias parcelas. El café lo vende en el mercado local.  A esta actividad le dedica 8 horas diarias.
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 3,000.00 Lempiras para comprar fertilizante para darle un mejor mantenimiento al cultivo del café y sacar buenas cosechas.
Su plan es mejorar su producción y con las ganancias tener un mejor nivel de vida. Ella pertenece al Grupo Solidario Gran Bendición  que está conformado por 3 miembros que residen en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Brenda, 33, is in a common law relationship and has four children; she lives in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro.  She is a very hardworking woman.  She does farming.  She’s been producing coffee to sell for three years.  She has her own parcels of land already.  She sells the coffee in the local market.  She spends 8 hours daily at work.

She’s asking for a 3,000 lempira loan to buy fertilizer to better care for her coffee plants and produce good harvests.  Her plan is to improve production and attain a better standard of living with the profits.  She belongs to the “Gran Bendición” (Great Blessing) solidarity group which has three members who live in the same community and are all farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Denia Merari

texts.es: Denia tiene 30 años de edad, vive en San Francisco de Yojoa junto a su conyugue y sus dos hijos. Hace 5 años que se dedica a vender mercadería en la comunidad, vende jeans, blusas, zapatos, sandalias, productos Avon etc.  El negocio lo tiene en su casa y sale a vender de manera ambulante a domicilio y por pedidos. Solicita un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar más mercadería y surtir su negocio para incrementar las ventas y los ingresos.  Su meta es trabajar mucho para mantener estable el negocio y obtener el ingreso necesario para la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Denia, 30, lives in San Francisco de Yojoa with her spouse and two children.  She’s been selling merchandise in her community for the last five years.  She sells jeans, blouses, shoes, sandals, Avon products, etc.  Her business is home-based and she goes out selling from place to place door to door and also based on prior orders.  

She’s asking for a 10,000 lempira loan to buy more merchandise to stock her business in order to increase sales and income.  Her goal is to work hard to keep the business stable and earn income needed for her family unit.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Rafiki Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mbavu est actuellement conseillère et ancienne présidente du groupe de crédit Rafiki, elle lève la main sur la photo, cliente au 17e cycle de crédit, âgée de 42 ans, mariée. Elle est mère de 13 enfants parmi lesquels 9 étudient et 3 sont mariés. Son mari est huissier dans une coopérative d’épargne et de crédit de la ville. Signalons que cette maman a mis au monde à deux reprises des jumeaux. Elle a commencé son petit commerce avec son fonds propre reçu de son familier en guise de petit geste de cadeau. Elle est vendeuse ambulante des souliers usagers dans la ville de Goma. Il y a 15 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de vente des souliers usagers. Elle vend également des pommes de terre à domicile pour accroitre ses revenus. Avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima, la cliente souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant  5 paires des souliers usagers. Dans l’avenir, elle planifie de changer d’activité en ouvrant une petite boutique de vente des produits divers, et à la longue acheter une parcelle pour sa famille. La cliente  remercie vivement  l’IMF Hekima pour les crédits qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The client, Mbavu, is the current advisor and former president of the loan group Rafiki. Her hand is raised in the photo. 

She is 42 years old and is in her 17th loan cycle. She is the mother of 13 children including 2 sets of twins. Nine of her children go to school and three are married. Her husband is a doorman at a credit union in the city. 

She started her small business with funds given to her by her family as a gift. For 15 years, she has been selling used shoes on foot in the city of Goma. She also sells potatoes out of her home to add to her revenues. 

With her loan from IMF Hekima, the client would like to increase her sales by buying 5 pairs of used shoes. 

In the future, she would like to change her line of business and open a small boutique that sells various items. In the long term, she'd like to buy a piece of land for her family. 

The client would like to thank IMF Hekima enthusiastically for the loans that she has received without the need for collateral. Thanks to their loans, she is able to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy 5 pairs of used shoes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth esta casada y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones pequeñas, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica  a la venta de ropa de ambos sexos y carteras para damas, ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia, es por eso que solicita el crédito para aumentar su mercadería desea comprar ropa por cantidad y posteriormente venderlas de forma ambulante ya que no cuenta con un puesto de venta fijo trabajando por más de ocho horas al día., también cuenta con el alquiler de un departamento.
El sueño de Elizabeth es mejorar sus ingresos para poder cubrir los gastos universitarios de sus hijos y también adquirir un puesto de venta en un lugar comercial.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has two children who are school age.  They live in her house occupying three small rooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Sopocachi zone.

She currently earns income selling clothes for both genders and women’s purses since she’s the only one who covers food, schooling and basic utility costs for her family.  This is why she’s asking for a loan to increase her stock merchandise.  She wants to buy clothes in quantity to then resell from place to place since she does not have a permanent sales stand.  She works more than 8 hours daily and she also earns income from renting a room.

Elizabeth’s dream is to improve her income in order to cover university costs for her children and also to acquire a sales stand in a commercial place.  
This is the fourth time she’s asked for an IMPRO loan and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Rossi

texts.es:
Rossi es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos que estudian en la universidad , tres de ellos ya son independientes y solo vive con el menor en una casa en alquiler ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica  a la comercialización de condimentos para las comidas de forma ambulante y por más de diez horas ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de su mercadería ya que desea ampliarla para mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Rossi es adquirir una casa en anticrético y tener una tienda para no hacerlo de forma  ambulante ya que es muy sacrificado.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Rossi is divorced and has four children studying in the university.  Three of them are already independent and only the youngest still lives at home with her in a rented house occupying two rooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Alto San Pedro zone.

She currently earns income because she sells spices for food from place to place and for more than ten hours daily since she must cover food, education and basic utility payments for her family. She needs the loan to buy merchandise because she wants to expand it and improve her income.

Rossi’s dream is to acquire a house in the ‘anticrético’ modality [a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] and to have a store so that she doesn’t have to do it from place to place anymore since that’s quite demanding.

This is the third time she’s asked for an IMPRO loan and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Adrian Rosendo

texts.es: Adrian Rosendo de 39 años de edad, casado, con 2 hijos menores de edad, tiene por actividad economica una carpinteria, este emprendedor ha sido un hombre bien dedicado, con sus hijos, el cual el quiere brindar mejores condiciones de vida, el financiamiento lo quiere para realizar mejoras en su vivienda la cuales consisten en construccion de una pilar de agua para reservar agua  potable, y construir un pared perimetral en la parte de la carpinteria para que el agua lluvia no se introduzca en la habitacion.del financiamiento comprara meterial de construccion como: arena, cemento,hierro, alfajillas, clavos, alambres, cal,  madera.
texts.en:
Adrián Rosendo, 39, is married and has two minor children.  His economic activity is carpentry.  This entrepreneur is a man who is very devoted to his children and wants to provide them with better living conditions.  

He wants the loan to do some home improvements consisting in building a water tank to store potable water and to build a perimeter wall around the carpentry shop so that rain water won’t leak into the room.  He will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies like sand, cement, rebar, window and door frames, nails, wire, lime powder and lumber.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Claudia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se dedica al comercio de materiales de construcción como arena, piedra, yeso entre otros productos., ella comenzó con esta actividad hace algunos años, cuando comenzó el boom de la construcción y el movimiento turístico de su región, además con un poco de ingenio y animada por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso económico extra, pudo aprender este negocio, el cual comenta que le va muy bien. Claudia en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar los materiales con los cuales trabaja, como arena y piedra para construcción.
Claudia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
texts.en:
Claudia belongs to the “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium) communal bank in the province of Urubamba del Cusco, Perú.  She sells building materials and supplies like sand, stone and plaster, among others.  

She started this activity a few years ago when the construction boom and tourism began in her region.  With a little bit of ingenuity and motivated by the need to earn extra income, she was able to learn this business and she comments that she does quite well.  

On this occasion, Claudia will use the requested loan to buy the materials she works with like sand and building stone.  Claudia is very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to provide her family with a better quality of life by helping her with the growth and strengthening of her activities.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Harbie

texts.es: Harbie, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de los cuales dos están estudiando   actualmente. El con el crédito pretende realizar una plantación de tomate y además  comprar insumos como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado sembrar tomate y con todos estos insumos darle el adecuado mantenimiento para su posterior venta y   poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Harbie, 44, is married living with his wife and four children two of which are attending school at present.  He intends to use the loan for his tomato crop and will buy supplies like manure and fumigations and will hire day laborers.  He’s thinking about planting tomatoes and all these supplies will be used to care for the crop properly so that higher profits will be generated from its future sale and he will attain better living conditions and economic stability.

This is his first loan from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks but Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила продает разный товар для быта. Людмила использовала предыдущий кредит для закупки канцелярских товаров перед школьным сезоном.

Раньше Людмила имела две торговые точки, но приняла решение продать вторую и вложить деньги в бизнес. Она нисколько об этом не жалеет. Людмила рассудительная и ответственная.

Людмила опять просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку канцтоваров к школьному сезону После школьного сезона продаж она вместе с мужем надеется поехать отдохнуть в Карпаты.
texts.en:
Ludmila sells various everyday goods. She used her previous loan to purchase office supplies prior to school's start. Previously, she owned two sales points, but decided to sell one and invest the money into her business. She doesn't regret this decision one bit. 

Ludmila is very rational and responsible. She's asking for another loan in order to purchase school supplies before the it begins. After this sales period she hopes to go on vacation with her husband to the Carpathian mountains.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for the new school season

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia Vilma tiene 44 años de edad y es casada fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, ella vive en la ciudad de Huambutio y pertenece al banco Comunal “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y chanchos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales menores como alimento balanceado y también va comprar algunos cuyes. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Vilma, 44, is married and she has two children.  She lives in the city of Huambutio and belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” communal bank.  She does very well thanks to the punctuality of her installment payments.

She sells food and raises small animals like guinea pigs and pigs.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy feed for her small animals like nutritionally balanced feed; she’s also going to buy some guinea pigs.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her installment payments as scheduled

loans.use: to buy some guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es: Tatiana de 36 años de edad vive en el municipio de Galapa, con su dos hijos menores de edad; allí tiene un taller de reparación de electrodomésticos y venta de repuestos, en el que tiene un experiencia  de hace 12 años, cuando nació  como iniciativa de su anterior cónyuge, para generar ingresos familiares. Este negocio es un punto comercial donde ofrece el servicio de reparación y mantenimiento de electrodomésticos menores y vende todo tipo de repuestos para estos mismos artefactos, a la clientela que ha estructurado en el municipio de Galapa donde aun funciona. Tatiana vende diariamente, en una jornada que va desde las  8 :00 a m. hasta las 6:00 pm, y sus compras las realiza en grandes almacenes de repuestos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, a 20 minutos del municipio donde habita.  En la actualidad los repuestos que mas vende son los de lavadoras, pues el mercado está colmado de negocios donde ofrecen este servicio y los propietarios de estos negocios deben frecuentemente hacer mantenimiento preventivo a las maquinas de lavar para poder ser efectivos en su servicio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a Tatiana   la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará principalmente repuestos para maquinas de lavar   y también comprará otros para planchas y abanicos, que son los que presentan una segunda mayor rotación. Con su credikiva, tendrá la oportunidad de vender aun más, en tanto a que su inventario atraerá cada vez a mas clientes y esto es justamente lo que hace que su inversión tenga éxito.
texts.en:
Tatiana is 36 years old and lives in the city of Galapa with her two young children. She has a shop that repairs home applicances and sells spare parts.  She has 12 years of experience in this business.  She started the business with her former husband in order to generate income for the family. Her business offers repair services and also sells all types of spare parts for appliances to customers in Galapa.

She works every day from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  She purchases her products from large distributors in the city of Barranquilla, which is 20 minutes away from where she lives.  Currently, her biggest-selling items are parts for washing machines, since the market is full of businesses who offer repair services and the owners of these businesses frequently need to perform preventive maintenance on these machines.  

She is currently seeking her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the funds mainly to buy spare parts for washing machines and also to buy parts for steam presses and fans, which are her next biggest-selling items.  With this loan she will have the opportunity to increase her sales even more, as her inventory of products will attract more and more clients, which is just what she needs in order to be successful.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for washing machines and also to buy parts for steam presses and fans, which are her next biggest-selling items.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres  y dos hermanos   actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar almacigo de café para su posterior siembra e  insumos como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado comprar  este almacigo para poder producir un poco mas y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida  para él y sus padres . Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Antonio, age 22, is single and currently lives with his parents and two siblings. He intends to use the loan to buy a coffee seedbed to later use for sowing. He will also buy fertilizers and fumigation. The loan will also help pay for the labor.

He is planning on buying this seedbed in order to be able to produce more and to be able to generate more income. He will do this to get a better quality of life for himself and his parents.

This is the first loan he has gotten from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any other loans with state banks. However, FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant coffee.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es:
La señora Fausta tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, ella vive en la ciudad de Huambutio y pertenece al banco Comunal “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejas, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo leña, residuos de madera y combustibles. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Fausta is 41 years old, married, and as a result of this relationship, she has three children.  She lives in the city of Huambutio and belongs to the community banking group “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” from the Asociación Arariwa, and things are going very well for the group thanks to the punctual payments on their loans.  She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who helps her family to get ahead in life though her business in the creation of clay roofing tiles.  She needs this loan for the opportunity to buy materials for her work, like firewood, wood scraps, and combustibles.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms on her loan.

loans.use: to buy work materials, like firewood, wood scraps, and flammable materials.

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
La señora Regina tiene 61 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene un hijo, ella vive en la ciudad de Huambutio y pertenece al banco Comunal “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella se dedica a brindar servicio de internet, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de la computadoras. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Regina is 61 years old and married, and she has one child.  She lives in the city of Huambutio and is a part of the community banking group “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” in the Asociación Arariwa, and things are going well for them thanks to the punctual payment of their loans.  She is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking woman who helps her family to get ahead and is involved in providing internet services.  She needs this loan to give her the opportunity to do maintenance work on the computers.

The member is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the terms of the loan and make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on the computers.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys tiene 61 años de edad y es casada, ella vive en la ciudad de Huambutio y pertenece al banco Comunal “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella es profesora y desde hace varios años que enseña y le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal para su alimentación y gastos de la casa como pagar luz y el agua. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 61 years old and married, and she lives in the city of Huambutio, where she belongs to the community banking group “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” in the Asociación Arariwa.  Things are going well for them thanks to the timely payment of their loans. She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who helps her family to get ahead, since she is a teacher and for many years she has been teaching and it's going very well for her.  She needs this loan for personal use for her food and the household expenses, like paying for the electrical and water bills.

She is thankful for the loan and promises that she will make her payments punctually in accordance with the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy food and cover the household expenses like paying for the lights and water bills.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.es:
La señora Prisca tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de union libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella vive en la ciudad de Huambutio y pertenece al banco Comunal “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella es una mujer trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella tiene diferentes actividades como por ejemplo se dedica a la venta de productos secos como por ejemplo maíz, cebada, trigo, ella también se dedica a la elaboración de tejas, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como maíz, cebada, trigo y otros cereales mas. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Prisca is 36 and lives with her common law partner and their two children, she lives in the city of Huambutio and belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio" from the Arariwa Association where she does well thanks to the punctual payments she makes, she is a hard working woman that gets her family ahead through different activities such as the sale of dry products such as corn, barley, wheat and she also makes tiles, for this opportunity she requests a loan to buy merchandise such as corn, barley, wheat and other cereals.

She is thankful for the loan and commits to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy corn, barley, wheat and other cereals.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
El socio Valerio continua con su negocio de agencia de viajes ,el vende lo que son diferentes tipos de paquetes turisticos como tours a Machupicchu,City Tours,Valle Sagrado entre otros,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,el socio desea poder continuar trabajando por su familia.
EL socio solicita el credito para la compra de boletos turisticos para la agencia.
texts.en:
Valerio continues in his work running a travel agency.  He sells many different kinds of packages for tourists, like tours of Machupicchu, City Tours, Valle Sagrado, and others.  The member has spent a lot of time in this business, and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into his business every day.  He wants to be able to continue working for his family's sake.

He is asking for this loan to buy tourist tickets for the agency.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets for the travel agency.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es casada y vive en la ciudad de Huambutio y pertenece al banco Comunal “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella se dedica a la venta y comprar de animales menores como cuyes, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal para alimentación de los animales y va comprar algunos cuyes. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Victoria is married and lives in the city of Huambutio and she is a part of the community bank “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” in the Asociación Arariwa and things are going well for them thanks to the punctual payment of their loans.  She is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking woman who helps her family to get ahead, and she is involved in buying and selling small animals like guinea pigs. She needs this loan for her personal use to buy feed for her animals and to buy some guinea pigs.

The member is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the terms of the loan and make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to get animal feed and to buy some guinea pigs.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
La señora Justa tiene 35 años de edad es casada y fruto de esta hemoza relación tiene dos hijos, ella vive en la ciudad de Huambutio y pertenece al banco Comunal “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores para luego venderlos en alguna feria dominical, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal para alimentación de los animales y va comprar algunos cuyes. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Justa is 35 years old and is married, and the result of this beautiful relationship is two children.  She lives in the city of Huambutio and she is a part of the community bank “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” in the Asociación Arariwa, and things are going well for them thanks to the punctual payment of their loans. She is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking woman who helps her family to get ahead and is involved in raising small animals to later sell them at a Sunday market. She needs this loan for her personal use to buy feed for her animals, and she will buy some guinea pigs.

The member is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the terms of the loan and make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, and she's going to buy some guinea pigs.

loans.name: Feri

texts.en: Feri, that is how the community around his area calls him. He is a young man, in his early 20s, and he owns the high spirit to become an enterpreneur. He chose Ruma [Kiva's Field Partner] as his first step. He lives in the eastern part of Jakarta and currently owns an airtime business only. Even when it was still a small business, his shop was nice and clean. So people are interested to come to his shop. Basically, he needs a loan that will help to expand his business to a higher level using a new product from Ruma. The name of the product is Loket Ruma. Loket Ruma is a bill payment service that will help people to pay their household (or sometimes their small businesses) bills using Ruma’s microenterpreneur. Loket Ruma uses electronic data capture to create the payment transactions. The money will be used by Feri to pay the guarantee deposit money to Ruma. With this new product, his neighbors will be able to pay their monthly electricity bill, phone land lines bills and motorcycle installments through him. No need to be in line at the bank! In the future, he hopes that he will be a successful businessman, starting from what he has right now.

loans.use: to pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Santusa, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la docencia en uno de los colegios de su provincia, actividad que hasta ahora le trae muchas satisfacciones puesto que con ella ha podido criar y educar a sus hijos que ahora ya son adultos e independientes. Santusa  está satisfecha con todo el esfuerzo que realizó durante todos estos años y por eso ahora está haciendo algunos cambios a su casa, por ello invertirá su préstamo para renovar y dar mantenimiento a su vivienda, para ello comprará pintura y yeso.
Santusa está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle realizar mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
This member's name is Santusa, and she is a member of the community banking group “Tercer Milenio” from the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Perú.  She continues to be a teacher in one of the schools in her province, an activity that has given her a great deal of satisfaction because she has been able to raise and educate her children, who are now independent adults.  Santusa is satisfied with all the effort she has put forth through all those years, and for this reason, she is now making some changes to her house.  She will invest her loan is refurbishing and doing maintenance on her home, for which she will buy paint and plaster. 

Santusa is very thankful to KIVA for allowing her to make these improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy paint and plaster to do maintenance work on her house.

loans.name: Jesusmide Group

texts.fr: JESUSMIDE est un groupe constitué de quatre personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Jeanne. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Jeanne est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un couturier du nom de Thomas. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Jeanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Jeanne vend des vêtements et des pommades corporels à son domicile depuis près de six ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Jeanne vend des boissons. Jeanne s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Ce prêt permettra certainement à  Jeanne et à son groupe JESUSMIDE de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Jesusmide is a group made up of four persons who are friends living in the same neighborhood.  The group leader (whose hand is raised on the photo) is named Jeanne. In order to increase their working capital this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

Jeanne is 28 years old and is married to a tailor named Thomas. The couple has four children, some of them attend school and all are their dependents. Jeanne lives together with her children and her husband and together they provide for the household expenses. Jeanne did not attend school. To meet her needs and those of her family, Jeanne has been selling clothes and body ointments from her home for the last six years. At the same time, Jeanne also sells drinks. She gets her supplies from a town in Benin. 

This loan will certainly allow Jeanne and her group Jesusmide to enhance the level of their activity and increase their customers and income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Mario Clemente

texts.es: El Sr. Mario  es una persona muy trabajadora indican sus  vecinos, vive en concubinato y  tiene cuatro hijos, alquila un cuarto en Ivirgarzama para vivir, cada día ingresa a su trabajo a las 5 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche, dependiendo de las impertinencias del tiempo, la Asociación de transporte Moto Taxi " 2 de Agosto", a la cual esta afiliado hace 15 años cuenta con diferentes paradas, donde la gente acude a solicitar este servicio, el día que trabaja mas es Domingo, porque  en la zona es día de feria y transita muchísima gente, este día es donde tiene buenos ingresos, para iniciar esta actividad, se compro una motocicleta de medio uso, ahora quiere reemplazar su herramienta de trabajo por una nueva que le dará menos problemas, por tal razon, es que se apersono a nuestra oficina para solicitar un credito, esto le ayudara a tener menos gastos, debido a que no necesitara contar con los servicios de un mecanico lo que le resta sus ingresos.
texts.en: Mario is very hardworking person according to his neighbors, he lives with his common law partner and has four children, he rents a room in Ivirgarzama, each day he goes to work from 5 AM to 11 PM, depending on how time gets in the way.  The motorbike taxi transporting association called "August 2nd", to which he has belonged to for 15 years, it has different stops areas where people go to request taxi service, the day when he is the busiest is Sunday, because it's a holiday and a lot of people go by his area, this is a good day for income, to get started with this activity he bought a used motorbike which he now wants to replace for a new one that will give him less problems, for this reason, he came to our office to request a loan, this will help him have less expenses because he won't need to go to the repair shop which was reducing his income.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to use it as a taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio continua con su negocio de venta de plateria como collares,pulseras,anillos entre otros,el socio trabaja de forma ambulatoria repartiendo su mercaderia a sus clientes que mas le solicitan como el sector turismo,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio cada dia , siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de materiales como plata.
 
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is a part of the community banking group “INTI QUILLA.”  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, and part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member continues to run his business in the sales of silver goods, like necklaces, bracelets, rings, and others.  He works on foot, showing his goods to his customers who want it the most, like the tourist sector.  The member has spent a lot of time in this business, which is going well thank to the effort he puts into it every day, this being the way that he supports his family in getting ahead.

The member is asking for a loan to buy materials like silver.
 
He is happy about the loan and promises to complete his loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials like silver.

loans.name: Shavkatjon

texts.en:
Shavkatjon works hard every day from early morning till late evening. He is a very hardworking man. 

For more than 16 years, he has had his own business, and his skills and experiences help him to develop the business. In the local market he sells shoes and has a wide assortment of goods. Because his goods have a wide assortment, he attracts many customers. He is one of the successful businessmen between other businessmen. 

He has five lovely children and tries to do the best for them. His wife is a kind woman and helps him with the business. 

He wants to develop his business further, but his income isn’t enough for it. He is asking for a loan to buy men's shoes for the new season. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase new men's shoes for sale.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is 35 years old and lives in Alegria, Pagadian City. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Emelinda has a business selling rice cakes, juice, and ice candy (a frozen treat) at her stall outside the school. She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Emelinda has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Emelinda has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, she would like to make her food stall a canteen and soon have a restaurant on her own.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Josefina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la venta de chicha de quinua, actividad que como ella misma manifiesta le va muy bien además este negocio le da para mantener a su casa. Josefina en esta oportunidad invertirá su préstamo para comprar los insumos que le permitan elaborar su chicha de quinua, y  para ello comprará insumos como azúcar, y quinua.
Josefina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse con su actividad y llevar el sustento a su casa.
texts.en:
This member is named Josefina, and she is a part of the community banking group “Tercer Milenio” from the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Perú.  Our member is involved in the sale of an alcoholic fermented quinoa beverage called "chicha de quinua."  This is an activity which she says is going very well and that the business proceeds go to the household expenses.  Josefina will use this opportunity to invest her loan in buying the raw products that allow her to make the "chicha de quinua," and so she will buy materials like sugar and quinoa.

Josefina is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to continue with her business and helping to sustain her household.

loans.use: to buy groceries like quinoa and sugar.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with four children. She is 35 years old and lives in Balangasan, Pagadian City.

Helen sells breads, cakes, ice candy (a frozen treat), and ice juice to earn a living. She has had this business for four years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Helen has been a member of PMPC for more than three years. In the future, she hopes to have a bakery, selling cakes and pastries on her own trademark.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Jeane

texts.en:
Jeane is married with four children. She is 40 years old and lives in Dumagoc, Pagadian City.

Jeane sells dry goods just to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her wholesale business.

Jeane has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to buy a truck for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her wholesale business

loans.name: San Miguel Kuña Renda Group

texts.es:
En la  Ciudad de Caaguazú, surge el grupo San Miguel Kuña Renda, quienes están en el primer ciclo del programa, donde están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una de estas 12 mujeres es Lucia, quien vende todo tipo de comestibles, cuenta que al principio le costó un poco, pero que luego gracias a su buena sazón fue ganándose clientes, y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, harina, verduras, hortalizas y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende.
texts.en:
The group San Miguel Kuña Renda was formed in the city of Caaguazú.  They are in their first loan cycle of the program, where they are learning to work together and help each other.

One of these 12 women is Lucia, who sells all types of food. She tells us that at first it was a little hard, but then thanks to the good flavor of her food, she won more customers, and now she has a very good clientele.

She is applying for the loan to buy meat, condiments, flour, greens, vegetables, and other ingredients so that she can continue making the good food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, flour, greens, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is 65 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with four children. 

Jesus has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to be used in purchasing feed for his existing hog-fattening business. 

Jesus has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, he hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his existing hog-fattening business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 65 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  He is widowed with four children. 

Carlos has a hollow block-making business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to be used to purchase construction materials for house repair. 

Carlos has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Carlos hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a seamstress, who sews clothes for her community clients. She is very skillful and charges very reasonable rates for her work. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month.

Her husband sells wood. Natural gas is not available in all the areas of this city, and that’s why wood is used here for cooking.

Khalida is a mother of three daughters and two sons. Two of them are getting their education, while the others are illiterate.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah so she can further improve her sewing business.  With the loan, she will buy clothes of different varieties for sewing. This will help her make more sales and income.


Note: "In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Khalida."

loans.use: To buy clothes for sewing

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 49 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Rosario has a general store. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Rosario has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en: Guldasta is as beautiful as a flower because the meaning of her name is ‘flower’. She is a very kind and hardworking woman. Guldasta is a widow and has 4 children. Her older son is married and Guldasta has a grandchild and loves him very much. Guldasta is as good with her family as she is in business. She has own her business for 15 years. She sells national women’s pants. She sells the pants which are sewed by her daughters and daughter-in-law. She has many customers as her goods have a wide assortment. She is asking for a loan to buy fabrics for developing her business. Please, help her to improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su segundo  ciclo es un comité ejemplar donde las miembros se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias a salir adelante.
Zonia es una de las integrantes del grupo y cuenta que se dedica a la costura. Ella se define a si misma como una persona con muchas ganas y espíritu de superación, que es por lo que se esfuerza, y con lo cual esta saliendo adelante. Cuenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo crecer y salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás con lo que podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y a la vez ir abriéndose camino en su vida de microempresaria.
texts.en:
This group is going through its second cycle, it's an exemplary committee where the members work hard to get ahead and help their families.
Zonia is one of the members of the group and works as a seamstress.  She describes herself as a person with drive and an ambitious spirit, reason why she works hard and is getting ahead.  She started with very little, but thanks to her effort she has grown her business and succeeded.

She requests a loan to buy fabric, thread, elastics, buttons and other items to be able to complete the requests from her clients and make her way through as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastics, buttons and other.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 33 years old and lives in Comunal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 5 children.

Evelyn owns a photography and lamination business and earns approximately 2500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase materials for her photography and lamination business.

Evelyn is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her photography and lamination business

loans.name: Luiz Mario

texts.es: Luis Mario, tiene la edad  de 45 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar semilla de chile y tomate e insumos como abonos y fumigaciones. El tiene pensado realizar las dos plantaciones  de chile y tomate y darle el adecuado mantenimiento para su posterior venta en el mercado local y lugares aledaños y en la feria del pueblo y así poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Luis Mario is 45 years old, and he is married and currently lives with his wife.  Plans to use the loan to buy pepper and tomato plant seeds and other items like fertilizers and insecticides.  He has thought about making two different plantings of peppers and tomatoes and giving them good care so that he can then sell them in the local market and neighboring regions and in the town market, and thus he will be able to have a larger income and a better quality of life and economic stability.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has never before been given a loan from a large bank, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with great ease and at a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to plant peppers and tomatoes.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “La victoria”  en honor a la lucha que representa luchar día a día para sobrevivir. El grupo está en su decimo primer ciclo y lo han logrado por medio de la unión de todas ellas.
La Sra.  Rosa quien es la presidenta cuenta que con mucha lucha y sacrificio ayuda a su familia y esta solventando el día a día de los gastos. Cuenta que vende todo tipo de comidas, como ser empanada, sándwich, croquetas y demás. Tiene buena clientela ya que todos sus productos son muy buenos y eso le ayuda mucho. Su meta es algún día poder tener un gran copetín y así seguir deleitando a sus clientes.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de huevos, harina, carne, condimentos y demás insumos que necesita para poder seguir con su trabajo. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas reciben de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "The Victory" to honor the day-by-day struggle to survive. This group is in its 10th loan cycle, and they have succeeded through the unity of all the members.

Señora Rosa, who is the president, tells us that with great effort and sacrifice she helps her family and is paying the day-to-day expenses. She sells every type of food, such as empanadas, sandwiches, croquettes, and other items. She has a good customer base, since all her products are very good, and this helps her a lot. Her goal is to some day have a big fast food counter and thus continue to delight her customers.

She is applying for the loan to purchase eggs, flour, meat, condiments, and other ingredients that she needs so that she can continue with her work. She is thankful for the opportunity that she and her friends receive from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, meat, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries including noodles, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Rajabmoh

texts.en:
Rajabmoh is a woman who likes to work hard. She is very clever and industrious. 

Rajabmoh has had her own business for more than 14 years.  She sells national women’s pants, and has a kiosk in the local market.  Sewers bring her pants they've sewed for her to sell.  Rajabmoh gives fabrics to them, and also pays their salaries.  

Her experiences have helped her to develop her business, but her income is small. She has four children and a kind husband, who is a taxi driver. Rajabmoh’s children are small yet and can’t help her. She is asking for a loan to buy fabrics for sewing pants so she can widen the assortment of her goods. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Christine est une veuve de 50 ans, mère de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 16 et 26 ans et tous vont encore à l'école. Christine est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 6 ans déjà ou elle commercialise les poissons frais, elle achète un carton à chaque fois pour le détaille mais ça rapporte peu alors que c'est grâce à cette activité qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille.  Elle est obligé de tous faire écouler à cause de son capital pourtant elle a déjà de l'expérience dans ce domaine et une clientèle fidèle. C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit qui donnera l'opportunité de s'acheter des cartons de poisson et de crevettes pour augmenter ses ventes, satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses bénéfices qu'elle réinvestira dans son activité parce qu'elle aimerai ouvrir une poissonnerie dans un avenir proche.Elle pourra aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Christine is a widow aged 50, mother of five children whose ages range from 16 to 26 years old. They are all still attending school. Christine has been a fishmonger in a market in the capital for six years already, selling fresh fish. She buys a carton each time to retail, but that brings in very little, whereas she counts on this business to support her family. She is obliged to sell off all of it because of her capital and yet she has experience in this domain and a faithful clientele. For this reason she is requesting a loan which will give her the opportunity to buy cartons of fish and shrimp to expand her sales, satisfy her customers, and increase her profit which she will reinvest in her business, since she would like to open up a fish shop in the near future. She will also be able to cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fish and shrimp

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 63 years old and lives in Sebac,Tudela. She is married with two children. 
Norma is a government employee and earns approximately PHP 38,500 each month.Norma has requested a loan of 20000 for house repair. 
Norma has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Norma hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal needs.

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is 50 years old and lives in Polangyuta, Siquijor, Philippines.  She is married and has four school-aged children.  

Susie displays of gasoline in the small village of Polangyuta to earn a living and has had this business for 28 years in operation.  She requested a loan to use as working capital for her existing business.

Susie is a new member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. In the future, Susie dreams to expand her business and hopes to acquire another space for her retail business.

loans.use: To purchase "Fuel" retail in the village of Polangyuta, Siquijor

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is married with one child. She is 28 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay, the Philippines.

Mary Joy sells rice and corn to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 50,000 PHP to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Mary Joy has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is from Guingona, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. He is 47 years old, married, and the father of six children. 

To make a living, Virgilio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising bananas. Virgilio has been in his business for six years and earns PHP 3,500 a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Virgilio joined GDMPC.  He is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise bananas. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants for raising bananas.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 34 years old and married with four children.

Julieta is in the agricultural business, farming fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetables.

Julieta has been farming fruits and vegetables for five years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetables garden.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth lives in Romarate, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old and married, with six children. She makes a living by providing motorcycle taxi services to people in her community. She been in this business for 12 years and earns PHP 11,000 a month from her work. 

In 2010, Lilibeth joined GDMP in 2010. She has applied for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle taxi business.

loans.name: Song's Group

texts.en: Thmor Koul district of Battambang province is the residential area of Song and his family. He is 30 years old and has three dependent children who are still at school. For 20 years, he and his wife have been planting paddy rice to overcome the family's hardship. To earn more income, they also sell vegetables at the traditional market. Song’s group consists of three members; he and one member are in fifth cycle while another member is in fourth cycle. He completely paid back the entire past loans which have helped him to relieve the family’s burden and to have a decent house. He is applying for a loan of 800,000 KHR and is going to use his portion as the group leader to buy fertilizers for his rice field and more vegetables for selling. He hopes to earn more income from current businesses and better off his family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice field and more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Virgencita De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El Comite Virgencita de Caacupe esta ubicado en el Chaco, estan en el tercer ciclo, y cuentan que gracias al apoyo en conjunto de todas ellas están saliendo adelante y se ayudan a mejorar su estilo de vida.
La  Sra Ana, una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de escobas, y aunque es un trabajo difícil y sacrificado está orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es el medio por el cual mantiene a su familia. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de escobas, con lo cual tendrá un buen stock y de esa forma seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras reciben.
texts.en: The Group "Virgencita de Caacupe" is located in Chaco, they are going through their third cycle, and they tell us that thanks to the support they give each other they are getting ahead and help each other to improve their lifestyle.  Ana is one of the members of the group and sells brooms, even though her job is difficult and she has to make sacrifices she is proud of what she does because it's the way she supports her family.  She requests a loan to buy brooms, to increase her stock and meet the demand of her customers.  She is thankful for the opportunity that her and her group members get.

loans.use: to buy brooms for sale.

loans.name: Nila Margarita

texts.es:
Santo Domingo es una ciudad ecuatoriana, capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, es la cuarta ciudad más poblada del Ecuador, en los últimos tiempos, Santo Domingo se ha desarrollado demográfica, tecnológica y comercialmente además de mejorar su infraestructura vial y urbana ya que es la vía que conecta la sierra y la costa.
Es una zona climática lluviosa subtropical, el principal atractivo del cantón es la naturaleza, ya que posee una muy alta biodiversidad, en la actualidad y gracias a la cantidad de bosques de distintos tipos, es considerada por científicos ambientales como laboratorio para la investigación genética mundial.
Así como la ciudad crece, crecen muchos emprendedores, es el caso de Nila. Ella es una mujer luchadora de 22 años que da lo mejor de sí cada día por salir adelante y mejorar no sólo su vida, sino también la de sus dos hijos. Es la primera vez que acude a Fundación Alternativa, institución mediadora entre Kiva y cada emprendedor para solicitar ayuda económica, espera aumentar  su materia prima y seguir trabajando. Inició su negocio de reparación y realización de calzador hace cuatro años y espera que su negocio crezca al igual que la ciudad, que cada día sigue expandiendo sus fronteras. Ella sueña con tener un taller más grande y aumentar su producción y popularidad. Ella sabe que el esfuerzo y responsabilidad que demuestra cada día es lo que va a hacer que ella crezca y expanda su negocio.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo is an Ecuadoran city, and the capital of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, and it is the fourth most populated city in Ecuador.  Lately, Santo Domingo has seen great development in terms of the demographics, technology, and commercially, as well as improving its highway infrastructure and the urban roads, since this is the route that connects the mountains to the coast.

This is a rainy and subtropical climate region, and the principal attraction of this region is the natural beauty, since is possesses a great amount of biodiversity, and currently thanks to the quantity of different types of forests, it is considered by many climate scientists to be to be a labratory for the investigation of the world's genetic diversity.

Just as the city has grown, many entrepreneurs have grown businesses, such as is the case with Nila.  She is an ambitious woman of 22 years who gives her best to every day so that she can get ahead and improve not only her own life, but also that of her two children.  This is the first time that she has come to Fundación Alternativa, and intermediary institution between Kiva and each individual entrepreneur who asks for economic help.  She wants to supplement her raw materials and continues working.  She began her business of repairs and creation of new shoes about four years ago, and she hopes that her business will grow the same as the city is growing, and that every day she will continue to expand her horizons.

She dreams of having a larger workshop and augmenting her production and her popularity.  She knows that her strength and the responsibility that she shows every day is what will help her to expand and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like leather and insoles.

loans.name: Progresando Group

texts.es:
El Comite Progresando está en el primer ciclo del programa de la fundación paraguaya. Son 10 mujeres que se han unido para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio de ese trabajo darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
Patricia es miembro del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de carbón, y cuenta que es un buen negocio ya que últimamente el carbón es muy solicitado ya que el gas es muy caro. Desea poder seguir trabajando para poder seguir ayudando a su familia y cubrir los gastos de la casa.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón, y de esa forma seguir dando a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The Comite Progresando is in its first loan cycle with the Fundación Paraguaya program. They are 10 women that have united to be able to held each other and through this work, give their children a better future. 

Patricia is one member of the group. She makes a living selling charcoal and has a good business since lately charcoal is in high demand due to gas being very expensive. She hopes to continue working to be able to continue helping her family and covering the household expenses. She is requesting the loan to buy charcoal. In this way she continues giving her family all that they need.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en: Five years ago, Sharofat began her own business. Her hard work and aspirations help her to be the best in business. She sells national women’s pants in the local market.Sharofat buys fabrics and gives them to seamstresses. They sew pants and then Sharofat sells them. She has many customers as her goods come in a wide assortment. Sharofat has four children and a kind husband. Her husband is also a businessman and he has a lot of work and can’t to help his wife with her business. Sharofat manages her business alone. She wants to develop her business further and that’s why she is asking for a loan to buy fabrics for sewing pants. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Maqsooda's Group

texts.en:
Maqsooda has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who is attached to a printing and binding business. With the loan investment he will buy paper for printing and iron for binding purposes. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Maqsooda has full confidence in him that he will become more successful in his business after investing the loan.

She is a housewife, remaining at her home and doing her household responsibilities. She has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works in an auto workshop while her two younger children are getting their education.

Maqsooda knows the importance of education very well and hopes that she will be able to continue providing education to her children in future.

Note: In the photo the lady raising her hand is Maqsooda.

loans.use: To buy paper and other material for printing and binding business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be an honest and determined woman. She operates a general store where she sells clothes and detergents she makes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more clothes and raw materials for making detergent for sale. Her business goal is to run another general store selling clothes and detergent within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and raw materials for making detergents for selling.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is 42 years old and she is married; she has got seven children, and her husband is a businessman. She has a kiosk in front of her home, to supply people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including coffee, biscuits, soap, cigarettes, and sugar. 

Albina started with her own working capital of $ 200 in 2011. She has a farm to grow vegetables. She hopes that with the income she can build a good house for her family in the future.

loans.use: To buy coffee, biscuits, soap, cigarettes, and sugar.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a newly recognized member of PMPC.  He is married with five adult children.  He is residing in Sawang, Maria, Siquijor.  He is encouraged to be a member of the coop to have financial access for his business.  He intends to use the PMPC loan for additional capital for buying and selling scrap materials. He believes that through hard work with the help of God, he can increase the earnings of the business to save for his retirement.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: This time, Eva is borrowing PHP 20,000 to fund her computer rental business. The general store business that she previously funded through Kiva partner, NWTF, continues to provide for Eva and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: To fund her computer rental business

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en: Sor, 45, is a widow mother and has two children. To earn a living, Sor has been selling fish at the traditional market for 10 years. From the current business, she is able to earn about 15,300 KHR per day. Sor has been with VisionFund for three loans already. All the loans, which have helped her to smoothly manage her fish selling business, have been repaid with success. She and her co-member are applying for new loan in amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. Sor, the group leader, will use her portion to buy more fish to resale. She hopes to earn more profit so she can improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Sarieng's Group

texts.en:
Sarieng is 34 years old and living in the village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a widow and has two dependent children who are still in school. To support her family, Sarieng has been selling fish and raising pigs for three years. From her current business, she can earn approximately KHR 20,000 per day for her family’s daily needs. 

In this group of two members, Sarieng is the group leader. She has been with VisionFund for seven cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to earn a better living. Now she and her co-member are applying for a new loan of KHR 1,400,000 KHR and 1,200,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more piglets for raising and fishes for sale. She hopes this loan will enable her to live in proper conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy piglets for raising and fishes for sale

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 50 years old. She is married and has seven children.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Lilia has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns income from raising livestock.

Lilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is 54 years old and single. He works very hard to provide for his parents and for his nephews. 

Ramon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Ramon has been in this business for 32 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, noodles, etc.. 

In the future Ramon would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.en: Kunduz likes to eat sweets. Eighteen years ago she began her own business selling sweets and biscuits, chocolates, nuts, etc. In the local market she has her own sales venue and a lot of customers. Her colleagues know her as clever and serious. She works hard to develop her business but her income is small. She has six children and a lovely husband. Her children help her with the business. She is asking for a loan to buy goods for developing the business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy biscuits and nuts to expand her business

loans.name: Oscar Jose Luis

texts.es: El cliente Oscar , es un señor de 23 años de edad, esta casado el cliente trabaja en una empresa de Telecomunicaciones en la ciudad de Cochabamba, actualmente el cliente vive por la zona norte de la ciudad, aproximadamente a 7 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente no es propia, el cliente vive con su esposa y su familia en anticrético, ambos tienen 1 hijo dependiente y el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la compra de mercadería, debido a que su esposa se dedica a la venta de accesorios de limpieza, en la actualidad la mercadería que la cliente maneja esta muy caro, y necesita el capital para el negocio, ya que se esta agotando el contrato de anticrético de la casa donde viven y necesitan mejorar su comercialización para mejorar su estatus de vida.
texts.en:
The client, Oscar, is a 23 year old man. He is married and works in a Telecommunications business in the city of Cochabamba. He currently lives in the northern region of the city, approximately 7 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. The house in which he lives is not his own. He lives in the house with his wife and family on a rent-free basis through the use of an upfront loan which is paid back upon completion of the rental period. 

They have one child who is dependent on them. The purpose of the loan from the institution is to buy merchandise because his wife makes a living selling cleaning accessories. Currently the products that the customer manages is very expensive and needs the capital for the business because the rental contact is exhausting itself. They need to improve their marketing to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cleaning accessories.

loans.name: Juleta

texts.en:
Juleta has been engaged in animal breeding and gardening in Lusadzor village for a long time. She rears three cows, three calves, five pigs and some chickens as well. In her garden Juleta grows vegetables and fruit. Juleta's accent is on figs and Oriental persimmons grown for sale. Also she is able to sell produced milk and cheese directly from her house. 

Juleta says that her agricultural business allows her to provide for her family and therefore she intends to develop it. For that reason she is asking for a $3,000 loan to buy one more cow for her farm and also to stock a large lot of fodder for her farm animals.   
 
Juleta is 50 years old. She is married and has two children. Juleta’s daughter is married and she lives separately from her parents. Juleta’s son and his family live with Juleta and they help her with the farming. Juleta’s husband now is living and working in Russia. 

This is Juleta’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy one more cow for her farm and also to stock a large lot of fodder for her farm animals

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard, who is 30 years old, has a taxi business in Nakuru town and has been in the business for one year. He is married to Clara and they have two children aged six and one years old.

This will be his first loan and he plans to use the loan amount to buy spare parts and repair his taxi and keep it in good condition. With the anticipated profits, he plans to buy a plot.

In the future, Benard hopes to grow his business by buying another taxi as well as to make more income and be able to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repair his taxi.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Oun is aged 49 years old. She is a married mother of five children, only one of whom is dependent on her and works at the family’s business.

To earn a living, Oun works as a rice farmer. She has been in this business for several years and earns about 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Oun’s group consists of two members who are applying for their first microloans with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Oun is requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 from VisionFund, while her group member is applying for 800,000 KHR. 

As the leader of the group, she will use her loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make their living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Uimailuma

texts.en: Uimailuma is a 42-year-old woman who is married with one child. She runs a business sewing clothes to sell in her community. She has five years of experience with this business. Uimailuma has requested a loan to buy materials, threads and a  electric sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to expand her business from home to town. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads, and a  eletric sewing machine

loans.name: Ma. Magdalina

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalina is 47 years old, married, and has two children, ages 16 and 19. She is a restaurant owner from Tangnan, Panglao, Bohol. She and her husband work in their restaurant to make it profitable. 

Magdalina is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy ingredients like fish, pork, beef, chicken, soft drinks, and three sacks of rice. She dreams of improving her business because her main goal is to see her children graduate from college. A business that is sustainable and profitable will surely help her family to have a good life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, pork, beef, chicken, soft drinks, and three sacks of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua con su negocio de venta de artesania ,la socia cuenta con un local donde vende toda su mercaderia a sus clientes que mas le solicitan como turistas,la socia vende diferentes tipos de mercaderia como chompas,polos,chalinas,guantes entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de chompas de alpaca.
                                                                                           
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is a part of the community banking group “INTI QUILLA.”  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, a part of the Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

She continues to work in her business of craft sales.  She owns a location where she sells all of her merchandise to her customers who are the most eager for her goods, like tourists.  The member sells different kinds of merchandise, like sweaters, polo shirts, scarves, gloves, and other items.
