texts.en: The venture bank PRIMAVERA – 26 is made up of eight members, five women and three men. The president of the bank, Carla, is 32 years old and has a seven-year-old child. Her business is selling cosmetics from a catalog. She sells her products on foot, visiting homes and public and private offices in the city of La Paz, where she offers her products. This is her first loan series with the institution. Carla is going to use this loan to buy cosmetics and jewelry wholesale and on sale, and in this way provide a variety of products to her customers and increase her profits. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Carla is going to utilize the profits to continue buying a variety of beauty products. Carla is a hard-working person who feels happy because of the opportunity provided to her, since her fellow group members, some of them are supporting their families alone.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wholesale cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.en:
Rolanda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Rolanda sells perfumes in their community. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase perfumes to resell.

Rolanda became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of perfumes to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has a motorcycle business in Nakuru town, has been in the business for the past two years, and it has been profitable. He is 45 years old, married to Susan, and they have four children.

This will be his first loan and he plans to use the amount to buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle. He also plans to use part of the loan amount to renew his motorcycle insurance. With the anticipated income he plans to buy a taxi.

In the future Peter hopes to venture more into the transport business, make more income and be able to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Saraphina

texts.en: Saraphina is a 58-year-old single woman. She has a son. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, kale, onions and cabbage. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of vegetables for resale. She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy a water tank. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have increased her daily income from her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a water tank worth Kes 21,000

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Analyn became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.en: When Yusufjon began his own business 12 years ago, his living condition was very difficult as his income was little and it was not enough for living. Now, he is one of the best businessmen. He is busy with gardening. He has a garden where there are a lot of apricot trees. He dries apricots and makes ‘kuraga’ and then sells it to local people. His business has been developing year by year but his family is big and he needs more money. He wants to buy cattle and in this way get additional income. He and his 5 children await your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Carlos Martin

texts.es: Carlos Martin de 39 años de edad, casado, con cinco hijos todos bajo su responsabilidad ya todos estudian, este emprendedor tiene por actividad economica molino y siembre de caña de azucar en su localidad, tiempo de tener el negocio 16 años, el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion este emprendedor se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre, trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superacion personal, ya que dicha forma se ha propuesto cumplir su objectivo y metas en un futuro, el objectivo del prestamos es adquirir un motor eletrico para el molino de mayor potencia para brindar un mejor servicio y poder consumir menos energia y bajar sus costos de energia eletrica
texts.en: Carlos Martin is 39 years old and married with five children who he is responsible for since they all study. This businessman's economic activity is milling and sowing sugarcane in his town. The business, which he has had for 16 years, is located in his home. This entrepreneur is characterized as a man who is hard-working, responsible, with the personal will to overcome, since that is the way he has proposed to fulfill his objectives and goals in the future. The goal of the loans is to acquire a more powerful electric motor for the mill to provide better service and be able to consume less energy and lower his electricity costs.

loans.use: to buy a more powerful electric motor for the mill to provide better service.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan lives with his parents in Spandarian village, Armenia. The family is involved in agriculture. They raise cows, sheep and chickens and also cultivate potato and barley. Vardan needs to finance the transportation of their potato and barley harvest and their milk products. With the help of a loan he will purchase 300 liters of petrol and 500 liters of diesel fuel. This is important for Vardan to organize sales of his family's produce and hence gather enough income to sustain his family.

loans.use: to pay for fuel for transportation of farm produce

loans.name: Salameh

texts.en:
Salameh is a 59-year-old married man with no children. He opened a small shop in Nabatieh, Lebanon, in 2005, where he sells perfumes, accessories and toys. He enjoys running this kind of business, and works on improving it as much as he can. 

Salameh is a loyal Al Majmoua borrower and this is his seventh loan cycle. He invested the money from his previous loans in his business through adding new products. Today, Salameh is requesting a new loan due to the improvements it will bring to both his social and financial situations. He will again increase his business capital with newly-released products.

He is so excited about this loan because he will use it to respond to his customers' needs. He is always planning to expand his business as much as he can and he hopes to start trading wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to purchase newly-released products for his shop

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Rosalinda has a rice farm. She has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to buy fertilizer for the rice farm.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 47 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Getrude has been working hard to manage her shop, which sells video tapes, CDs and DVDs. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase another computer, video tapes, CDs and DVDs. This will help Getrude to generate greater profits so she can expand the business. Getrude hopes that in the future she will be able to live a good life. 

Getrude is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Getrude who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase another computer, video tapes, CDs and DVDs for her shop

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Melanie provides motorela (a three-wheeled vehicle powered by a motorcycle) or motorcycle services. Her husband is the driver. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

Melanie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Melanie hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson will use the loan to service his motorbike. He will also use part of the loan to buy a goat for rearing since this will be another source of income for the family. This will be his second loan from KADET LTD. Benson repaid his previous loan well and in good time. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to boost the farming business for his wife and to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Magellan Robert

texts.fr: Magellan est un homme de 37 ans,fiancé,père de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 02 et 08 ans.Deux de ces derniers vont déjà à l'école.Il est commerçant dans un quartier de la capitale économique depuis 03 ans où il vend des accessoires téléphoniques et des téléphones portables. La vente d'accessoires téléphonique est une activité qui fonctionne bien,mais cependant il est confronté à un problème d'insuffisance de son stock par rapport à la demande, car son capital ne lui permet pas de renouveler rapidement ce stock lorsque celui-ci  est en alerte afin de satisfaire la clientèle en attente.Problème qui crée une baisse progressive de sa clientèle et de ses ventes.Il voudrait donc ce crédit afin d'acheter des accessoires téléphoniques en grande quantité ce qui lui évitera les ruptures de stock , répondra à la demande de ses clients et augmentera ses bénéfices.Bénéfices qui lui permettront de développer son affaire et surtout de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Magellan is a 37-year-old man who is engaged and the father of 3 children aged between 2 and 8. Two of his children already attend school. Magellan is a retailer and has been selling mobile phones and accessories for 3 years in one of the districts of the economic capital. The sale of mobile phone accessories is a profitable area of business, but Magellan faces the problem of having insufficient inventory with which to fulfill demand, as his capital does not enable him to restock quickly enough for the customers who are left waiting. This is a problem which is causing his sales and customer numbers to progressively diminish. He would therefore like this loan so that he is able to buy a large amount of phone accessories and avoid stock shortages, which will will enable him to respond to customer demand and raise his profits. The profits will allow him to develop his business and, above all, to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories (batteries, chargers, smart cards).

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Elvira provides motorela or motorcycle services, as her husband is the driver. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom Gilles Pulchérie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Gilles Pulchérie est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin. Gilles Pulchérie n’a pas été à l’école. Gilles Pulchérie est mariée à un certain Raymond et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Gilles Pulchérie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Gilles Pulchérie vend depuis quinze ans, tissus et des chaussures par le système de distribution. Gilles Pulchérie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Gilles Pulchérie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group "God is great" is made up of 3 people who live in the same area. The group's representative, Gilles Pulchérie, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. Gilles Pulchérie is 44 years old and lives in Benin. She has no schooling. She is married to a man called Raymond and is the mother of 3 dependent children, who all go to school.  Gilles Pulchérie lives together with her husband and children and the couple both take care of the household responsibilities. In order to be able to contribute to the various household expenses, Gilles Pulchérie has been selling fabrics and shoes via the distribution system for 15 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin.

With a view to satisfying her customers and in order to increase her turnover and revenue, Gilles Pulchérie is requesting a 2nd loan from ALIDé, together with the other member of the "God is great" group. The first loan has been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes.

loans.name: Luisa Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Luisa de 62 años de edad, es casada , tiene 3 hijos , se dedica al comercio, dueña de una pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación . Este negocio lo inicio hace dos años después que la jubilaron pues antes trabajaba como secretaria , pero al retirarse decidió vivir del negocio de la pulpería , la cual atiende ella misma. Ella necesita el crédito para comprar arros, frijoles , azúcar,leche , enlatados, producto de limpieza , avenas. Pues son productos  que se venden mas rapidos  de los cuales no pueden carecer pues la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan a diario. Uno de sus propósitos es ampliar su pulpería y ofrecer productos variado de mucho consumo y necesidad en los hogares.
texts.en: Luisa is 62 years old, and married with three children.  She is the owner of a general store that she has in her home.  She started this business two years ago, after she retired from her secretarial job.  However, when she retired, she decided to make her living from the general store business, which she takes care of herself.  She needs the loan to purchase rice, beans, sugar, milk, canned goods, cleaning products, and oats.  These are products that she sells the most quickly so she must have them on hand because most of her customers request them daily.  One of her goals is to expand her general store and offer a variety of highly consumed, essential household products.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, milk, canned goods, cleaning products, and oats.

loans.name: Baasandash

texts.en:
Baasandash, 28, is a monk who is experienced at divination. Currently he lives with his wife in an old rental house in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. They do not have any children. 

Mr Baasandash's earnings are very variable - sometimes he can earn a lot of money and sometimes he has only a few customers. He has been operating his business for 11 years nonstop. His wife, Osorjin, 30, makes casual clothes at her home and sells them to her regular customers. She buys raw materials for her clothes from the markets in far away Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. To transport the materials to her home, she hires a driver, which is a large expense due to the costs of fuel and wages. 

As a result, she and Baasandash haved decided to buy a car which runs on natural gas. They both know that using a gas-powered car is a progressive idea and important for saving the health of people and the environment. So they need about 3,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to cover the costs of purchasing the car for the tailoring business.

loans.use: to purchase a natural-gas powered car for his wife’s tailoring business

loans.name: Salame

texts.en:
Salame is a 34-year-old fish monger in Kilifi and a widowed mother of three who has been successfully conducting this business for the last five years. This will mark her third business loan with KADET LTD which she will use to purchase more tilapia, Nile perch, and sardines to resell to her customers. The anticipated profits will be used to buy more stocks of fish and repay her loan.

Salame hopes to realize more profits from her sales and thus be able to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more tilapia, Nile perch, and sardines to resell

loans.name: Mastur

texts.en: Bapak Mastur lives in a city called Serang, about two hours' driving from Jakarta. The name "Bapak" is very famous – it's used for an older man in a village community. Bapak Mastur owns a small grocery shop that sells a lot of Indonesian household basic needs such as sugar, rice, flour, eggs and basic toiletries. Ruma [Kiva's Field Partner] recently created a new product line that will help its microenterpreneurs to serve customers better. Its new product is called Loket Ruma. The premise for becoming a Loket Ruma agent is to provide a bill payment service for the customer. Bapak Mastur’s customers will be able to pay their household (or even their small business) payments such as electricity, or even motorcycle installments, in his shop. For Loket Ruma, Bapak Mastur will be using an electronic data capture (EDC) machine. This machine will create a payment transaction for Bapak Mastur's customers. This loan from Kiva will be used to pay the guarantee deposit money for an EDC. Bapak Mastur is married and has four children that live in and around the city. His oldest child is 28 years old, followed by a 26-year-old, a 24-year-old, and the youngest is 14 years old. His last child is the baby of the family. By becoming a Loket Ruma agent, he hopes that his small grocery shop will have an extra value added service. People will come to his shop and do more transactions there.

loans.use: to pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Rufa sells fish in their community. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy a variety of fish to resell.

Rufa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rufa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to resell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 31-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be aggressive businesswoman. She operates a retail business and a farm where she sells clean water and vegetables such as maize, beans, etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located at a dry area which has a lot of demand for clean water supply and her primary customers are residents from the environs. 

Eunice describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a water tank to increase water supply services to the customers. Her business goal is to dig her own borehole  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have  bought a bigger tank for tapping clean water so as to meet the customer demand.

loans.use: to buy a water tank worth Kes 8,700

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a 26-year-old business lady. She is married to John, who is a businessman. They are blessed with one child. 

She has operated a photocopy and printing business for the past one year with the monthly income of KES 10,000.
 
She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Fridah will use the loan to buy a new photocopier machine. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will buy printing papers and plain papers. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open a stationery shop and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier machine.

loans.name: Rebelita

texts.en:
Rebelita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Rebelita provides motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for nine years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Rebelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rebelita hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 26 years old and a single man from Olkalou.

Joseph is a farmer and has been in this business for the past 5 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a dairy cow to use in his farm for milk production.

He hopes to sell a lot of milk in the near future and be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to use in his farm for milk production.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Nida sells snacks in her local community, like hot cakes and banana cake. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks, like sugar, flour, and cheese.

Nida has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.en:
Abdujabor is a clever man with a high degree. He is an economist in the collective farm. Also he has a garden and has been busy with making and selling dried fruit. He collects the harvest from his apricot garden, makes ‘kuraga’ and sells it to local people at a low price. It is the main source of his income.  

As he is very hard working and glorious, his business has developing year by year. He has a lovely wife and four clever children. His wife is a worker and tries to do the best for her family. She works at the collective farm. Abdujabor wants to develop his business but he needs your help with money. If you will help him to get a loan, he would buy dried fruits for developing his business. He awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for developing his business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 29 years old, married and blessed with two children that he supports. He has been a maize farmer  for the past five years. His monthly income is KES.15,000.

He has applied for a loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD; it will facilitate purchase of farm inputs.


He intends to use anticipated profits to reinvest to the business. His future dreams is to have a stable business

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 42 years old,single and lives in the Philippines.

Norma is buying and selling beauty products from AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase beauty products from AVON like face powder, facial cream and body lotion.

Norma has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Norma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products from AVON

loans.name: Dody

texts.en:
Dody is a 37-year-old man and is married to Yohana, a 30-year-old lady. They are blessed with a son: Glen, 4 years old. Last year Dody decided to initiate a kiosk business at home in order to generate additional income for his family. Yohana assists him in running and managing the business. Several daily basic needs, snacks, detergent, shampoo, etc. are available in his kiosk. 

Dody would like to add more products to be sold in his kiosk and to renovate his house but he doesn’t have enough money to do so. Therefore, Dody submitted a loan application and requested a loan amounting to IDR 7,500,000 from TLM. He would like to spend the loan on more kiosk products i.e. snacks, instant noodles, soap, detergent, mobile phone recharge and also building material.

loans.use: to buy more kiosk products i.e. snacks, instant noodles, soap, detergent, mobile phone recharge and also building material.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 29 years old and is married with three children. Jean Pierre sells various goods such as: sugar, lotions, cooking oil etc. He has five years of experience in this work and he currently employs two people to help him. He works from 6 a.m to 7 p.m every day except on Saturday.

Jean Pierre has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as: sugar, lotions, cooking oil, beans, maize etc for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as: sugar, lotions, cooking oil, beans, maize etc for resale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married and has eight children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent .

She has a business of a restaurant and has been in this business for three years. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, chicken and Irish potatoes. She sells to all categories of people but on retail. 

Her major business challenges include transportation and increasing prices of food. She is aspiring to see her business grow big so that she owns a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own home.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, beef, rice, chicken and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one more cow to be fattened and sold.

loans.name: Precella

texts.en:
Precella is a 34-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with four young children. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store and also farms rice for income to help her husband. 

Precella is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. She is inspired to work hard so that she can send her children to school. Her business profits will go towards her childrens' needs, like food and school fees. In the future, she plans to make improvements in her store to make it bigger for more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 27 year old, from Nyahururu, and is a single lady.

Hellen has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy two bales of clothes to add to her stock for sale. She has been in this business for the past four years with good income.

She hopes to sell new clothes in the near future and open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy two bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ramula

texts.en:
Ramula is 37 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 8 years, Ramula has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells maize flour, sugar and soap, etc.. 

To help expand her business, Ramula has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like maize flour, dry beans, rice, and sugar for resale, and will help Ramula to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Ramula hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Ramula is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ramula who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like maize flour, dry beans, rice, and sugar for resale

loans.name: Noudele Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUDELE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même maison. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ayaba Rosalie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ayaba Rosalie est âgée de 59 ans et est une veuve. Ayaba Rosalie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Ayaba Rosalie est mère de six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et aucun ne vit plus à sa charge. Ayaba Rosalie vit et assure seule ses différents besoins. Pour parvenir à ses différents besoins, Ayaba Rosalie vend depuis quinze ans divers produits (huile végétale et biscuits) à son domicile. Ayaba Rosalie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ayaba Rosalie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NOUDELE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Noudele group is made up of 3 people who live in the same house. This is the first time that the group requests financial help from ALIDé, in order to raise their level of business. The group's representative, Ayaba Rosalie, is the one will her hand raised in the picture. She is 59 years old and a widow. She left school at primary level. Ayaba Rosalie is the mother of 6 children, some of whom are educated and all of whom live independently. Ayaba Rosalie lives alone and takes care of her various needs. In order to be able to do this, she has been selling various products (vegetable oil and biscuits) for 15 years from her home. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin.

With a view to satisfying her customers and in order to increase her turnover and revenue, Ayaba Rosalie is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the Noudele group.

loans.use: to buy cans of vegetable oil and biscuits.

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Romela is providing multi cab services, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 6 years.She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Romela has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Romela hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and her husband works as a construction worker. Her six children are between the ages of 10-22 years old. She needs to help her husband so they can meet the needs of her family. She is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business for five years now. She is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, toiletries and seasonings. 

An increase in her inventory will attract more customers for her business. And an increase in her income will provide her family a healthy diet and her children will be able to continue attending school.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, toiletries and seasonings

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy  is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her younger brother.  She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this clothing business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT –SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  She works five days a week at the market and sells to all categories of people, retail. Her business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of used clothes.  

Dorothy is aspiring of seeing her business grow so that she starts importing used clothes, educating her children up to university and building her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.   Her monthly expenses includes  rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 30 years old. He is married to Erinah and together they have one child. He operates a blacksmith business and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD and he intends to buy more stock of metals for use in his business. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time.

He hopes to be a wholesaler and supply to various supermarkets and hardware stores.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials  e.g. metals for work.

loans.name: Justiniana

texts.en:
Justiniana is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. Justiniana has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan for 5,000  PHP to buy a stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Justiniana  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is 23 years old. She runs a shop in Kapan town, where she trades with shoes and bags. Karine needs to add inventory with more variety in her shop. With the requested amount she plans to purchase 80 pairs of shoes and 30 bags. This will allow Karine to increase the sales and bring in more income. Karine lives with her little, 2-year-old son. Development of business is important for her to have a stable income and insure a brighter future for her child.

loans.use: to pay for shoes and bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas, plantains,macabo, wine and liquor.

loans.name: Rony

texts.en: Bapak Rony owns a small shop next to his house in Cibubur, Indonesia. Cibubur itself is a suburban area around Jakarta that takes about 30-45 minutes [driving] during normal hours. His small shop sells basic grocery items such as rice, gas, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, snacks, drinks, and toiletries. And, of course – last but not least – he is selling airtime prepaid minutes. The reason Bapak Rony wanted to try Ruma’s new product, Loket Ruma, is because he wanted to generate more income for his family. By becoming a Loket Ruma agent, he will be able to provide his customers with a bill payment service that is a new business around his area. Customers and his neighbors will be able to pay their personal or household bills in his small shop. He will be able to create the payment transaction by using an electronic data capture (EDC) machine. This machine will connect its server and pay the customer's bill automatically, so they no longer need to go to the bank and waste their time. This loan from Kiva will be given to him to pay the guarantee deposit money in order to own this EDC machine. He hopes by having this new service product in his shop, Bapak Rony will be able to expand his business. He is expecting new customers to come to him to pay their electricity bill, water bill and motorcycle installments.

loans.use: to pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children with two of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells maize flour, sugar and soap, etc.. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like maize flour, dry beans, rice, and sugar for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like maize flour, dry beans, rice, and sugar for resale

loans.name: Ranojon

texts.en: Ranojon is a successful business woman as she has more than 4 years of experience in business. She sells washing powder, soap and all things which people need for living. Ranojon’s friends know her as kind, good natured and clever. She has a big family and tries to do the best for them. She has 4 children and her elder daughter helps her with business. Her husband is a worker and can’t help Ranojon with business. That’s why, dear lenders, you are the only one who can help her. She is asking for a loan of 1000tjs to buy Pride, soap for widening her assortment. She awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy new kind of washing powder, soap for developing business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old. She is married to Joseph and together they have a three-year-old. She operates a maize meal mill and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced by a field officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase maize for milling for sale.

She hopes to manage selling the flour wholesale to many distributors.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for milling.

loans.name: Paul Rosaire

texts.fr: Rosaire est un jeune homme de 32 ans,célibataire,père d'un enfant âgé de 07 mois.il est commerçant et gère une quincaillerie dans une banlieue depuis 05 ans déjà.Sa qualité de bon commerçant lui a permis de faire grandir son activité au fil du temps ce qui se matérialise par une clientèle considérable et en constante croissance.La demande en matériaux évolue,mais parmi tous ces matériaux la demande en contre plaquets connaît une progression plus importante,d'où son problème car son capital ne lui permet pas d'acheter assez de contre plaquets permettant de satisfaire cette demande,ce qui ne lui permet donc pas de satisfaire cette clientèle là.il sollicite donc ce crédit afin de pouvoir acheter un grand stock de contre plaquets ce qui lui évitera les ruptures de stock et lui permettra de gagner cette clientèle.Les bénéfices générés par ces ventes lui permettront d'agrandir et étendre son activité  et surtout de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Paul Rosaire is a 32-year-old man. He is single and the father of a 7-month-old infant. He is a retailer and has been running a hardware store in a suburban location for 5 years already. His reputation as a good business man has enabled him to grow his business over the years, evidenced by a considerable customer base which is growing constantly. 

The demand for materials is evolving and, of all these materials, it is the demand for plywood which is growing the most; this is causing him a problem as his capital does not allow him to buy enough plywood to satisfy this demand, and he is consequently unable to satisfy the clients who want it. Paul Rosaire is therefore requesting this loan so that he can buy a large stock of plywood, which will help him to avoid stock shortages and will allow him to bring in those customers. The profits from his sales will allow him to increase and expand his business and, above all, to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy plywood.

loans.name: Hebert Andres

texts.es:
Hebert es un joven de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial los cultivos de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Hebert le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”.  

Día a día Hebert trabaja en una empresa que brinda servicios de ventas, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar con los gastos de su hogar ya que apoya a sus padres con los cuales vive actualmente; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo trabaja con muchas ganas de trabajar.

Hebert está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una moto para poder movilizarse ya que su vivienda se está muy alejada de su centro de labores y también porque visita a muchos clientes, con esta mejora podrá ahorrar en movilidad  y podrá seguir ahorrando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Herbert is 27 years old.  He lives in the city of Ica, a city that is known for its temperate and welcoming climate, its agriculture, and especially for its cotton, grapes, asparagus, and other crops.  When he has free time, Herbert likes to eat his favorite dish - the delicious "arroz con pollo."

Day to day Herbert works for a company as a salesperson.  He works about 8 hours per day and with his income he is able to contribute to his household expenses and support his parents with what they need.  He believes that he does well in his job because he is responsible, and above all, he has a strong desire to work.

Herbert is very thankful for the Kiva lenders and gives thanks for the help he has received.  He will be able to buy a motorcycle so that he can commute to work.  His home is very far from the city center where he works and he often needs to visit customers.  With this loan his commute will improve and he will save time.  He will be able to continue saving so that he can make his biggest dream come true - to own his own home.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John  is a 49-year-old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 22 years. He describes himself to be an aggressive man. He operates a mining farm where he sells building blocks. He has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 10 staff members. His business is located at a viable business environment where building blocks are easily accesible  and his primary customers are local residents. 

John describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the Kes 85,500 loan to buy a water tank worth Kes 78,000 and the rest loan proceeds worth Kes 7,500 to pay for the installation of the water tank. His business goal is to buy a lorry to help in delivering building stones/bricks to customers within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, his business will have been successful.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and pay for the installation of the water tank.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 23 years old and single. He has a mobile phone accessories business in Nyahururu town and has operated it for four years. He also offers mobile battery charging services and has a barber shop at the same place.

This will be his first loan and he plans to use the amount to buy mobile phone accessories for sale. With the anticipated profits he plans to boost his business by buying more stock of phone accessories.

In the future, Stephen hopes to grow his business by supplying mobile phone accessories in Nakuru and other towns.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more textile materials for dressmaking

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 41 years old. She is married and has six children, five of them in school. Her husband is a farmer. 

She has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods. 

She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including cigarettes, oil, soap, biscuits, and animals like chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to buy additional items including cigarettes, oil, soap, biscuits, and animals like chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Emila Jeannette

texts.fr: Emila jeannette est une femme de 52 an,célibataire,mère d'un enfant âgé de 25 ans qui va encore à l'école.Elle est couturière dans une banlieue depuis 02 ans où elle achète des tissus pour confectionner des housses de décoration pour chaises qu'elle revend elle-même.La demande en housses de décoration est croissante, mais cependant le capital alloué à l'achat de tissus pour la confection de ces housses ne lui permet pas d'acheter assez de tissus nécessaire pour confectionner des housses qui répondront à la demande de sa clientèle,ce qui crée de constantes ruptures de stock et la diminution de sa clientèle.Elle voudrait donc ce crédit pour acheter des tissus en grande quantités afin de confectionner une quantité importante de housses de chaises ce qui lui évitera les ruptures mais surtout retiendra et augmentera sa clientèle, donc ses ventes et par conséquent ses bénéfices.Ces bénéfices lui permettront d'étendre ses points de vente et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emila Jeannette, age 52, is a single mother of a 25-year-old child who still attends school. For the past two years, she has been working as a seamstress in a suburb where she buys fabrics to make decorative chair covers for sale. 

There is a steady increase in the demand for chair covers, but she doesn’t have the capital needed to buy a sufficient supply of fabrics to achieve customer satisfaction. 

In light of frequent stock shortages, and a drop in customer demand, Emila Jeannette is seeking a loan to buy a large supply of fabrics. This will allow her to make a substantial number of chair covers, thereby preventing further shortages while helping to retain and even bolster her customer base, and her sales and profits. 

She plans to use these profits to expand her service locations and to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make and sell chair covers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with four children ages 6, 8, 14 and 18. She is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. While her husband works in the farm, Maria also helps in meeting the needs of her family by cooking snacks that she sells in her neighborhood. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, school supplies and sticky rice which she cooks into rice cake.

Her income will provide her family a nutritious diet and tuition fees for her children. In the future, she would like to improve her business and to invest in other business options for more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, school supplies and sticky rice

loans.name: Las Merceditas Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Merceditas  se conformó en el año 2008, con mucho esfuerzo ya se encuentran en el 8 ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar  a sus familias.
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la de la Sr. Luisa quien se dedica a la venta de sábanas, comida y pescado, es una mujer muy dinámica, como se puede ver. Gracias a su arduo trabajo está ayudando a su familia y dándoles lo que más necesitan para el día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas y pescado, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y dando a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día
texts.en:
The Las Merceditas Group was formed in 2008.  With a lot of hard work and effort, they are now in their eighth loan cycle. They work closely together in the group.  Besides each member's independent work, they also participate in activities as a group.  They help each other reach their goals which is to work hard to support their families.

One moving story is that of Luisa.  Luisa sells sheets, food, and fish.  She is a very dynamic woman, as you can see.  Thanks to her hard work she is supporting her family and providing them with what they need day to day.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy sheets and fish so that she can continue working and providing her family with what they need every day.

loans.use: to buy sheets and fish for sale.

loans.name: Serge Bertrand

texts.fr: Serges Bertrand est un jeune homme de 34 ans,célibataire,sans enfant.Il est commerçant dans un marché de la capitale économique depuis 03 ans où il vend des chaussures et chapeaux de mariages.Il a dû arrêter la vente de vêtements car celle-ci ne rapportait plus et s'est donc lancé totalement dans la vente exclusive de chaussures et chapeaux.Cette activité fonctionne assez bien car grâce à son expérience de vendeur il a réussit à attirer une clientèle fidèle et qui croît de jours en jours.Cependant,la demande en chapeaux de mariage étant croissante il a du mal à répondre aux besoins de cette clientèle à cause de la ruptures constantes et de son capital qui ne lui permet pas de s'approvisionner convenablement.il voudrait donc ce crédit afin d'augmenter son stock de chapeaux de mariages ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire à la demande et d'éviter la perte de cette clientèle.Les bénéfices que générera ses ventes lui permettront de réinvestir dans son activité afin de pouvoir vendre d'autres accessoires pour mariages mais également de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Serges Bertrand is a 34-year-old man who is single and has no children. He is a retailer and has been selling shoes and wedding hats at a market in the economic capital for 3 years. He had to stop selling clothes as this was not profitable enough, and he instead threw himself into exclusively selling shoes and hats. This business is doing quite well as, thanks to his experience as a salesman, he has managed to build a loyal clientèle which is growing every day.

However, since the demand for wedding hats is growing, Serges Bertrand is finding it difficult to fulfill the needs of his customers as he is constantly suffering from stock shortages and his capital does not allow him to get adequate supplies. He would therefore like to get this loan so that he can increase his inventory of wedding hats, which will enable him to satisfy his customers and not lose them. The profits generated by his sales will allow him to reinvest in his business so that he can sell other wedding accessories, and will also enable him to meet his needs.

loans.use: to buy wedding hats.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys  is a 53-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, 22 years and 30 years old. She describes herself to be honest and a go-getter woman. She operates a grocery store and rental house business selling vegetables and providing accomodation to tenants. She has been involved in this business for 17 years. Her business is located near a busy road which is near a town  and her primary customers are residents. 

Gladys describes her biggest business challenge to be delay of payments from customers. She will use the Kes 41,500 loan to buy a water tank worth Kes 41,500  for her tenants. Her business goal is to build more houses for rental accomodation  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have been financially stable in her business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank worth Kes 41,500 for her tenants.

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah is 45 years old. She is married to Njogo and together they have three children. She operates a restaurant and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is her first loan in KADET LTD. She was introduced by a field officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase sugar, flour, rice and cooking oil for use in her business.


She hopes to expand her business and add more workers.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, rice and cooking oil for use in her business.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a 52-year-old married woman with no children who spends her time tailoring to communicate with others.

Saada is a hard-working woman, who is liked by almost all of her customers that come to her shop in order to enjoy communicating with her.

Saada is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy  necessary tailoring tools and do necessary maintenance on her house. She believes that her work has helped her a lot in filling her free time, and encouraging her to have new friends most of the time.

Saada is happy with what she has accomplished till now. She was capable of building a small house in her village and is working hard to finish it as soon as possible to spend what's left for her (as she says) in her life in her village.

loans.use: to buy  necessary tailoring equipment and do necessary maintenance on her house

loans.name: Luneta

texts.en:
Luneta is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a farmer who works hard to earn a living. Her seven children are all grown so she needs to look after herself and her husband who is a carpenter. The success of today's farming is always attributed to the use of fertilizer. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. 

She will use her income to buy a healthy diet for her family and reinvest in the same business. Luneta plans to cultivate more land in the future to increase her productivity and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 35-year-old business lady, married to Joseph who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children who are all in school. She has been selling assorted fruits and vegetables with a monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Ann will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for selling. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy  assorted green vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 41 years old, comes from Nyahururu, and is married with three children who are aged between 12 years and six years.

Stephen has a laundry business that he has been doing for the past six years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a dry cleaner to improve in his services to his customers.

He hopes to see his business expand and be able to open up other laundry shops in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a dry cleaner

loans.name: Norijon

texts.en:
Norijon is a woman who works hard from early morning till late evening. She has been busy sewing national dresses for women. She likes having her own business very much and works with pleasure. As she is a woman of taste and fashion, she sews very beautiful dresses. Many women like to wear the dresses sewn by Norijon. Norijon has many customers. She has a successful business and in this way she makes money for a living. 

Norijon is a widow bringing up three children alone. She is asking for a loan to buy fabrics for developing her business. She needs your support. Please, help her if it is possible.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 31,500 pesos Yolanda ha podido avanzar en la construcción de su casa. Aún no la ha terminado, pero está construyendo el baño y planea avanzar en un dormitorio.En la foto podemos ver una paded de blocks y detrás, en vez de pared, utiliza cortinas para dividir los espacios. Yolanda es micro empresaria y hace todo lo que puede para aumentar sus ingresos. Vende ropa y zapatos de segunda mano, vende frituras en las noches (negocio muy popular en la República Dominicana, ya que muchos en vez de hacer cena compran carne frita de res, cerdo o pollo acompañada de plátano macho verde frito) y además vende jugos naturales. Los tres negocios operan desde su casa. Yolanda es casada y tiene 6 hijos de edades entre 30 y 12 años. Los tres más pequeños (20,17 y 12) aún viven con ella. Los de 17 y 12 años están en la secundaria y practican baseball, con el sueño de un día ser filmados por algún equipo de grades ligas.
Terminar de construir su casa es el gran sueño de Yolanda
texts.en:
With a loan of 31,500 pesos, Yolanda has been able to proceed on the construction of her house.  It still has not been completed, but she is building a bathroom and plans to continue with a bedroom.  In the photo we can see a block wall and behind her, in place of a wall, she uses curtains to divide the space.

Yolanda is entrepreneurial and does whatever she needs to increase her income.  She sells second-hand clothing and shoes in the day, and she sells fried food in the evenings (this is a very popular business in the Dominican Republic since instead of buying a meal, many people buy fried beef, pork, or chicken accompanied with fried green plantains.)  She also sells natural fruit juices.

She operates her three businesses from her home.  Yolanda is married and has six children between the ages of 30 and 12 years old.  The three youngest (20, 17, and 12) still live with her.  The 17 year old and 12 year old are in school and they play baseball and dream to one day be picked up by a team in the major leagues.  Yolanda's biggest dream is to finish building her home.

loans.use: to proceed with the construction of her house.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is involved in agriculture. She raises cows, sheep, and chickens and cultivates potatoes. Karine would like to increase the number of cows on her farm. In addition, she needs to purchase grass to feed them, as the grass she grows on the farm is insufficient for this purpose. 

Karine lives with her husband and four children: her daughters (10 and 11 years) and sons (7 and 3 years). Agriculture is the main source of income for this family of many children, so developing the business will help Karine and her husband to earn more income and ensure improved living conditions for their children.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renew the tools needed for his auto body shop and pay rent on his home

loans.name: Adrien

texts.en:
Adrien is 35 years old and is married with six children. He sells various goods such as beans and maize. He has five years of experience in this line of work, and he currently employs three people to help him. He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day of the week, except Saturdays. 

Adrien has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods, such as beans and maize, for resale.

loans.name: Sudarmo

texts.en: Bapak Sudarmo owns a small mobile phone shop in Cibubur, Indonesia. Cibubur is a suburban area about 30-45 minutes from Jakarta during normal traffic. His small shop sells used mobile phones, new mobile phones (very limited numbers), sim cards, mobile phone cases, and, of course, airtime prepaid minutes. He is married and has a child (8 years old). Bapak Sudarmo knows that Ruma has a new product called Loket Ruma. He agreed to try out this product by becoming a Loket Ruma agent. By becoming a Loket Ruma agent, he can generate more money because he will have more services for his customers. This Loket Ruma will make him a payment point for his customers to pay household bills. He will need an electronic data capture (EDC) machine to create the payment transactions. This loan from Kiva will be given to him to pay the guarantee deposit money in order to own this machine. The main reason why he easily agreed to become an agent is because he sees the demand for a payment point in his community. By becoming a payment point, he believes the opportunity to expand his business is more feasible now.

loans.use: to pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business

loans.name: Duo Luz De La Esperanza Group

texts.es: Dúo Luz de la Esperanza. Este Dúo  Está integrado por doña Fidelina, quien tiene 35 años de edad tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus 3 hijos, (1 mujer y 2 varones)ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano, y también se dedica a la venta de ropa típica desde hace varios años, el esposo de ella trabaja como chofer de un bus pequeño que transporta pasajeros de tecpan hacia otra colonia y con el sueldo que gana ayuda a su familia ya que dos de sus hijos van a la escuela de la localidad, doña Fidelina sueña con tener un propio local para su negocio ya que en estos momentos vende su producto de forma ambulante. Doña Fidelina nos está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos típicos y para la compra de ropa típica para la venta.
texts.en:
The Group "Dúo Luz de la Esperanza" is comprised of two members.  Fidelina is 35 years old and has three children that she cares for (one girl and two boys.)  She weaves traditional textiles by hand.  She has also been selling traditional clothing for many years.  Her husband is a driver of a small bus that takes passengers from Tecpan to another region.  With their income they can support the family and they can send two of the children to school in the area.  Fidelina dreams to have her own store for her business since she currently sells her products door-to-door.  

Fidelina is seeking a loan so that she can buy supplies for her traditional weaving and so that she can buy traditional clothing for sale.

loans.use: to buy supplies for weaving and to buy traditional clothing for sale.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en: Ravshan is a successful businessman with more than 12 years of experience selling dried fruit. He has learned all aspects of his business very well. He has a location in the local market, and his goods attract many customers. He is also the very caring father of 2 children and a lovely husband. His wife loves him very much and helps him with business. He is asking for a loan to buy goods for developing his business. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep for resale.

loans.name: Mabothraneh Group

texts.en: Isatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu was born in Portloko, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. She is a 49-year-old widow and has two children, one in primary school and the other in secondary school. Isatu sells food at the market, including palm oil, Maggi (seasoning), salt, pepper, and dried/smoked fish. She has been in this business for many years now. With help from this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan (1,200,000 SLL) to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her inventory.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs in bulk to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Adonay - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ADONAY - 26 Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Virginia tiene 45 años, y tres hijos que tienen las  edades de 12, 25 y 28  años,  La Sra. Virginia se dedica  a la  fabricación y ventas  de calzados, su taller se encuentra en la zona de pasankeri,  ella vende sus productos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en una zona populosa de la ciudad de La Paz donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Virginia va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de materiales , variedad de cueros para la fabricación de zapatos  y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Virginia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales para la fabricación de sus productos, la Sra. Virginia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The ADONAY - 26 Group is comprised of 9 members (seven women and two men).  The president of the group is Virginia.  She is 45 years old and has three children that are 12, 25, and 28 years old.  Virginia makes and sells shoes.  Her workshop is located in the Pasankeri area.  She sells her products in a stall in a popular area of the city of La Paz.

This loan is her first with the institution.  Virginia is going to use the money to buy materials and a variety of leather for the making of shoes.  She will be able to offer a variety of products to her customers and increase her income.  Her reason for asking for the loan is to continue improving her business.  Virginia is going to use her earnings to continue buying materials for making her products. 
 
Virginia is a hard-working person that is happy for the opportunity given to her and to her fellow group members, because in many cases they are the sole providers for their families.

loans.use: to buy a variety of supplies for sewing leather shoes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of her young brother. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She has been in the clothing business for 2 years. She sells to all categories of people at the market on a retail basis. She works six days per week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to build her own house. She currently resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Akotobu Group

texts.en:
Naomi and Victoria are both married businesswomen. Victoria is 40 years old with 3 children, and Naomi is 37 years old with 2 children. They have each been operating businesses in their community for the past 10 years.

Victoria operates a drugstore and coldstore. She is also a registered drug seller, so she buys drugs and fish from authorized depots. She is in her 5th loan cycle, and she and Naomi are both loyal clients of ID-Ghana. They paid their previous loans successfully. Victoria makes a profit of 170 GHC monthly. Together they need 2,300 Ghanaian cedis for their businesses; therefore, they are applying to Kiva to come to their aid.

loans.use: To buy enough drugs, fish, and meat to meet customer demand

loans.name: Ruth Dalila

texts.es: Ruth, de  29 años de edad, habita en la comarca Poneloya, en las afueras de León , es madre de  4 hijos , se dedica  a la venta y compra de pescados y cerdos , lleva 15 años dedicándose a este negocio. El  cual aprendió desde los 14 años de edad donde su primera experiencia  fue con un bote y una red de pescar. Ella por las mañanas se dedica a la pesca y después se va a vender su producto fresco a los mercados de la ciudad, todo esto lo realiza por si misma. También se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos . Ella esta solicitando el crédito para comprar una red de pescar y cerdos para criar y vender. Una de sus metas próximas es darle un mejor mantenimiento a su bote para tener un mejor rendimiento en su  trabajo y priorizar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 29 years old and lives in Poneloya, which is outside of León.  She is the mother of four children.  She buys and sells fish and pigs and has had this business for 15 years.  She learned this work when she was 14 years old and she got into a boat with a fishing net.

In the mornings she fishes and afterward she sells her fresh fish in the city markets.  She does all of this by herself.  She also buys and sells pigs.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy a fishing net and pigs to raise and sell.  One of her goals is to do maintenance on her boat so that she can improve the output of her work and she also wants to make the education of her children a high priority.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and to also buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Shalala

texts.en:
Shalala is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She is a market vendor who sells different kinds of goods such as cookies, pastas, ketchup, tea, and candies. She has 6 years of experience in this field. Her shop located in the central bazaar, which helps to make her business successful because a lot of people visit the bazaar during the day.

Shalala's monthly income is 100 AZN, which is too small to cover the needs of her beloved children. Her husband is a builder, and his salary is not permanent. To improve their financial situation, Shalala has decided to improve her business. She has applied for a loan of 1800 AZN to restock and diversify her inventory of food products. This will be her second loan, and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: to restock and diversify her inventory of food products

loans.name: Dúo Nueva Visión Group

texts.es: Dúo Nueva Visión  Este Dúo está integrado por la señora Dorotea Quien tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de diferentes edades, ella es originaria de Acatenango pero actual mente reside en Chimaltenango, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica usada, sus ventas las realiza en diferentes lugares de forma ambulante todavía no cuenta con un local propio,  pero nos cuenta que tiene una gran ambición de tener un local donde vender su producto ya que así no tendrá que ir caminando ya que es muy cansado, espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado desde ya les desea bendiciones donde quiera que estén. Está solicitando este crédito para la compra de ropa típica usada.
texts.en:
Dúo Nueva Visión: This pair has as one member, Dorotea who is 53 years old, married and with 4 children of varied ages. She is a native of Acatenango but now resides in Chimaltenango. She makes a living selling traditional used clothing. 

She makes her sales in different places in an itinerant manner because she does not have her own locale. However she says that she has a grand ambition to have her own locale where she would sell her products so that she would not have to be traveling because it is very tiring. 

She hopes that she can be helped with with the requested loan and wishes blessings to all, wherever they are. She is requesting this loan to buy traditional used clothing.

loans.use: to buy traditional used clothing.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is a 48-year-old man who runs a private business. He works as a driver, but his primary business is selling food products. He is a market vendor and has been selling different goods such as yoghurt, sausages, candies, cookies, and pastas for the last 8 years. He is responsible for his wife and two sons.
 
Asif's business brings in a stable monthly income of 200 AZN, and his older son helps him to sell products from the shop. He would like to increase his income so he has applied for a loan of 2000 AZN. He will use this loan to diversify his inventory and purchase more products for his shop. This will be his second loan, and he has good loan history.

loans.use: to buy more food products to sell

loans.name: Progress Group

texts.en: Salomey and Ramatu are the members of this two-person loan group. Ramatu makes a living by selling cassava, plantain and vegetables while Salomey makes a living by selling provisions. Salomey is 50 years, buys her goods in Accra and sells them from a kiosk near her home in Teshie. Ramatu buys her food from a market in Accra called agbogbloshie and also sells them from her home. Ramatu went into business in 2005 and is now 45 years old and the mother of two children. She is applying for her third loan from ID-Ghana after repaying her first two loans promptly. She earns a profit of 100 Ghanan cedis a month. In the future, she plans to own a taxi. Both lenders plan to use their loan for 1,100 Ghana cedis to meet customer demands.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta owns a sari-sari store in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She sells basic household commodities like rice, snack food, canned goods, cooking oil, salt, sugar, chips, toiletries and other seasonings. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have five children: four are adults and the youngest is 12 years old. She is asking for a loan to buy an additional supply of canned goods, toiletries, snack food, coffee, eggs and seasonings. In the future, she hopes to continue expanding her business for a better income that will support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, toiletries, snack food, coffee, eggs and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Azamzhan

texts.en: Azamjon, a kind-hearted  and successful businessman who likes to help people who need it, is very much loved by his wife and children for whom he strives to provide all modern conveniences. For more than 22 years he has been engaged in animal husbandry, and is one of the best clients of our organization. Azamjon is requesting a loan to buy young cattle for the further development of his business. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: to buy young cattle to develop his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new pots, cake pans, spatulas, a beater, a food cart, etc

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en: Yegana is 52 years old woman, married and the mother of two sons. She earns a living by breeding sheep and cattle, and selling them to local butchers. She has 16 years of experience in this field, thanks to her husband, who taught her how to look after cattle and helps her run her business. Her husband is a teacher in local school. Yegana usually buys young cattle and sheep, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them for a profit in the local livestock bazaar. She earns 80 AZN a month. Beef and mutton are very popular in Azerbaijan because people use them in everyday dishes such as pilau and dolma, and eat lots of yogurt.  Also she sells sheep fur, which is useful for making clothes and blankets. Yegana has applied for a loan for 1,200 AZN to expand her herd by buying one cow and five sheep.

loans.use: to buy one cow and five sheep.

loans.name: Lion Group

texts.en:
Thanks to the first loan that you helped members of the "Lion" group with, their businesses have seen a lot of growth over the months. They were able to add more goods to their respective businesses. This thus led to an increase in sales and in profit. As a consequent, these guys' living conditions improved to a new height. 

Having done repaying their previous loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan in the same amount as the previous, i.e. 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each. This will again enable them to further increase their business inventories. Ibrahim will this time buy only palm-oil. But this time, he will be able to buy a larger quantity than he bought previously.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of palm-oil than previously

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 28 years old and is married with two children aged 1 and 3 years old. Jean de Dieu sells shoes for men. He has two years of experience in this work, and he currently employs two people to help him. He starts his work at 8 a.m. and works until 7 p.m. every day except on the weekend.

Jean de Dieu has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more shoes for men for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for men for resale.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this charcoal business for 10 years. She sells to all categories of people but on a retail basis.  

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She works seven days a week and works at the market.  

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages for charcoal. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben lives Vedi town with his parents. The family is involved in agriculture: They grow apricot, apple and peach trees and keep a grape orchard. 

Ruben would like to start cattle breeding, for which he needs to renovate the old barn. Ruben also needs to purchase fertilizer and medicine, with the help of which he will cultivate the land and inject the trees and to prevent diseases. This loan is important for Ruben to develop his agriculture business and continue investments for further expansion of his farm.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, medicine and barn renovation.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim is 53, married with two children. He has bred livestock from a very young age, thanks to his father, who taught him best, he already has 22 years of experience. During these years Rasim has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.

He purchases lambs and calves in the central livestock market and raises them. After fattening the animals he resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar.  Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.
  
His business requires a lot of physical strength and Rasim most of his time in the open air. His wife helps him to feed the animals. 

His monthly income is 200 AZN and Rasim wishes to increase it. As meat is in high demand, he needs more capital to put into his business and cover the market.  For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN. He will use the loan to buy two cattle, five sheep and fodder. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle, five sheep and fodder

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 30-year-old married man with two children. He and his family live in Taiz, Yemen. For the past four years, he has owned a house. He has a good reputation and his smile is apparent to everyone. He is requesting a youth loan from AMB to buy home appliances for his house.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for his house.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is married and has four children who are 16, 13, 11 and one and a half years old. She has always wanted to provide them with a good education, and since her husband's income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Mwajuma decided to start working about 10 years ago, operating a kiosk, in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home's finances. 

In addition, she has a vegetable stall outside her home where she sells fruits and vegetables. Thanks to the increasing number of customers, Mwajuma is looking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, and salt, that will allow her to increase her inventory and offer a better service to her customers.
