In this way, her business will continue to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Jeimi

texts.es: Jeimy de 28 años  es la propietaria de una miscelánea ubicada al sur occidente de la ciudad, donde comercializa productos de belleza como champoo, cremas protectoras del cabello,  ropa infantil, productos de papelería y accesorios femeninos. En este mismo punto ella ha agregado una venta de helados y refrescos con el que genera ingresos adicionales, aprovechando la clientela que ha logrado conquistar con su buen servicio. Con su negocio obtiene una rentabilidad que le permite generar recursos para aportarle  desde hace 1 año, al bienestar de su hogar conformado por su esposo quien la apoya  y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 7 años. Jeimy trabaja ofreciendo mercancía variada de contado y a crédito, aplicando muchas veces el plan separe, es decir que antes de llevarse el artículo sus clientes abonan poco a poco, hasta lograr comprarlo totalmente.  Jeimy  usualmente hace sus compras en almacenes donde le ofrecen descuentos y una buena calidad en las mercancías que le venden. Su meta es ampliar su miscelánea y su sueño principal es tener su propia casa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará   artículos cosméticos, ropa exterior en las líneas femenina e infantil. Con su credikiva, planea aumentar un poco más su capital de trabajo, para poder responderle a sus clientes de manera oportuna, y generar la fidelidad de estos. Y es que esta es la razón por la cual su credikiva tendrá éxito.
texts.en:
Jeimy is 28 years old and is the owner of a general store located in the southeastern part of the city. Here she sells beauty products like shampoo, protective hair creams, infant clothing, paper products and female accessories. In this same place she has added ice cream and beverage sales with which she generates additional income, taking advantage of the clientele that she has gained with her good service. 

With her business she receives profits that allow her to obtain the necessary resources to support her for a year. The well-being of her home is shaped by her husband who supports her and her three children between the ages of 1 and 7 years old. Jeimy offers varied merchandise for cash and on credit. She has often provided separate payment plans in which prior to taking the item with them, the clients pay little by little until they have completely paid for it. Jeimy usually makes her purchases in stores where they offer her discounts and products of good quality that are sold to her. Her goal is to expand her store and her primary dream is to have her own house. 

She is currently requesting this loan with Kiva, her first financing made with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this she will buy cosmetics and female and infant outerwear. With her Kiva loan she plans to increase her working capital by a little bit to be able to respond to her customers in an opportune way and generate loyalty among them. This is the reason for which her Kiva loan will have success.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic and female and infant outerwear.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 54-year-old married man, father of three children. Ali has been working in the agriculture business for 22 years. He enjoys this business very much and works on improving it all the time.

Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his store of food  for his cattle for the winter season. He will also invest part of the loan in his son's wedding expenses. He is very excited about this wedding and hopes to be capable of helping all of his children in their future.

This is Ali's first experience with Al Majmoua, and he hopes that the future ones will expand his business more and more.

loans.use: To increase his store of food  for his cattle for the winter season

loans.name: Yoqubjon

texts.en:
For more than 19 years, Yoqubjon has had his own business. He is the owner of a café. He serves with high quality and that’s why his customers like to visit his café.  There are the best cooks in his café. If you want to eat the best and tasty food then you must visit his café. 

Yoqubjon has additional income from selling building materials. He is one of the best clients of Imon International organization and has a good credit history. He is a very careful father and husband. His family loves him very much. His two children want to be as smart and successful as their father. His wife doesn’t help him with the business and you are the only one who can help him. He is asking for for a loan to repair his cafe because it is in bad condition and lately it has  attracted few customers. Please, support him.

loans.use: To repair his café

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik is 26 years old. He lives in Noravan village with his parents. The family is busy with daily agricultural activities, as their farm includes a large number of livestock, trees and plants. Norik and his parents raise cows, sheep and chickens, grow wheat, barley and potatoes, as well as apple, pear and walnut trees. 

Norik would like to increase the number of livestock, for which he needs sufficient means. With  the requested amount he will purchase 12 calves. 

Expansion of the farm is important for Norik to keep development of agriculture and provide financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to pay for 12 calves to raise

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: Walid started his clothes selling activity four years ago; he started his own activity and earn a better income. Although being a native of Ibb, Yemen. He is 30 years old and single man. He chooses the styles and colors of the clothes to sell, while he negotiates prices. He is requesting a youth loan to buy more clothes such as shirts for men, jeans and T-shirts of different styles and colors. His life project is to expand his activity, selling not only clothes but also other products that his customer may request.

loans.use: to buy more clothes such as shirts for men, jeans and T-shirts of different styles and colors for his business

loans.name: Mukafat

texts.en: Mukafat is 52 years old, married and the mother of two children. For the last 14 years, she has earned a living by raising fruits and vegetables in her  garden. She chose this business because fruits and vegetables are very popular in Azerbaijan, where people like to eat them and make juices out of them while they are still fresh, which is very healthy. Her husband lives on a pension and helps Mukafat sell crops in the central bazaar. Her monthly income is 150 AZN, but raising crops in the open air takes a lot of strength, which is hard for a woman and the reason why her husband helps her. Mukafat is requesting a loan for 1,000 AZN to buy seeds and fertilizer. This will allow her to improve the quality of the products she raises and increase her monthly sales.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha tiene 42 años, se describe como una persona jovial, trabajadora y muy positiva en sus objetivos planteados. Martha vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en Urcuquí que se encuentra a 20 minutos de Ibarra.

Martha trabaja con una empleada en la venta de comida rápida como papas fritas, hamburguesas, negocio que le permite cubrir los gastos de su casa como alimentación, vestimenta, estudios de sus hijos. Martha ya viene trabajando 5 años consecutivos con Fodemi, el actual crédito que solicita es para Para mejorar su negocio incorporando mesas, sillas, una nueva cocina industrial, porque sus clientes crecen constantemente y también para la compra de papas por quintales, refrescos, embutidos. Esta inversión ayudará a que su negocio sea más presentable y que sus clientes sean fieles con ella y así obtener buenos ingresos.

Martha sueña con que su negocio se convierta en buen restaurant y funcione al 100% y así poder reunir ingresos y poder construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Martha, age 42, can be described as a cheerful, hard-working, and very positive person who has her goals set.  Martha lives with her husband and their four children in Urcuquí, which is 20 minutes from Ibarra.  Martha works with an employee selling fast food like French fries and hamburgers.  The business allows her to cover the household expenses like food, clothes, and her children’s education.

Martha has been working with Fodemi for five consecutive years.  The loan she is now requesting is to improve her business by adding tables, chairs, and a new industrial stove.  She will do this because she is continuously getting more customers.  She will also buy “quintales” [1 quintal = 100 kg] of potatoes, soft drinks, and sausages.  This investment will help her business to be more presentable, will make her customers loyal to her, and she will get more income.

Martha dreams of her business becoming a good restaurant that at functions at 100%.  This way she will be able to get together income, and she will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to improve her business by adding tables, chairs, and a new industrial stove.  She will also buy potatoes, soft drinks, and sausages.

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sabenty” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata. Aminata is age 43. She was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman. One of her children is attending primary school and three are in secondary school. Aminata has been a petty businesswoman for many years now. She sells milk, mayonnaise, butter, sugar, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy milk, mayonnaise, butter, sugar, etc. in large quantity to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Kibwana

texts.en:
Kibwana is a 50-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 10 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be honest and  focused. He operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located at a competitive area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Kibwana describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent power blackouts distracting water supply. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank. His business goal is to buy two more water kiosks for selling water to customers within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have expanded his business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 30 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. For the last six months, she has earned a living by baking doughnuts for sale. She now has one employee and generates extra income by selling fruits and snacks. Thanks to the training on business management she has received from Faulu Kenya, she has become more business-oriented and dreams of expanding her business and opening more outlets in the future. She is requesting a loan for KES 50,000 to buy wheat flour, fruits and snacks.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, fruit and snacks.

loans.name: Erenia Patricia

texts.es: Erenia, de 58 años de edad, casada de oficio  costurera, lleva 45 años trabajando en el negocio de la costura y confección, lleva 45 años trabajando en el negocio de la costura. Ella empezó  como aprendiz  en un pequeño taller de costura cuando tenía 13 años de edad esto le sirvió de escuela para ganarse la vida. Poco a poco fue mejorando, con los trabajos de costura que realizo fue ahorrando hasta lograr poner su propio mini taller de costura. Ella realizo trajes para todo tipo de eventos como bodas, quince años, bautizos, uniformes de empresas. También sale a vender ropa en las comunidades en las afueras de León de donde es originaria. Está requiriendo el préstamo para comprar tela al por mayor y poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene. Con el crédito podrá adquirir más materia prima para trabajar y entregar a tiempo los pedidos. Uno de sus más grandes sueños es lograr ampliar su talle comprar nuevas maquinas de cocer y brindar trabajos a mujeres que como ella buscan superarse cada día.
texts.en:
Erenia, 58 years old and married, is a seamstress. She has worked for 45 years in the sewing and dressmaking business. She began as an apprentice in a small sewing workshop when she was 13 years old. It served as a school that taught her how to make a living. Little by little she began improving and with her sewing jobs she began saving until she was able to open her own mini sewing workshop.

Erenia makes dresses for all kinds of events such as weddings, “quince años” [a teen-age girl’s coming out ceremony], baptisms, business uniforms. She also sells clothing in communities on the outskirts of León, where she is a native. She needs the loan to purchase fabrics wholesale and so that she can fulfill the orders she has. With the loan she will be able to acqure more raw material for her work and deliver her orders on time.

One of her greatest dreams is to be able to expand her workshop and buy new sewing machines and offer work to women like herself who are looking for ways to succeed every day.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en: Tima is 23 old and lives in an outlying area of the city of San Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and the mother of four children. For the last eight years, she has worked very hard in her kiosk, selling basic consumer products such as flour, sweets and other items. She uses her income to help her husband meet their household expenses. She works full-time, and started her business on her own from capital she generated while working elsewhere. She is requesting a loan for KSH 40,000 to buy more rice, flour, sugar and other items to sell to her customers. She is a hard worker because she would like to generate enough money to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more rice, flour, sugar and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 40 years old. He is married to Florence and together they have three children. He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced by a field officer. He will use the loan amount to purchase sweets, biscuits, books, pencils, toys to stock in his shop.

He hopes to expand his business and shift to a better business room.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, books, pencils, and toys to stock in his shop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 56 years old, widowed with eight children. Thanks to the houses that she has rented out to her tenants, she is able to cater for her children's needs with the income she receives. Besides, she also does farming to generate extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of building more houses in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to renovate her houses.

loans.use: To renovate her houses

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es: Camilo de 36 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 1 año de edad. Él es propietario de un taller de latonería, actividad que aprendió de su padre hace 20 años, pues es también pintor y latonero. Camilo tiene su negocio en un lugar ubicado al norte de la ciudad y su mercado lo conforman clientes con ingresos medios y altos, que circundan o habitan alrededor de él y que lo conocen y   prefieren su taller, pues logra con sus esfuerzos   entregarles un servicio de calidad, respondiéndoles con materiales seguros y garantizados. Su negocio está muy bien organizado, cuenta con una oficina cómoda donde atiende a su clientela, una cabina de pintura para evitar impurezas, y lograr un excelente acabado. Como novedoso Camilo ofrece el servicio a domicilio eficaz, recogiendo el vehículo donde su cliente lo requiera   y entregándolo totalmente reparado en horas de la tarde de ese mismo día. Para lograr tal efectividad, en su trabajo utiliza pinturas de secado rápido y cuenta con varios empleados a quienes paga una tarifa por producción; ellos solo aportan la mano de obra porque el negocio cuenta con local, herramientas de trabajo  y materiales e insumos para responder al servicio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará pinturas, disolventes, pastas de hueso duro, barniz y láminas galvanizadas. Con su credikiva fortalecerá su microempresas pues tiene como meta afianzar la promoción de sus servicios y requiere tener todo lo necesario para el crecimiento de su clientela sea armónico,  como es a lo que aspira y esto es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Camilo is 36 years old and lives with his wife and one year old son.  He owns an auto body shop and learned this trade from father, also a painter and auto body shop technician, twenty years ago.  Camilo’s business is located north of the city and his market is comprised of medium to high income customers that live around him and know him.  Customers prefer his shop because he works hard to deliver quality service and uses safe and guaranteed materials.  His business is very well-organized.  He has a comfortable office where he serves his customers and, a spray booth to shield the automobiles from contaminants during the painting process, which results in an excellent, good as new finish.  Camilo offers convenient home delivery service; he picks up the vehicle from wherever the customer requests and delivers it completely repaired in the afternoon of the same day.  To achieve this efficiency in his business, he use quick-drying paint and has several employees to whom he pay a fee for production.  They only provide labor because the business has the tools and supplies needed to meet customer service requests.  Now, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with the “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo”.  He will purchase paint, solvent, “hueso duro” (a brand of auto body fill used to repair dents, etc.), glaze, and galvanized metal sheets.  The Kiva loan will help strengthen his small business because his goals are to improve the promotion of his services and to have everything he needs to grow his customer base efficiently.  This is his aspiration and the Kiva loan is exactly what he needs to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase paint, solvent, “hueso duro” (a brand of auto body fill used to repair dents, etc.), glaze, and galvanized metal sheets.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en: Firdavs is always in rivalry with the modern world. He is strong-minded, decent and gentle. For improving living, 9 years ago he began his own business. He has been busy with driving. He serves local people as a taxi driver. He has many clients. His experiences and skills help him for developing business. He must repair his car to improve the level of his services. He is asking for a loan to repair his car. He promises to repay the asked-for loan on time. He needs your help and mercy.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Monica Cecilia

texts.es:
Mónica tiene 29m años, se destaca por ser una mujer trabajadora, alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante con su familia. Mónica vive con sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra.

Mónica trabaja con su cuñado en la confección de tejidos como sacos, gorras de lana, guantes de lana. Mónica trabaja en este negocio un año y constantemente por su excelente trabajo ha ido ganando clientela, ahora necesita incrementar su producción para tener ventas e ingresos, por lo cual ha realizado un crédito con la intención de comprar lana para tejer sacos y obtener una buena producción y mejores ingresos.

Mónica sueña en comprar más máquinas y poder emplear a personal para que su negocio crezca en cuanto a producción e ingresos mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mónica is 29 years old, her main qualities are being a hardworking woman, very cheerful and with a lot of motivation for making her family prosper. She lives with her three children in the town of Ibarra. She works with her brother-in-law weaving woollen clothes such as coats, hats, and gloves. Mónica has been in this line of business for one year and she has been steadily accruing her clientele because of the excellent work she does. She now needs to increase her production in order to generate sales and income, and has thus taken out a loan with the intention of buying wool to make coats, trusting she will earn more if she produces more. Mónica dreams of buying more machines and being able to hire personnel in order to make her business grow, produce more, and earn more, ultimately improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wool to make more coats.

loans.name: Irungu

texts.en:
Irungu, who is now 29 years old and married, has a motorcycle transport business. He has been in the business for the past five years and this will be his first loan.

He plans to use the loan amount to buy motorcycle spare parts and service his motorcycle. In the future, Irungu hopes to invest more in transport business, make more income and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran, who lives in Brnakot village with his wife and parents, has been running a farm for eight years. He currently breeds 50 cows and 500 sheep and also cultivates potatoes.

Though Seyran grows grass on his farm, it is not enough to feed the cattle, so he needs to purchase additional grass. He also needs some funds to cover the transportation costs for his milk products and potato harvest. This loan will help Seyran to keep developing his business products, which will provide a stable income for him and his family.

loans.use: to pay for grass and transportation.

loans.name: Hosana Group

texts.fr: La cliente Charlotte est leader du le groupement  d’affaire Hozana, âgée de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Son mari est un commerçant détaillant. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans cette activité de commerce de divers. Elle expose ses marchandises tout près d’un parking (bon Voyage), pointe stratégique pour les potentiels clients voyageurs. Elle commença son entreprise avec son fonds propre, quand, elle avait encore 18 ans. Plus tard, elle sollicita le soutien de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec les articles divers (cigarettes, bijoux, biscuits, savons, sucres, etc.). Dit-elle, sa famille dépend de cette activité. Grace a ces crédits qu’elle bénéficie, elle supporte aisément les frais scolaires, l’alimentation, etc.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes
texts.en:
Charlotte, age 41, is the leader of the business group Hosana. She is married with eight children. Her husband is a retailer. She and her husband support one another in the sale of various products. She displays her goods near the Bon Voyage parking lot, a strategic location where travelers constitute potential customers. She started her business at age 18 with her own funds, and later turned to the Hekima MFI for financial support. 

She will use this new loan to stock up on merchandise (cigarettes, jewellery, biscuits, soap, sugar, etc.). Her family depends on this activity. The loans that she obtains allow her to pay for tuition, food, etc. without difficulty. 

Charlotte wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping women who own small businesses to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to stock up on various items (cigarettes, jewellery, biscuits, soap, sugar, etc.) for sale.

loans.name: Monica Patricia

texts.es: La chuletas, el lomo y  en general la carne porcina, son las especialidades de Mónica, pues desde hace 14 años,   su madre se dedicó a la comercialización de este producto y por eso conoció su sistema de compra y de comercialización. Para Mónica a sus 25 años, esta actividad se ha convertido en una forma de generar ingresos   para sostenerse y planear su futuro; es por esto que  en la terraza de su casa,  se ubica los fines de semana para vender carne de cerdo por libras, a una clientela que  identifica este producto como muy fresco, de muy buena calidad y por eso regresan. Mónica compra en granjas campesinas, con una frecuencia semanal y distribuye entre las amas de casa vecinas y tiendas, que con anticipación le han encargado para su venta, la cual hace de contado. Su meta es lograr ampliar su negocio y aumentar cada vez más su  clientela, pero su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para tal fin. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mari Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen carne de cerdo, para abordar otros sectores en los cuales no ha incursionado, pues planea   aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y   mejorar  aun mas sus ingresos con la inversión de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Chops, loin and pork meat in general are Mónica’s specialities as, since she was 14 years old, her mother was engaged in selling this product and she, too, learned the system of buying and marketing pork. For Mónica, who is now 25 years old, this business has become a way of generating income to support herself and plan her future. Consequently, you can find her on the terrace of her house on weekends selling pork by the pound to a clientele that identifies this product as very fresh and good quality and therefore, they return..

Mónica buys from rural farms weekly and distributes to neighboring housewives and stores that have commissioned the sale in advance and which she does in cash. Her goal is to expand her business and increase her customer base, however her working capital is insufficient for such an end. This is the reason she has come for a Kiva loan, her first funding from Fundación Mari Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy pork meat in greater volume in order to venture into other areas she has not tackled before. Thus she plans to expand the volume of her sales and increase her income even more with her Kiva loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase pork meat in greater volume.

loans.name: Fearness Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to once again present to you these small-scale entrepreneurs from Makeni city. These women are very grateful for the previous loan of 1,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones they received from Kiva lenders, a loan they have since repaid.

They are now requesting a new loan of 1,700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones each to further expand and develop their respective businesses. As earlier, Rugiatu, who is the leader of the group, will be privileged to buy fish, palm oil, rice, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy fish, palm oil, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is going on with his business. Thanks to his occupation, Armen keeps his young family and his mother as well. His first Kiva loan was used to buy raw material for his business. Recently Armen has constructed a new rolling device and a cardboard cutting device by himself. This fact has allowed Armen to develop his business and thus to increase his profit. 

Now Armen is asking for a $ 2,500 loan to buy a large lot of raw materials: tin foil and plastic wrap for his business.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of raw materials: tin foil and plastic wrap for his business

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 31-year-old married man and the father of three children. He has been working as a mechanic since 1994. He is a hard-working man with a good reputation who seeks perfection in his business and in his customer service.

Fouad works hard on updating his business. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy newly released tools, other than those he already bought with the previously requested loan. He will also invest part of the loan in laying down floor tiles at home to keep it a healthy living place. 

He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three cycles. He is a borrower in good standing and has proved to be a hard-working man. This was shown through his business improvements and through the updating of his tools. As is obvious in his village, Fouad is liked by most of his neighbors who represent almost 90% of his customers. They highly recommend dealing with him. He is working hard on providing his children with the best education ever, in addition to a healthy and happy childhood.

Fouad is still planning on expanding his business by opening a bigger garage in the future and adding new services, and he will try his best to make it come true.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 37 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his agrovet shop, which sells back sprayers, seeds, herbicides and fungicides. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more herbicides, seeds and other products for his shop, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and buy more goods to increase his stock which will help him to accumulate his income. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to grow his agrovet business . 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies to sell in his agro-vet business

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 42 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Dorothy has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Dorothy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes like jeans shirts for resale, and will help Dorothy to generate greater profits and open up another clothing business. Dorothy hopes that in the future she will be able to build more houses to rent out. 

Dorothy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dorothy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes like jeans shirts for resale

loans.name: Natividad Ramona

texts.es:
Natividad , habita en la ciudad de León , se dedica a la venta de comida típica tales como vigoron , baho, enchiladas. Ella lleva 20 años dedicándose  a ser comerciantes, la mayoría de sus clientes son los trabajadores de fabricas quienes salen a buscar almuerzo . Es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos que gracias a este negocio ha logrado mantener su hogar.
Muchos de sus clientes según nos dice ella la buscan por el sabor casero que le pone a sus comidas , la esposa de uno de sus hijos la ayudan a atender el negocio. Ella anhela tener su propio local de comidas bien acondicionadas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Esta solicitando el crédito para comprar arroz, verduras, platos plásticos, frutas para realizar sus comidas y refrescos naturales.
texts.en: Natividad lives in the city of León, she sells typical food for a living, such as, pork rinds, vaho (a traditional meal of steamed meat and vegetables) and enchiladas. She has been doing this for 20 years; most of her customers are the factory workers who buy food from her at lunch time. She is a single mother, she has 5 children who she has been able to support at home thanks to this business. She says that most of her customers buy from her because of the homemade taste she adds to her food. The wife of one of her sons helps her provide service at the business. She yearns to have a food store of her own, properly furnished to provide a better service to her customers. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, vegetables, plastic plates and fruits to cook her meals and make natural soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, plastic plates and fruits

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 32-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be honest and a generous woman. She operates a tailoring business where she sells dresses. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Omar describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a sewing machine. Her business goal is to run her own dressing school within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with profits generated.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kibwana

texts.en:
Kibwana, age 25, lives peacefully with his family in his own home in the village of Kaloleni. To earn a living, he operates a clothing sales business, providing his services to people living in his community and at the market. He has been engaged in this type of business since 2008, earning in the vicinity of KES 15,000 per month. Kibwana is responsible for three children who are attending school.

Kibwana is now asking for a loan of KES 35,000 to invest in his business. He will purchase bundles of clothes for resale using this loan. He hopes to improve his general living conditions and increase his business activities to pursue a higher standard of living.

loans.use: purchase bundles of clothes for resale

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 36 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of which are currently in school. For the past three years, Annet has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells soft drinks and beer. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beer and drinks to sell, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and expand her income through improved bar sales. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to make her bar bigger. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell at her bar

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 48 years old, married to Alice, and supports his family. He has run a poultry farm for the last three years, making a monthly income of KES. 16,000. 

This is his first loan of KES. 75,000 from KADET LTD, with which he plans to buy additional chicks to sell at maturity. The anticipated profits will help him start a money transfer facility. 


His future dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks for rearing and resale after maturity

loans.name: Maruja Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maruja es una persona que se considera tranquila, alegre, trabajadora, amable y servicial lo que hace que sus clientes acudan a su local. Maruja vive con su esposo y su hija en Urcuquí que se encuentra a 20 minutos de Ibarra.

Maruja trabaja con una ayudante en un local de venta de comida, este negocio ha ido creciendo constantemente, ya que empezó vendiendo asados en la calle y cuando logró obtener una buena cantidad de clientes e ingresos pudo alquilar un local donde actualmente vende desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas. El crédito que ha solicitado a Fodemi es para la compra de vajilla, mesas, sillas, refrescos al por mayor y un congelador , víveres para mejorar el aspecto de su local. 

Maruja sueña en tener su propia casa y local para que sus imgresos sean mayores y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maruja is considered a quiet, happy, hardworking, friendly and helpful person, qualities that attract customers to her business. She lives with her husband and daughter in Urcuquí, located 20 minutes from Ibarra.

Maruja works with an assistant at a locale where she sells meals. This business has been growing constantly since she began selling barbecue in the street until she succeeded in attracting a good number of clients and enough income and was able to rent a space where she currently sells breakfast, lunch and afternoon snacks. The loan she has requested from Fodemi is to purchase tableware, tables, chairs, drinks wholesale and a freezer and provisions in order to improve the appearance of her place.

Maruja dreams of owning her own house and business premises, so that her income will increase and she will be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tableware, tables, chairs, soft drinks wholesale and a freezer and provisions in order to improve the appearance of her place.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica es una joven muy trabajadora, es madre de 2 pequeños de 5 año y uno de 4 meses, ella es muy amorosa y sobre todo es muy luchadora ya que junto a su esposo trabajan muy duro para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y tengan una vida digna y sobre todo sean muchos mejores que ellos. Su vivienda su ubica en la linda ciudad de Pucallpa, ubicada en la selva de nuestro país y donde encontramos flora y fauna impresionante, sobre todo porque es un lugar donde podemos despejarnos del bullicio de la ciudad y apreciar paisajes hermosos. Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platillos favoritos es el riquísimo “picadillo de paiche”, asimismo en sus tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear con su hijos para poder conversar y pasar un momento de familia. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres Veronica solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Secretariado.

Día a día Veronica trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente, Verónica cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de buena calidad a precios cómodos.

Veronica está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercaderia para su negocio como cajas de leche, arroz, azúcar, verduras al por mayor, entre otros y tambien poder construir una cerca alrededor de su vivienda para poder tener mayor seguridad, de esta manera podra tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y ptambien tener una vivienda más segura, de esta manera ell apodra seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y poder tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Veronica is a hardworking, young mother of two small children, one 5 years old and the other 4 months. She is very loving and, most of all, dedicated, as she and her husband work very hard to provide their children with decent living conditions that they hope will be much better than those of their youth. Their house is in the beautiful city of Pucallpa, located in the country's northern forest, where the flora and fauna are extraordinary. Here you can escape the city noise and marvel at the gorgeous surroundings. As an upstanding Peruvian, she loves the country's cuisine; one of her favorite traditional dishes is the delicious dried salted fish, “picadillo de paiche.” In her free time, she likes to take her children for a walk so that they can chat and be together. Veronica would have loved to be a professional secretary; however, her parents had few financial resources, and she was only able to finish fifth grade.

Each day Veronica works in her grocery store for about 10 hours and serves up to 10 customers. Veronica believes her business prospers because she is friendly with her customers and offers quality products at affordable prices. Veronica is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support that will enable her to buy merchandise like cases of milk, rice, sugar, wholesale vegetables, and other items for her business and offer a wider variety to her customers. She will also be able to build a wall around her house to make it safer and continue working toward her greatest dream: "To give her children a good education and to have a minimarket."

loans.use: to buy merchandise like cases of milk, rice, sugar, wholesale vegetables, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 19-year-old single man from Ain. He has been working at raising livestock for six years. His family made him start working early because they needed extra money for living expenses. 

As was mentioned in the previous loan request, Mahdi didn't finish his education and he really feels sad for not doing so. He had a dream to make come true but he knows all he's got are his loyal friends. He believes that he must do his best to keep everything suitable and comforting for them.

Mahdi works hard at raising his livestock in clean and healthy surroundings to make sure that they will provide him with the best quality of milk to be sold. He sells his goats' milk and meat depending on customers' requests. He is requesting a youth loan from Al Majmoua, in order to expand the barn for his herd and to keep their living place healthy and updated with the best equipment necessary for the winter season. He hopes to increase his herd through future loans to be requested.

loans.use: to expand the barn for his herd.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Cecilio, él pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú. Nuestro socio apostó junto a su hermano hace algún tiempo por el negocio de la construcción, formando juntos una empresa de fabricación de bloquetas o ladrillos de concreto, para la construcción y edificación de edificios, nuestro socio gracias al crecimiento de esta empresa ha podido incrementar sus ingresos económicos y de esta manera mejoró la calidad de vida integral de su familia, dando una mejor educación a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro. El señor Cecilio invertirá su préstamo para comprar la materia prima que le permita producir sus ladrillos, en este caso comprará cemento y piedra chancada.
El gran sueño de Cecilio es hacer crecer a su empresa y desarrollarse como una empresa consultora de construcción a nivel regional.
 Cecilio agradece a  KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse con su actividad y seguir creciendo cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Our member is Cecilio. He belongs to the communal bank "Tercer Milenio" in the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Peru. Our member, along with his brother, took a chance on the construction business some time ago. Together they started a business of manufacturing cement blocks or concrete bricks for the construction and building of buildings. Cecilio, thanks to the growth of this business, has been able to increase his economic profits and in this way, improved his family's whole quality of life, giving a better education to his children so that they will have a better future. Cecilio will invest his loan to buy the raw material that will allow him to produce his bricks. In this case, he will buy cement and crushed stone. 
Cecilio's big dream is to grow his business and develop it as a construction consulting firm at a regional level. 
Cecilio thanks KIVA for allowing him to develop his work and to continue growing more each time.

loans.use: to buy cement and crushed stone

loans.name: Alfredo Jesus

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 30 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa y junto a ella tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 8años.,a quienes ama muchísimo y sobre todo son su motor para salir adelante cada día y poder ser mejor cada día a pesar de los problemas que se presentan cada día, pero con solo ver a su familia se olvida de todo y sigue adelante. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, maíz, frejol, entre otros, también se le conoce por uno de sus platillos típicos mas riquísimos el cual es el “chupe de Camarones”. Cuando dispone d un tiempito libre a Alfredo le gusta mucho pasear con su familia. Debido a su pocos recursos económicos solo ha podido estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Alfredo trabaja en su negocio como carpintero, especialmente en la construcción de casas prefabricadas, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 2 clientes en el día ya que es un poco trabajoso; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo honesto con los clientes por ello siempre lo recomiendan.

Alfredo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como construir paredes, ya que actualmente su vivienda es de tripley y esteras, de esta manera el podrá ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia, con lo cual seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y tener una carpintería mas grande”.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 30 years old.  He lives with his wife and together they have 2 children ages 9 and 8. He loves them all very much and they above all are the engine that motivates him to move forward every day and to be better every day despite problems that arise every day.  Just seeing his family helps him to forget everything and move on. His house is located in the city of Camana, a city that is characterized by a warm and welcoming climate.  Thus, agriculture is popular, especially the growing of rice, corn, and beans among other things.  The city is also known for one of its most typical and delicious dishes, which is the "chupe de camarones" or finger-licking shrimp.  When he has a bit of free time, Alfredo likes to spend it with his family.  Because of the family's low income, Alfredo could only study up to the fifth grade, but he would have liked very much to have a college degree.

Alfredo works daily in his business as a carpenter, especially in the construction of prefabricated houses.  He works about 10 hours a day and can serve up to two clients per day, since he is a bit of a workaholic.  He thinks he does well in his business because he is very responsible and above all honest with customers, and for that reason they always recommend him.

Alfredo is very grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have given he will be able to make improvements to his home such as building walls, because his home is currently made of plywood and woven mats.  In this way he can continue improving his family's quality of life and working to fulfill his greatest dream: "To give a good education for their children and to have a larger carpentry shop."

loans.use: to improve his home (construction of walls)

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 30 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Leonard has been working hard to manage his retail and grocery shop, which sells grocery food stuffs and general goods. 

To help expand his business, Leonard has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more basins, sugar, posho, beans and airtime to sell, and will help Leonard to generate greater profits and increase his daily income since he is adding more stock to his business. Leonard hopes that in the future he will be able to grow his retail shop even more. 

Leonard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Leonard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more basins, sugar, and other general goods for his store

loans.name: Umry

texts.en:
Umry is a very beautiful woman. Also, she is very clever and a successful business woman. For more than three years, she has been busy with own store. She sells necessary things for people such as clocks, thread, needles and souvenirs, etc. She has her own shop and a lot of customers. She has a wide assortment and it attracts many customers. 

Umry is married and has two children. She tries to do the best for her children. Her husband helps her with all her deals. She wants to develop her business but her income isn't enough for it and you are the only one who can help her. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy goods for developing her business. She awaits your help and support.

loans.use: to buy clocks and needles for widening her assortment

loans.name: Duo Eucalipto Group

texts.es: Dúo Eucalipto Este Dúo Está integrado por Claudia  ella es soltera vive con su mama ella se dedica a la venta de productos Mexicanos el cual compra en Tapachula ella solicita un nuevo crédito ya que la demanda de su clientela ha aumentado y necesita satisfacer las necesidades de ellos ya que el capital que ella trabaja es muy poco y como cada día el precio de los productos aumenta y la ganancia sigue siendo lo mismo es por eso que quiere aumentar su capital para aumentar su ganancia para poder aperturar una cuenta de ahorro para cuando ella tenga una edad más avanzada, no tenga de que preocuparse el sueño más grande de ella es terminar de estudiar y ser alguien en la vida. Está solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos Mexicanos, como, arroz, frijol, aceite etc.
texts.en: Claudia is part of the Dúo Eucalipto group.  She is single and lives with her mother.  She works selling Mexican food products that she buys in Tapachula.  She is asking for a new credit since the demand from her customers has increased and she needs to satisfy their needs.  The capital that she has is very small and every day the price of her products goes up and her income stays steady.  For that reason she wants to increase her capital in order to increase her income and be able to open a savings account so that when she is older she will not have to worry.  Her greatest dream is to finish studying and to become someone in life.  She is asking for this credit in order to purchase Mexican food products like rice, beans, oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy Mexican food products like rice, beans, oil, etc.

loans.name: Sawuga

texts.en:
Sawuga is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has 10 children, 1 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Sawuga has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells general home use items and clothing. 

To help expand her business, Sawuga has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more inputs like toilet paper and clothing to sell in her business. This will help Sawuga to generate greater profits and expand her business through increased supplies. Sawuga hopes that, in the future, she will be able to increase her customer base. 

Sawuga is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sawuga who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more inputs like toilet paper and clothing to sell in her business.

loans.name: Miika

texts.en:
Miika is 41 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children, six of which are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Miika has been working hard to manage his produce shop, which sells produce like posho, beans, and coffee. 

To help expand his business, Miika has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beans, coffee, pasho, and millet and will help Miika to generate greater profits and increase his income since he is buying more produce to sell. Miika hopes that in the future he will be able to sell produce on a larger scale. 

Miika is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Miika who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more beans, coffee, pasho, and millet

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 50 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 20 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, like jeans shirts, for resale. Increased supplies will help Sarah to increase her sales and generate greater profits. Sarah hopes that, in the future, she will be able to have a lot of money. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes like jeans shirts for resale.

loans.name: Erison

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Erison, él pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú. Nuestro socio apostó hace algún tiempo al negocio de la construcción, formando al lado de su hermano una empresa de fabricación de bloquetas o ladrillos de concreto, para la construcción de edificaciones y edificios, gracias al crecimiento de esta empresa, nuestro socio ha podido incrementar sus ingresos económicos y de esta manera mejoró la calidad de vida integral de su familia. El señor Erison invertirá su préstamo para comprar la materia prima que le permita producir sus ladrillos, en este caso comprará cemento y piedra chancada.
El gran sueño de Erison es hacer crecer a su empresa y desarrollarse como una empresa consultora a nivel regional.
 Erison agradece a  KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse con su actividad y seguir creciendo cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Our member is Sr. Erison who belongs to the “Tercer Milenio” Communal Bank in the Province of Urubamba in Cusco, Perú. Some time ago, he backed a construction business that he established with his brother. The business produces concrete blocks or bricks for building construction. Thanks to the growth of this business, our member has been able to increase his income and in this way he improved the quality of life of his entire family. 

Erison will invest the loan in purchasing raw material to produce his bricks; in this case he will buy cement and crushed stone. His great dream is to have his business grow and develop into a regional consulting firm.

He is grateful to Kiva for allowing him to develop his business and continue to grow even more

loans.use: to purchase cement and ground stone.

loans.name: Matano

texts.en: Mr. Matano lives in Kenya. He is single and earns a living running a coconut-selling business, which he started in 2010. His goal is to develop his business and maximize his profits and personal income. He is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 from Yehu, where he is a member. The money from this first loan will allow him to buy a stock of coconuts in order to meet the growing demand of his customers. He hopes to increase his turnover and to raise the level of his savings. His ambition is to become an important businessman.

loans.use: to buy a stock of coconuts

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 31 years old and is married. She has four children. Epiphanie purchases and sells various goods such as: lotions, cooking oil, soap, Colgate, etc. She has been in this business for four years, and she starts her work from 8 a.m to 7 p.m every day, except on Sunday, of the week. Epiphanie currently employs two people to help her in the business.

Epiphanie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as: lotions, cooking oil, soap, toothpaste, etc. for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, and she will be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as: lotions, cooking oil, soap, toothpaste, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Monif

texts.en:
Monif is 26 years old, single, and has four children. This entrepreneur has had as his economic activity a grocery store for 8 years. He lives in Taiz, Yemen.

The business came about through the necessity of having to work in order to provide for his family. He took out a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy  bread, milk, canned foods, and soft drinks for his business.  Thanks to his tenacity and responsibility he hopes to fulfill dreams and personal goals, such as expanding his business, improving his housing, and educating his children.

loans.use: to buy  bread, milk, canned foods, and soft drinks for his business.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is 33 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Sauda has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells snacks and general homeuse items. 

To help expand her business, Sauda has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more inputs like eggs and bread to sell in her business, and will help Sauda to generate greater profits and increase her customer base. Sauda hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her income and profits from increased supply in her business. 

Sauda is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sauda who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more inputs like eggs and bread to sell in her business.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en: Israel is 42 years old. He has 9 children between the ages of 8 and 36. The oldest child is no longer a student—he works for himself. Israel has spent ten years selling different items in the boutique. He wants the loan to buy more salt and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more soap, salt, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Araksi

texts.en:
Araksi is involved in agriculture. Together with her husband, she raises cows, cultivates wheat and potatoes, and grows apple, pear, and walnut trees. Araksi needs some financial investments for autumn sowing. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel for agricultural equipment. Araksi will also purchase some forage for the cattle. 

Araksi lives with her husband and 4 children: 3 daughters and 1 son. Araksi's husband works at the local rescue service, but the family’s main income is from agriculture. Stable development of the farm is vital for Araksi to have financial stability and ensure a prosperous life for her children.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, forage, and diesel fuel

loans.name: Maritza Waleska

texts.es:
Maritza, tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en el municipio de Trujillo, Colon junto con sus dos hijas que son menores de edad, una de ellas está en la escuela.
Maritza tiene su propio negocio que lo estableció hace dos años, vende golosinas y comida, como refrescos, churros, pollo frito, chuleta de cerdo frita, tacos, pastelitos rellenos de carne y arroz etc.  Este negocio lo tiene en local propio y vende todo el día, tiene contrato con una cooperativa quien le compra almuerzos. Lo ha mantenido mediante la inversión de préstamos, actualmente solicita el tercero y es por 25,000.00 Lempiras con el cual va surtir el negocio de insumos como ser: carnes, vegetales, arroz, manteca, harina y otros para preparar las comidas y  golosinas y aumentar las ventas, además quiere mejorar el  local del negocio para brindar un mejor servicio, lo cercará de tela metálica para cubrir de insectos y pondrá un mueble. Su meta es crecer en su negocio  y darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza, age 25, is a single mother.  She lives in the Trujillo municipality in Colon with her two minor daughters, and they go to school.

Maritza established her own business two years ago.  She sells sweets and food like soft drinks, churros, fried chicken, fried pork chops, tacos, pastries, and peppers stuffed with meat and rice, etc.

She has this business at her own place, and she sells all day.  She has a contract with a cooperative that buys lunches from her.  She has maintained the business by investing the loans.

She is currently requesting her third loan for 25,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to stock the business with supplies like meats, vegetables, rice, lard, flour, and others.  She will do this in order to prepare the food and sweets and to increase sales.  She also wants to improve her place of business in order to provide better service.  She will enclose it with fine-wire netting to cover it from insects, and she will add a piece of furniture.

Her goal is to grow in her business and to give her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to stock her business with supplies to make food and sweets to sell.  She will also make improvements to her place of business.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 30 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, especialmente se cultiva el algodón, la uva, esparrago, entre otros, podemos encontrar también lugares turísticos como lo es la linda “Laguna e Huacachina”, ubicada en medio de Dunas impresionantes y en las cuales se puede practicar deportes de aventura como el sanboard. Como buen peruano le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos, el cual es el riquísimo “arroz con pollo”. Jose estudio la carrera de Técnico electricista, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar en la universidad.

Día a día Jose trabaja en su negocio de  reparación y venta de equipos celulares y accesorios para los mismos, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 35 clientes al día; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable u cumplido con sus clientes.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas eléctricas como medidores de energía, desarmadores, alicates, entre otras herramientas necesarias para brindar su servicio, de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Jose is a hard-working man. He is thirty years old and lives in the city of Ica, a city known for its very warm and friendly climate. As a result of the climate, there is lots of agriculture in the area. Specifically, cotton, grapes, and asparagus, among other crops, are cultivated here. We can also find tourist spots, such as the beautiful Laguna de Huacachina, which is located in the middle of impressive dunes where adventure sports such as sandboarding are popular. Like a good Peruvian, Jose enjoys eating one of his favorite delicious dishes, chicken and rice. Jose studied to be an electrician, but he would have liked to study in a university.
	
From day to day, Jose works at his business repairing and selling cellular phones and their accessories. He works around eight hours a day, and he can help up to thirty-five customers in a day. He believes his business is going well because he is very responsible and courteous with his customers.

Jose is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since it is through the help they have provided him that he will be able to purchase electric equipment such as electricity meters, screwdrivers, and pliers, among other tools necessary to offer his services. In this way he will increase his income and will be able to continue working to be able to realize his biggest dream: “Build a house.”

loans.use: To purchase tools(screwdrivers and pliers, among other).

loans.name: Merimee

texts.fr: Mérimée est un jeune homme de 30 ans,célibataire sans enfant,mais qui a à sa charge un de ses petits frères.Il gère un cybercafé dans un quartier de la capitale économique depuis 03 ans déjà et fait en plus de cela, mais conjointement des activités  bureautique.Internet est un phénomène qui se répand de plus en plus et touche toutes les couches sociales ce qui est un marché en pleine expansion et très rentable pour les gérants de cybercafé,mais cependant ce dernier ne profite pas assez de ce phénomène à cause du petit nombre de ses ordinateurs ,ce qui ne lui permet pas d'avoir une clientèle considérable et d'augmenter ses bénéfices.Il voudrait donc ce crédit pour de pouvoir acheter des ordinateurs afin de plus équiper et d'agrandir son cybercafé ce qui l'aidera à attirer plus de clients et augmentera par conséquent ses bénéfices.Bénéfices qui l'aideront  à étendre son cybercafé et à ouvrir d'autres d'une part et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mérimée, age 30, is a single man without children but with a younger brother in his care. For the past three years, he has been running a cybercafé in a district of the economic capital while also working in office technology services. 

The Internet phenomenon is spreading steadily and reaching all social classes, which makes it an expanding and profitable market for cybercafé managers. 

Mérimée, however, is unable to take advantage of this due to the small number of computers at his disposal, which prevents him from attracting a high volume of customers and bolster his profits. 

He is seeking a loan to buy computers in order to be better equipped to expand his cybercafé, which will help to attract more customers and boost his revenue. The profits will allow him to further expand his activity by opening other locations, and to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 30 years old and lives in the town of Rubindi in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, 2 of which are currently in school. For the past 4 years, Moses has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells sugar, salt, posho, and other food stuffs. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more rice, posho, and sugar, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and increase his daily income since more stock will be added to his store. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a big retail shop. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more rice, posho, and sugar

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose tiene 33 años, pero nos comenta que se considera como un joven de 20 porque es muy trabajador y porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz, maíz, frejoles, entre otros, se desarrolla también la pesca y es una ciudad donde se puede comer platillos típicos muy ricos, principalmente el “Chupe de Camarones, posee playas hermosas y un clima cálido y acogedor. Jose vive al lado de su esposa con quien tiene 2 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo y por quienes da la vida y se esfuerza por sacarlos adelante ya que él quiere que sean mejores que el y sobre todo sean personas de bien. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio y sobre todo compartir un rico plato de Chupe de Camarones. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Jose solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado muchos estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Jose trabaja en su pequeña parcela en donde él se dedica a su labores como agricultor, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas, sobre todo porque siempre está al pendiente del regado y cuidados de los cultivos; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y porque le gusta ser agricultor.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono y fertilizantes para el cuidado de su cultivo, con lo cual le permitirá tener una buena cosecha y sobre todo porque mejorar su calidad de vida, así el seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y darle una buena educación  su hijos”.
texts.en:
Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono y fertilizantes para el cuidado de su cultivo, con lo cual le permitirá tener una buena cosecha y sobre todo porque mejorar su calidad de vida, así el seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y darle una buena educación  su hijos”.

Jose is 33 years old.  He says that he feels like a young man of twenty because he is very hard working and has a strong desire to get ahead in life.  He lives in Camaná, a city known for its warm and welcoming climate and beautiful beaches as well as its well-developed agriculture, which includes the cultivation of rice, corn, beans, and others.  The fishing industry is also well-developed and it is a city where one can eat very delicious typical dishes, especially “Chupe de Camarones” (Peruvian shrimp chowder).  Jose lives with his wife and they have two children.  He loves his children very much and dedicates his life to them. He strives to get them ahead because he wants them to be better than himself and above all, he wants them to be good people.  When he has free time, he really enjoys playing football with his neighbors and friends from his neighborhood.  But more than anything, he enjoys sharing a delicious plate of “Chupe de Camarones”.  Jose did not have sufficient resources to  complete his education beyond secondary school but he would have very much liked to study for a university degree.  

Jose works day to day on his small plot of land where he is dedicated to farming.  He works about ten hours, and most importantly, he always keeps an eye on the watering and care of the crops.  He feels that his business is going well because he is very responsible and he enjoys being a farmer.  
Jose is very grateful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to purchase compost and fertilizer for the care of his crops, which will allow him to have a good harvest and most importantly, improve his quality of life.  In this way, he will continue working and be able to realize his greatest dream:  “To improve his family’s quality of life and provide his children with a good education”.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Patricia es una joven muy alegre y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener atractivos turísticos como “Las Islas Ballestas y el candelabro de paracas”, quienes reciben a muchos turistas en todo el año, ya que son paisajes hermosos, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y también la ganadería y la pesca. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho hacer deporte sobre todo le gusta juagar vóley con sus vecinos de su barrio, como buena peruana le gusta mucho comer nuestra comida típica, pero el platillo que le encanta es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de administración de empresas.

Con mucha dedicación Patricia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque e muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos bonitos y de buena calidad.

Patricia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le  han brindado ella podrá compra mostradores para su negocio y mercadería como blusas, sacos, pantalones, entre otros, de esta manera ella podrá tener mas variedad de productos para ofrecer y también podrá mostrar sus productos de manera más llamativa, así ella mejorara sus ingresos y seguirá luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener un local propio para su negocio”.
texts.en: Patricia is a very cheerful and enthusiastic young woman. She lives in the town of Pisco, which has many tourist attractions such as the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabra. These attract many tourists all year round, since they are beautiful landscapes. This benefits sectors such as agriculture, animal husbandry, and fishing immensely. When Patricia has some free time she loves to practice sports; she likes especially to play volleyball with people from her neighbourhood. In good Peruvian fashion, she loves to eat traditional food, her favourite dish being the delicious 'Pepper Chicken'. Due to the low income of her parents, she was only able to study until the fifth year of secondary school, but she would really have liked to get a degree in business administration. Patricia works with all her might in her small business of selling men's, women's, and children's clothes. She works about 10 hours a day and sometimes tends to as many as 30 customers a day. She thinks she owes her success to being very nice to customers and, above all, because she offers nice-looking products of good quality. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders, for thanks to their help she will be able to buy counters for her business as well as merchandise such as blouses, coats, trousers, etc. Thus she will have a wider range of products to sell, and be able to display her products in a more arresting way; this in turn will increase her income. She will continue to fight every day to make her greatest dream come true: "I want to have my own house and my own place for my business".

loans.use: to buy counters and merchandise.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: LA SEÑORA SALOME, es una persona de 47 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su casa propia y cuenta con 4 dependientes económicos a cargo. La actividad económica principal de la clienta es la producción agrícola y los principales productos que cultiva  son la papa y haba en sus propios terrenos que se hallan ubicadas en la comunidad de Parra Rancho del municipio de Tíraque que esta distante a 65 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora manifiesta ser una persona responsable y trabajadora que quiere incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa que  a partir de su producción le permitirá generar a nuestra clienta un mayor ingreso económico que mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Salome, age 47, is single, and she has an elementary school education.  She lives in her own house, and she has four dependents under her care.

Her main business activity is farming.  The main products that she grows are potatoes and beans.  She grows these on her own land in the Parra Rancho community in the Tíraque municipality.  It is 65 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.

She says that she is a responsible and hard-working person.  She wants to increase her agricultural production.  In order to do so, she needs to request a loan for capital to invest.  She will use the loan to buy chicken manure and potato seeds.  Her production will allow her to generate greater income that will improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Sorbeh Iii Group

texts.en:
Members of the "Sorbeh III" group are very grateful to their Kiva lenders for the earlier loan they received. The previous loan has been a blessing to the lives and businesses of these borrowers. They were able to invest the loan into their businesses, which led to a significant growth in their business inventories. Their level of sales and profit margins also increased significantly, thanks to the loan they received from Kiva's lending community. 

Having repaid their loan successfully, members of the Sorbeh III deem it fit to re-apply for a new loan of 1,200,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for each member. With this loan they will further invest in their respective businesses. As mentioned in her first borrower's profile, group leader Adama will again buy rice, palm-oil, sugar, margi, gari, etc. at wholesale prices to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, sugar, margi, gari, etc. at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa is 52 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 8 children. For the past 10 years, Hasifa has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells soda, beer and waragi. 

To help expand her business, Hasifa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand her business by buying more drinks, and will help Hasifa to generate greater profits and increase her stock. Hasifa hopes that in the future she will be able to open up more bars. 

Hasifa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hasifa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks.

loans.name: Tentuan

texts.en:
Tentuan is 34 years old he is married and blessed with two children aged 12 and seven years respectively, his wife who is a farmer. He has been in the business for three years and earns an income of KES 10,000 per month.
