This his first loan from KADET LTD. A loan of KES 20,000 will help him purchase more sheep for fattening. The profits he makes will educate his children and allow them to have a better life.

His  future dream is to be the best sheep supplier in his county and have a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en: Jumaa lives with his life partner and makes a living selling charcoal. He has been working in this business for three years and has garnered a lot of experience which has helped him to improve his business skills from day to day. Jumaa is a visionary man with a keen desire to get ahead. He needs to invest in his business, which is why he has sought a loan from Yehu to buy more sacks of charcoal. Jumaa is a person of high moral standing and he has a good repayment history. He states that he will be able to repay the loan and, at the same time, offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mwanjuma

texts.en:
Mrs. Mwanjuma is 40 years old and has 6 children. She has over ten years experience running her own grocery store; she was previously a farmer. She buys the products that she needs for her store in the municipal market, about five kilometers from her place of residence. 

The loan she is asking for from Yehu is to purchase basic necessities and increase her store's stock. Her objective is to increase sales, which will allow her to improve her standard of living. With the earnings from her business, she will try to pay for her children's schooling, so that they can continue with their education. She will also to make improvements to her house.

Mwajuma lives in her own home that has neither electricity, nor piped water. The loan will enable her to purchase tomatoes, onions, cabbages, kales, etc.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, cabbages, kales, etc.

loans.name: Rauben

texts.en:
Rauben sells beans and sorghum. He is aged 31. He has been in the business for five years. 

With the loan requested, Rauben will ncrease the inventory of his store, while the profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 55 years old and single. She's sold secondhand clothes for ladies, men and children for the last 22 years and makes a monthly income of 10000 KES. 

She's applied for her sixth loan of 80000 KES from KADET, which she plans to use to purchase more clothes to sell. 

The anticipated profits will be used to purchase a residential plot. Her dream is to build on her plot.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married and has four children. She takes care of additional family members (her mother and father). 

Catherine has a business of selling of chapats. She has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from mcdt-sacco to buy more wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal. She works seven days a week and sells to categories of people, but on retail. Her major business challenges include the increasing prices of baking flour and cooking oil. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked bakery and to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is 55 years old. She has 15 children.  Some of them attend school. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum and the profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy sorghum

loans.name: Ara

texts.en: Ara lives in Aghavnadzor village with his wife, parents, son and daughter. Ara is involved in agriculture: He breeds cows and grows fruit trees. Ara has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle. With the requested loan he plans to purchase 3 cows and a calf. This will allow Ara to receive more milk for his dairy, the sales of which provide his main income. This will give Ara an opportunity to improve his family's living conditions and insure a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows and a calf

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 42 years old. She sells sorghum and has been in the business for the past 12 years. She wants the loan to have more sorghum to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old. She is married to Samuel, and together they have three children. She operates a restaurant and has been in this business for the past 11 years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to them by a field officer. She will use the loan to purchase wheat and maize flour, cooking fat, and rice. She will use part of the loan to open another business, which will be for charcoal sales.

She hopes to purchase a truck to help in the charcoal transportation.

loans.use: To purchase wheat and maize flour, cooking fat, and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Voskinar

texts.en: Voskinar lives in Yeghegnadzor with her husband and 7-year-old daughter. Voskinar and her husband have been involved in fish-breeding for 5 years. They have a few little lakes where they keep different types of fish. Now, Voskinar would like to add more types of fish in the lakes and offer a larger variety to her clients. She also wants to purchase fodder to feed her fish. This loan will help Voskinar to implement her plans and develop her business.

loans.use: To pay for fish and fodder

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is 54 year-old man who is married to Mwanahawa. Together they have four children, one of whom is still attending school. He has owned and operated a bicycle garage where he does servicing and also sells spare parts. He is a determined man who always works hard to sustain his family. Abdalla is focused on owning a retail shop in the future and even to open up more businesses. 

They reside in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He is requesting a loan of Ksh 15,000 to purchase spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married with two children, and all her children go to school.
  
She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a stationery-selling business.  She has been in this business for five years and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis.  She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings to buy more books and a book-binding machine.  She doesn’t have any other source of income.  Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of stationery and thieves. She aspires to own a fully stocked stationery shop and to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more books and a book-binding machine

loans.name: Dezilanta

texts.en:
Dezilanta is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. One of them is currently in school. For the past 9 years, Dezilanta has been working hard to manage her small business selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Dezilanta has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, like jeans and shirts, for resale, and will help Dezilanta to generate greater profits from an increase in her sales. Dezilanta hopes that in the future she will be able to become the richest woman in town. 

Dezilanta is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dezilanta who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, like jeans and shirts, for resale,

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 43 years old. She has eight children; four of them go to school, while the other four started to manage their small businesses, because she couldn't afford to send them to school. Her husband works as a farmer. She has requested a loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. Dative will use the profits from her business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a 52-year-old married woman blessed with five children, two of whom are still in school. She runs a cereals store which has been in operation for three years. The business brings in a monthly income of approximately KES 12,000 per month.

This is her second loan of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Yehu after successfully repaying her previous loans. She'll use the loan to purchase more maize, beans and dried peas for resale. She'll use the profits gained to pay school fees for her children.

Her hope is that her business does well so that she can venture into a large-scale cereals selling business.
Mwajuma lives in a cement house with electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, beans and dried peas for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, 42 years old, is a plumber in Kilifi. He is a married father of three children. He has been doing plumbing successfully for the past three years .

This is his second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase pliers, spanners and water pipes. He will use the anticipated profits from his business to educate his children and repay his KADET loan. He hopes to have a big business that is going to provide employment to the society.

loans.use: to purchase pliers, spanners and water pipes

loans.name: Wilson Rafael

texts.es: Wilson de 47 años de edad, vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y tiene 7 hijos en las edades de 15 a 26 años, con quienes sueña se conviertan en personas de éxito. El posee 15 años de experiencia en la fabricación de muebles de comedor, alcobas y de sala, en su propia ebanistería ubicada en un costado de su casa, la cual inició tomando como base la enseñanza de su tío en este oficio. Los productos de mayor rotación comercial son los multimuebles, juegos de alcoba y comedor, por eso aunque maneja todas las líneas, últimamente se ha enfocado en estas. En su proceso desarrolla todas las tareas productivas y de comercialización: compra de madera, pulida, corte preparación ensamble, acabado y ventas, las cuales realiza a pequeños almacenes ubicados en un corredor comercial del centro de la ciudad y a referidos por sus propio mercado. Su tarea diaria es intensa, él inicia su  trabajo desde la 7:00 am hasta las 7:00 de la noche y cada día se esmera en la perfección de su técnica con el fin de sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará madera, pintura, lija y triplex, en volúmenes, que permitan aumentar su producción y mejorara el volumen de sus ventas, lo cual es lo que hace que la inversión de credikiva sea muy exitosa.
texts.en: Wilson is 47 years old and lives in the south west of the city with his wife.  He has 7 children ranging in age from 15 to 26 years, and he dreams that they will become successful people. He has 15 years of experience in manufacturing furniture for dining rooms, bedrooms, and living rooms.  He has his own cabinetmaker's shop, located on the side of his house, which he started based on his uncle's teaching of the trade. The products in greatest demand are  entertainment centers, as well as bedroom and dining sets.  For that reason, although he can build all the lines, recently he has focused on these products.  In his business he handles all of the labor, purchasing and marketing: He purchases the wood, the polish, does the cut preparation and assembly, as well as the finishing and sales.  He completes his sales at small stores located in a commercial corridor in the center of town as well as through people referred to him via the market.  His daily work is intense.  He begins his work at 7:00 am and continues to 7:00 pm each day and strives to perfect his technique in order to help his family get ahead.  Currently he is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first financing that he is requesting from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  With the loan he will buy wood, paint, sand and plywood in volumes that can increase production and improve his sales volume, which is what makes the Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, sand and plywood in volumes that can increase production

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 37 years old. She sells bananas and sorghum and has been in this business for 12 years.  She plans to use this loan to buy more bananas.

If she is able to realize extra profit because of this loan, she will use it to provide food for her family. Julienne dreams to achieve more in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bananas

loans.name: Shamura

texts.en:
Shamura is 24 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her small business selling clothes. 

To expand her business, Shamura has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva field partner BRAC Uganda. She plans to use the loan to buy more clothes such as jeans and shirts.  Shamura hopes this will help to generate greater profits.

Shamura is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs such as Shamura who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 42 years old. She is the mother of three children, all of whom go to school.  Jacquline has been selling bananas for the past five years.

Jacqueline plas to use this loan to increase the volume of her business.  If she is able to realize greater profits as a result, she will use it  to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bananas

loans.name: Adam

texts.es: El Sr. Adam tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero, es chofer de transporte público  hace más de 6 años, actualmente el cliente vive en una casa alquilada, ya que solo tiene terrenos de su propiedad en el área rural, los cuales a futuro piensa trabajarlo con el fin de producir y de esa forma superarse ya que su aspiración es tener un terrenito dentro de la ciudad. El cliente nos comenta además que dice haber cursado hasta la primaria, ya que no pudo concluir el bachillerato por problemas económicos por los que atravesaban sus padres viéndose en la necesidad de buscar trabajo desde muy pequeño y por tanto dejar de lado los estudios, es así que ahora solicita el crédito para poder superarse y crecer ya que tiene muchas aspiraciones. Con el crédito que se le otorgue el piensa  refaccionar su vehículo Microbús, que con mucho sacrificio pudo comprarlo, con el cual espera percibir mayores ingresos  y de esa forma mejorar  su nivel de vida, puesto que con el crédito será más fácil avanzar en el sueño que quiere lograr,  además de sentirse más satisfecho de haber logrado lo que quiso.
texts.en: Adam is single, 30 years old, and has been a public transportation driver for 6 years. He is currently a tenant, since the only lands he owns are in the rural area. In the future, he would like to use them for agricultural production and thus move up in life, since his aspiration is to own a small piece of land inside the city. He says that he was able to complete only primary school, since he was not able to get a secondary school diploma because of his parents' financial troubles. Adam had to look for work at a young age and thus had no choice but to put aside his studies. That is why now he asks for a loan in order to move up in life and grow, since he has many aspirations. With the loan, he wants to repair his vehicle, a Microbus, which was purchased at the cost of a great sacrifice and with which he hopes to increase his income and thus improve his standard of living. Thanks to the loan he will be further along on the path toward his dream, and will also feel satisfied to have reached this intermediary goal of repairing his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair a public transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Ramela

texts.en: Ramela is involved in agriculture. She raises cows, pigs and keeps livestock. Ramela's two sons help their mother with agriculture. Ramela makes cheese from the milk she gets, which she sells in the regional center, Kapan town.  Now Ramela would like to increase the number of cattle by purchaseing two neats and a cow. This will allow Ramela to make more cheese from the milk and increase her sales. Ramela hopes to earn more income and then she will renovate her house and insure a better future for her sons.

loans.use: to pay for 2 neats and a cow

loans.name: Jessica Diana

texts.es:
Jessica es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene 19 años y con el fruto de su trabajo colabora con los gastos del hogar, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, especialmente se cultiva el algodón, la uva, esparrago, entre otros, podemos encontrar también lugares turísticos como lo es la linda “Laguna e Huacachina”, ubicada en medio de Dunas impresionantes y en las cuales se puede practicar deportes de aventura como el sanboard. En su tiempo libre e Jessica le gusta mucho escuchar música y sobre todo comer uno de sus platillos favoritos, el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de derecho.

Con mucho entusiasmo Jessica trabaja como promotora de ventas en una tienda de su ciudad, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a su familia, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y siempre atiende a los clientes con mucha amabilidad.

Jessica está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá compra una cocina a gas ya que en su vivienda tenían una cocina a Kerosene y hace algunos días debido a lo inflamable del combustible tuvo un pequeño accidente que gracias a Dios no paso a mayores y por ello con esta mejora podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y sobre todo más seguridad, así ella podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Tener su casa propis y seguir apoyando a su familia”.
texts.en:
Jessica is a very hard-working young woman. She is nineteen years old, and she contributes her earnings to help with household bills. Her home is located in the city of Ica, a city known for its very warm and friendly climate. As a result of the climate, there is lots of agriculture in the area. Specifically, cotton, grapes, and asparagus, among other crops, are cultivated here. We can also find tourist spots, such as the beautiful Laguna de Huacachina, which is located in the middle of impressive dunes where adventure sports such as sandboarding are popular. In her free time, Jessica likes to listen to music, and above all she enjoys eating one of her favorite delicious dishes, chicken and rice. Due to her limited economic resources, she only attended high school, but she would have liked to study law.

Jessica works with lots of enthusiasm as a sales promoter in a store in her city. Since she helps her family with her earnings, she works around eight hours a day and can help up to thirty customers in a day. She believes that her work is going well for her because she is very responsible and always helps her customers with lots of kindness.

Jessica is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have provided her she will be able to purchase a gas stove. Currently, her family has a kerosene stove, which, due to the flammable nature of the fuel, had a small accident a couple days ago. Thankfully, it did not get out of hand, and as a result, with this improvement she will be able to provide a better quality of life to her family, and more importantly, more safety. This way, she will be able to continue working so she will be able to realize her biggest dream: “Have her own home and continue to help her family.”

loans.use: to purchase a gas stove.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 34 years old and lives in the town of Msambweni in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past three years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells charcoal.

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 25,000 Kenya Shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale, and will help her to generate greater profits and open up more businesses. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 35 year-old married woman who lives in the village of Mwambalazi, in the coastal region of Kenya. She sells goats at the market, a business which she has operated for six years. She is married to Musyoka but they have not yet been blessed with any child.
Joice is requesting a loan in the amount of Ksh 40,000 to purchase eight goats for sale. She hopes to earn some more profits out of it and be able to expand the business and open a retail shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase eight goats for sale.

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en: Goreth is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She has a business of frying and selling crisps, roasted ground nuts, hard corn and sim -sim. She has been in this business for five years. She generates additional income through selling bread. She supplies her produce to supermarkets in and around Kampala.  She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of ground nuts, Irish potatoes sim-sim and cooking oil.  She would like to own a big store so that she can keep her produce and employ two people to assist in frying. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags for frying crisps, roasted ground nuts, hard corn and sim-sim.

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en: Salomey is a 33 year-old fish seller.  She is married and has one child who is two years old. She lives with her family in Teshie community. This is her 4th loan cycle. She needs 900 Ghana cedis so she can buy more fish. The fish business is good in Ghana since almost everybody uses it one way or another. She has been selling fish for the past 7 years. She wants to be a major stakeholder in the fishing supplying business. She needs your help to be able to do a good business.

loans.use: To be able to meet customer demands.

loans.name: Guillermo Felix

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 49 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, especialmente se cultiva el algodón, la uva, esparrago, entre otros, podemos encontrar también lugares turísticos como lo es la linda “Laguna e Huacachina”, ubicada en medio de Dunas impresionantes y en las cuales se puede practicar deportes de aventura como el sanboard. Guillermo en su tiempo libre le gusta mucho arreglar cosas, ya que lo distrae mucho, también en ocasione le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “seco de Cabrito”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Guillermo trabaja muy duro en su negocio chofer de mototaxi, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo el puedo solventar los gastos de su hogar y poder salir adelante, Guillermo trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; él cree que el va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo amable con los clientes.

Guillermo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado terminara de construir su vivienda, de esta manera podrá tener una vivienda segura y sobre todo podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un taller de mecánica”.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 49 years old. He lives in the city of Ica, a city known for its very warm and friendly climate. As a result of the climate, there is lots of agriculture in the area. Specifically, cotton, grapes, and asparagus, among other crops, are cultivated here. We can also find tourist spots, such as the beautiful Laguna de Huacachina, which is located in the middle of impressive dunes where adventure sports such as sandboarding are popular. In his free time, Guillermo likes to fix things, since it distracts him. Additionally, on occasion he likes to eat one of his favorite delicious dishes, goat stew. Due to his limited economic resources, he only studied until the final year of high school, but he would have liked to study in a university.

From day to day, Guillermo works very hard as a rickshaw taxi driver, since his earnings help him to be able to cover his household costs and to get ahead. Guillermo works around eight hours a day and is able to help up to twenty customers daily. He believes that his business is going well because he is very responsible and, above all, kind to his customers.

Guillermo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have provided him, he will finish building his house. As a result, he will be able to have a safe home, and, more importantly, he will be able to continue working to be able to realize his biggest dream: “Have a workshop.”

loans.use: To improve his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes in larger quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Lissette

texts.en:
Lissette, the mother of three children, lives with them and their father, her long-term partner, and a niece. Since they are living in a deteriorating house, she is requesting her eighth loan, this one to improve the situation by purchasing materials to start building her house's walls, which she will change from wood to concrete block.

Lissete is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs who came to the organization almost four years ago for a loan to expand her business, a beauty salon which produces income she uses to help her family, reinvest, and make loan repayments. She lives in a slum area in the north of Santo Domingo.

Esperanza Internacional is running a program in which most of its clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show reliability in their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure while implementing their business loans and attending group meetings.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, cement and other materials.

loans.name: Randy David

texts.es: Randi un joven de 24 años de edad, aficionado a los video-juegos, hace 2 años, decidió generar sus propios ingresos mediante el montaje de una sala de video juegos, dirigida a generar entretenimiento a las nuevas generaciones; hoy  ha logrado consolidar una pequeña clientela, donde jóvenes y niños son sus principales clientes. Diariamente desde las 8:30 de la mañana hasta las 9:30 de la noche,  está dedicado a este negocio, que día a día le produce mas satisfacciones, pues genera ingresos  e identifica en el un importante potencial de crecimiento al cual quiere llegar. Randi se mantiene actualidad y por eso en su oferta están los mas modernos y actualizados videos y juegos, por eso su clientela es cada vez mayor. Su desafío actual es lograr un capital de trabajo que le permita innovar y fortalecer aun mas su clientela; esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual  comprara1 in box, un play Station y 2 canales de video juegos. Con su inversión credikiva, logrará actualizar su oferta y brindarle a su clientela, oportunidades de acceso a juegos modernos, que harán de jóvenes y niños su máxima diversión, mientras Randy continua aumentando sus ingresos.
texts.en: Randy, a young man of 24, is a fan of video games. Two years ago, he decided to generate his own income by setting up a hall for video games, directed to generating entertainment for the new generations. Today he has succeeded in solidifying a small customer base, where youths and children are his principal customers. Every day from 8:30 in the morning until 9:30 at night, he works at his business, which every day produces more satisfaction for him, since it generates income and he identifies in it an important potential for growth that he want to reach. Randy keeps up-to-date, and for this reason his offerings are the most modern and up-to-date videos and games, and so his clientele continues to grow. His present challenge is to obtain working capital to permit him to innovate and strengthen his customer base even more. This is exactly the reason why he has turned to a Kiva loan, which will be his first financing through Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and which he will use to buy an Xbox, a Play Station, and two channels of video games. With the investment of his Kiva loan, he will update his offerings and offer his customers opportunities to access modern games, which are the most fun for youths and children, while Randy continues to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy an Xbox, a Play Station, and two channels of video games.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
	Mr  Mamadou est  à quelques kilomètres de l’IMF, marié et père de famille il vit avec ses frères et sa famille. Mr Mamadou  participe aux dépenses quotidiennes  de la maison, il évolue dans le commerce et  a été encadré par son frère depuis son enfance pour  exceller dans ce domaine 
Il achète du mil pour ensuite le revendre sur le marché, ayant une très grande expérience à la vente Mr  Mamadou  veut diversifier ses produits et pour cela il veut  acheter 200 sacs de foin , de  ce fait il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 f remboursable en 12 mois dont un différé,avec le bénéfice qu’il aura il compte épargner une partie et le reste aider la famille, il est à son troisième prêt  à l’IMF
Mr Mamadou veut un jour voir son fond de commerce très  renforcé  pour pouvoir approvisionner un magasin non exploité.
texts.en:
Mamadou lives a few kilometres from the MFI; married and a father, he lives with his brothers as well as his family. Mamadou contributes to the household's daily expenses; he is a businessman and has been trained since childhood by his brother to excel in this activity. He buys meal to resell in the market. Having a solid experience in sales, Mamadou wants to diversify his offering and therefore he wants to buy 200 bags of hay - for this he is requesting a 500,000 Franc loan over twelve months (with one deferred). With the profits generated, he plans to save some and to help his family with the balance.
This is his third loan from the MFI. Mamadou hopes one day to gather enough capital to be able to stock a currently unused shop.

loans.use: to buy 200 bags of hay to sell at the market.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a resident of Malindi, in Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has nine children. Zawadi has owned and operated a grocery shop for four years.

Zawadi learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Zawadi's main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, seasonal weather and taxes.

Zawadi is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase iron sheets for building her grocery shop and renovating it. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her child. Zawadi hopes to open a wholesale grocery shop and become a supplier of her products in the future.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets for building her grocery shop and renovating it.

loans.name: Dame

texts.fr: 	Mr Dame est domicilié à environ 16 km de la ville principale, il est marié et père de famille.IL exerce le métier de commerce depuis plus de 10 ans, il achète des choux pour les revendre à Dakar.IL consacre tout son temps au travail en commençant sa journée à 8 h pour la finir à 21 h. Mr Dame a eu à contracté 3 prêts au niveau de l’IMF et il a toujours respecté ses engagement vis-à-vis de l institution.IL demande un crédit de  300 000 f remboursable en 12 mois ,le bénéfice qui aura issu de ces ventes lui permettra de prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes et d’épargner. Mr  Dame veut renforcer à l’avenir son fond de roulement pour mieux s’investir dans le maraichage.
texts.en:
Dame is based about 16 km from the main town, he is married and a father. He has worked as a trader for over ten years - he buys cabbages in order to resell them in Dakar. He gives up all his time for work - starting his day at 8am and finishing at 9pm. Dame has had three previous loans with the institution, and he has always respected his commitments to them.
He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs repayable over 12 months.
The profits that will be generated from these sales will allow him to cover his daily living expenses and to have some savings. In the future, Dame wants to grow his working capital in order to invest further into market gardening.

loans.use: to buy cabbages for resale in Dakar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings
